column4: >We are a group of nine undergraduate students, all part of a leadership organization called Sigma Chi Fraternity, Lambda Theta chapter of the University of Ottawa (uOttawa).

>The goal of our Toys 4 Joy fundraising campaign is to make a difference in the lives of others by enhancing the holiday experience for children and youths living with cancer. Throughout our lives thus far, we have been taught that we can choose our life path, that we should strive to be all that we can be. This is our way of beginning that journey. We are fundraising to purchase Christmas gifts for the children and youth on the cancer ward of the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO). With the money we raise, we hope to brighten up their Christmas stay in the hospital. We are very proud to have the blessing of the CHEO Foundation and of Santa! These gifts will be for them all to use based on a “wish list” that the Hospital has provided us as a guide. We will wrap and deliver in time for Santa’s sleigh on December 24th.
>The Sigma Chi Fraternity at uOttawa has been active in organizing numerous philanthropic events throughout the Ottawa community. Some of these include:
>Homeless for the Homeless: brothers of the fraternity stayed and slept outside on the University campus in the winter for several nights to raise money for the homeless. We raised over $5000.
>2011 Derby Days: fundraiser for the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO): Sigma Chi Fraternity raised over $7000.
>Help us make a real difference this Christmas. We need your help!  Join our team and help spread the Christmas spirit!

column4:
>With the help of your generous donations, we can give these children and youth at the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) a Christmas to remember. We can show them through the stresses and pains of their daily lives, that a world of happiness and generosity is out there and that we are always thinking of them. 

We will ensure the monies raised during this campaign go a long way and will find creative ways to brings as much value as we can to the gift-buying and gift-giving. No donation amount is too small, and we appreciate every single one.  Their JOY on Christmas morning from the TOYS they receive are our ultimate goal!  We thank you in advance on behalf of the CHEO kids!

column1: Notre histoire
Nous sommes un groupe de neuf étudiants (premier cycle), tous faisant partie d’une fraternité nommée Sigma Chi Fraternity Lambda Theta, chapitre de l’université d’Ottawa (uOttawa)

Le but de notre campagne de financement ‘Toys 4 Joy’, est de faire une différence dans la vie des autres, en améliorant l’expérience de Noel pour les jeunes atteints de cancer. Nous avons appris, tout au long de notre vie, qu’on doit choisir un chemin
column2: que nous devons être le meilleur de nous-mêmes. Cet effort marque le début d’une mission.

column1: Nous faisons une levée de fonds pour offrir des cadeaux de noël aux jeunes qui passeront leur noël à l’étage du cancer, de CHEO. Nous espérons embellir leur séjour de Noel à l’hôpital. Nous sommes fiers d’avoir l’approbation de la fondation CHEO, et celle du père noël! Ces cadeaux seront offerts à partir d’une liste de souhaits que l’hôpital nous a donnée comme guide. Nous emballerons les cadeaux, et nous irons les livrer pour le 24 décembre.

column2: >La fraternité Sigma Chi d’Ottawa est active dans l’organisation d’événements philanthropiques dans la communauté d’Ottawa, dont :

column1: ‘Homeless for the Homeless’: Les membres de la fraternité ont vécus dehors, sur le campus de l’université pendant l’hiver, afin de faire une levée de fonds pour les sans-abris. Nous avons amassé plus de 5,000 $.
‘2011 Derby Days’: levee de fonds pour le CHEO: la fraternité Sigma Chi a collectionné plus de 7,000$.
Aidez- nous à faire une différence pour Noel. Nous avons besoin de votre aide afin de partager l’esprit des fêtes.

column3: >Voici ce que nous recherchons:

>L'objectif de la campagne de financement Toys 4 Joy est d'amasser 5000 $. Chaque contribution compte vers notre objectif, et chaque don est accepté avec reconnaissance. Toute contribution de 5$ ou plus méritera mention sur notre site. Les cadeaux seront livrés avec une carte avec tous les noms des contributeurs.

column4: >Avec votre aide, nous pouvons offrir à ces jeunes de l’hôpital Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO), un noël avec de beaux souvenirs. Nous pouvons démontrer, qu’à travers le stress et la douleur de leur vie quotidienne, il existe un monde généreux et joyeux, et qu’ils ne sont pas oubliés.

>L’argent amassé sera utilisé sagement, et nous tenterons de trouver des méthodes créatives afin de s’assurer qu’elle aille loin en ce qui concerne l’achat des cadeaux. Nous ne refusons aucun don – aucune somme n’est trop petite. La joie que ces argents répandra est notre seul objectif. Nous vous remercions d’avance, au nom des enfants du CHEO, pour votre généreuse contribution.

column1: Les autres façons de nous aider

column3: >DIWO – ‘’Do it with others’’ – faites-le avec d’autres, c’est la seule façon.  Aidez-vous en informant les autres.  Trouvez nous sur ‘’Facebook’’ (Toys 4 Joy).  Le plus que vous informerez les autres, le plus qu’on verra de participation et de dons vers notre projet.  Le plus de dons, le plus de jouets, le plus de joie que nous apporterons aux jeunes malades.

>Simple? Tu parles! Dites à vos amis, vos voisins, vos professeurs! Dites à vos mères, pères, frères, sœurs, oncles, tantes et grands-parents! Dites à toute personne qui cherche à apporter de la joie de Noël à l'autre cela.
>Nous vous remercions.

column1: ","Our Story
We are a group of nine undergraduate students, all part of a leadership organization called Sigma Chi Fraternity, Lambda Theta chapter of the University of Ottawa (uOttawa).

The goal of our Toys 4 Joy fundraising campaign is to make a difference in the lives of others by enhancing the holiday experience for children and youths living with cancer. Throughout our lives thus far, we have been taught that we can choose our life path, that we should strive to be all that we can be. This is our way of beginning that journey. We are fundraising to purchase Christmas gifts for the children and youth on the cancer ward of the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO). With the money we raise, we hope to brighten up their Christmas stay in the hospital. We are very proud to have the blessing of the CHEO Foundation and of Santa! These gifts will be for them all to use based on a “wish list” that the Hospital has provided us as a guide. We will wrap and deliver in time for Santa’s sleigh on December 24th.
The Sigma Chi Fraternity at uOttawa has been active in organizing numerous philanthropic events throughout the Ottawa community. Some of these include:
Homeless for the Homeless: brothers of the fraternity stayed and slept outside on the University campus in the winter for several nights to raise money for the homeless. We raised over $5000.
2011 Derby Days: fundraiser for the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO): Sigma Chi Fraternity raised over $7000.
Help us make a real difference this Christmas. We need your help!  Join our team and help spread the Christmas spirit!
What We Need & What You Get

The goal of the Toys 4 Joy fundraising campaign is to raise $5000. Every $$ counts toward our goal and each and every donation is gratefully accepted and appreciated. Everyone who donates $5 or more will have their name and donation listed on this site as a testament of your generosity and as a symbol of our thanks. When our gifts finally arrive at their destination, the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) will receive a Christmas card accompanying the gifts with all your names listed so your contributions are recognized! As a special added benefit, all donors may experience a “warm and fuzzy” feeling of good-will that comes when making a difference in the life of another in need.
The Impact

With the help of your generous donations, we can give these children and youth at the Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO) a Christmas to remember. We can show them through the stresses and pains of their daily lives, that a world of happiness and generosity is out there and that we are always thinking of them. We will ensure the monies raised during this campaign go a long way and will find creative ways to brings as much value as we can to the gift-buying and gift-giving. No donation amount is too small, and we appreciate every single one.  Their JOY on Christmas morning from the TOYS they receive are our ultimate goal!  We thank you in advance on behalf of the CHEO kids!
Other Ways You Can Help

UNLEASH THE DIWO! “Do It With Others” is the only way! HELP us by spreading the spirit of TOYS 4 JOY! LIKE us and SHARE us here, there and everywhere! Find us on Facebook. The MORE you SHARE the more $$ we raise, the more TOYS we buy, the more JOY we bring. Simple? You bet! Tell your friends, your neighbours, your teachers! Tell your mothers, fathers, brothers, sisters, uncles, aunts and grandparents! Tell anyone who is looking to bring joy to another this Christmas. We thank you.

L’Impact

Avec votre aide, nous pouvons offrir à ces jeunes de l’hôpital Children’s Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO), un noël avec de beaux souvenirs. Nous pouvons démontrer, qu’à travers le stress et la douleur de leur vie quotidienne, il existe un monde généreux et joyeux, et qu’ils ne sont pas oubliés.

L’argent amassé sera utilisé sagement, et nous tenterons de trouver des méthodes créatives afin de s’assurer qu’elle aille loin en ce qui concerne l’achat des cadeaux. Nous ne refusons aucun don – aucune somme n’est trop petite. La joie que ces argents répandra est notre seul objectif. Nous vous remercions d’avance, au nom des enfants du CHEO, pour votre généreuse contribution.
Les autres façons de nous aider

DIWO – ‘’Do it with others’’ – faites-le avec d’autres, c’est la seule façon.  Aidez-vous en informant les autres.  Trouvez nous sur ‘’Facebook’’ (Toys 4 Joy).  Le plus que vous informerez les autres, le plus qu’on verra de participation et de dons vers notre projet.  Le plus de dons, le plus de jouets, le plus de joie que nous apporterons aux jeunes malades.

Committed to all forms of justice, La Union is an organization based out of Sunset Park, Brooklyn that has established a significant record of advancement of social, economic, and cultural rights of immigrants from Latin America.

In collaboration with other non-profit organizations including Brandworkers, Centro de Inmigrante-Staten Island, La Union is currently organizing to assist those families who were left most vulnerable by Hurricane Sandy: immigrants. Thousands of immigrants in the coastal areas including Coney Island, the Far Rockaways and Staten Island were completely devastated by the impact of Sandy.  Unfortunately, thousands of immigrants will be left without institutional aid due to discrimination, language, complexities associated with filing claims, distrust of government institutions, legal status, etc.  Without any aid, it will be extremely difficult to recover.

This reoccurring project allows contributors to put funds and resources directly into the hands of immigrant families to be used for needs ranging from blankets and heaters to unemployment assistance.  Many are without housing and are living in extremely crowded conditions with little economic resources or have remained in hazardous environmental conditions with no funds to rid their homes or mildew and mold, or find other housing.

This initiative is a long-term recovery project and will reoccur after the attainment of each $10,000 goal. It will continue to run until the need and/or contributions cease. 100% of monies raised will go directly into the hands of immigrant families.

If you are unable to donate money at this time but understand the importance of this initiative, please share our campaign with EVERYONE: friends, families, acquaintances, EVERYONE! Also, do contact La Union for non-monetary ways to contribute.

column2: >Rhondalyn Magin was Diagnosed with Familialpolyposis (Precancerous polypls on the colon and Stomach). From 1984-2005 she has had 6 dozen major surgeries. Her last surgery was in 2006, when she was reffered to Cleveland Clinic for Kock Continent Ileostomy, which was the most newest surgery to help her with her constant Ostomy  prolapses. This surgery was a total sucess for 6 years. Unfortunately, she has to travel back to Cleveland to have the Kock Pouch surgery again. This has to be done not only to improve her quality of life  , but also medically necessary or her life would be in danger due to life threatening complications.
>The goal for this is to raise funds to assist Rhondalyn with Living, and traveling expenses during this trying time. She will be laid up for a couple of months.

>Please if you can help with anything it would be greatly appreciated!

column1: Rhondalyn Magin was Diagnosed with Familialpolyposis (Precancerous polypls on the colon and Stomach). From 1984-2005 she has had 6 dozen major surgeries. Her last surgery was in 2006, when she was reffered to Cleveland Clinic for Kock Continent Ileostomy, which was the most newest surgery to help her with her constant Ostomy  prolapses. This surgery was a total sucess for 6 years. Unfortunately, she has to travel back to Cleveland to have the Kock Pouch surgery again. This has to be done not only to improve her quality of life  , but also medically necessary or her life would be in danger due to life threatening complications.
The goal for this is to raise funds to assist Rhondalyn with Living, and traveling expenses during this trying time. She will be laid up for a couple of months.

My name is Christina Johnson and I am the proud mother of two wonderful children, our son Jose, who is 3 and our daughter Aurora, who just turned 1 year old. Their father and I live in Newark NJ.

In February of 2010, I  suffered a sever spinal injury while on the job as a CNA. Little did we know, that at the time, I was about 2 weeks pregnant with our daughter. Because of the pregnancy, I was unable to have an MRI until my 6th month. I continued working, while experiencing sever pain in my back and legs. I was told by my superiors that my pain was due to my pregnancy, and without an MRI there was no proof of injury. In July of that year, I finally collapsed at work, losing control of my legs and bladder. By the time I was able to have and MRI performed, I had lost COMPLETE control of my bladder and was wearing diapers. Shortly after the MRI, which showed 1 herniated and two bulging discs, my surgeon performed an emergency microdiscectomy to prevent permanent nerve damage or paralysis. I was 6 months pregnant at the time.

After the birth of our beautiful daughter, my symptoms returned, loss of bladder and leg control. Another MRI showed that the disc had herniated again and the other two were bulging. Once again, to prevent permanent nerve damage, I was on the operating table within a week, this time recieving a Spinal Fusion of the L5-S1 vertebrae. My surgery was performed in April.

During all this time, I lost my insurance through my job, and was only recieving $247 a week. Because I was unable to care for our children, my fiance, Sobral, stayed home to take care of us all. We were forced to move to a cheaper apartment in Dec of 2011, before my second surgery.
After the second surgery, and while still on medical leave, I was fired from my job with no explanation given, just a letter in the mail this past July.
With all of this going on, and probably due to stress, a mass started growing in my throat. It has doubled in size this past year, and another was found in my uterus.

Because I am recieving workers compensation, $247 a week, I do not qualify for Health Insurance, or Financial Aid. I cannot file for disability while still in treatment, and although I will eventually recieve a settlement from the Workers Comp Insurance Company, we are in desperate need of funds now.
My workers comp does not even amount to our rent, and despite calls to congressmen and legislators, no one seems to know what to do.
We are asking our friends and family and anyone who reads this to help us out, even just by spreading the word, and telling our story.

I need 2 seperate biopses, one for my throat, and the other for the mass in my uterus. I survived cervical cancer years ago, so our fear is that we could be in for another fight. And as a mother, I know I can't lay down and give up, but we are afraid of losing our home, and I am afraid of losing my health.
We don't have much to give, but for anyone who donates, I will, if you would like, knit a hat or a scarf for you or a loved one.
God Bless, and PLEASE, share our story

column1: villages of Southern Rajasthan in India, many people do not have access to
public hospitals and doctors. The lack of care is especially dangerous for
pregnant women and infants, when basic medical care can make an outsize difference
to the health of mother and child.  Our
400 maternal and infant health workers, who are all from the 150 villages they
serve, are trained to provide vital health services and create a bridge between
rural communities and the public health system.
Every year they oversee 4,000 safe deliveries and guide over
2,000 mothers through the first year of their child’s life, significantly
reducing infant mortality and malnourishment.
salaries, and medical supplies for our 400 maternal and infant health workers,
benefitting over 6,000 mothers and children per year.  A little goes a long way in rural India – just look at the numbers at right.
examining a patient, 8 months pregnant

column2: ><i>Infant health worker Pinki weighing a child as part of

column1: a regular check-up
gloves, an apron, and a mask.

column3:
>


          

Seva Mandir (www.sevamandir.org) has been working in rural Rajasthan for the past 45

column1: years.  We currently work with 360,000
people in 700 of the world’s most impoverished communities where people live on
an average of $0.35 a day. We
take a holistic approach to community development.  Our programs provide critical maternal and
infant health services, ensure families have clean drinking water and can grow
enough food to eat, offer disadvantaged students a quality preschool and
primary education, empower women, and strengthen participation in village level
democracy.  We place paramount
importance, in keeping with Gandhian ideals, on enabling common citizens to
assume responsibility for development work in their community and take
ownership over building a better life for themselves.
Seva
Mandir has an annual budget of $3.2 million, 250 full time employees, another
1,000 part-time employees who live in its partner villages, and has received
recognition and funding from some of the world’s top organizations such as the
Ford Foundation, MacArthur Foundation and the World Bank.
Friends of Seva Mandir, Inc. (www.friendsofsevamandir.org) is a U.S.
501(c)(3) charitable organization.  It
makes grants  to support Seva Mandir’s programs in India. Contributions from
U.S. taxpayers to Friends of Seva Mandir, Inc. are deductible for  U.S. tax
purposes.
villages, there is a lack of education and awareness surrounding the care
needed during and after pregnancy.  This
is compounded by the prohibitive distance to most government medical
facilities, cultural norms that make it hard for women to talk openly about
their body and pregnancy, and by institutionalized discrimination against
tribal women. As a result, home deliveries by untrained local women are common,
leading to enormously increased risk to both mother and child.  After birth, there is little postnatal care,
even though most maternal deaths happen in the postnatal period, and an equally
huge lack of knowledge surrounding proper breastfeeding, nutrition, and
immunization regimes that are essential to getting a healthy start in
life.  For example, a survey of Seva Mandir’s partner villages by M.I.T.’s Jameel Poverty Action Lab found that 75%
of children were anemic and only 19% were fully immunized.
training, medical equipment, stipends and supervision to over 300 traditional
birth attendants from our partner villages.
In the 152 villages where these women live and work, they remain the
primary providers of maternal healthcare.
They perform home visits to women throughout their pregnancy, accompany
them to receive antenatal immunizations, encourage women to deliver at
hospitals and advocate for them there, and can recognize complications and
refer women when necessary.  Where
institutional delivery is not an option, our health workers conduct hygienic
and safe home deliveries using medical kits supplied by Seva Mandir.
our 100 infant health workers counsel mothers on critical aspects of newborn
care including breastfeeding, weaning and appropriate nutrition.  They also chart child growth, refer serious
cases of malnutrition to hospitals, and link mothers to Seva Mandir’s
immunization camps (called “
column2: >the most impressive we have ever evaluated, and probably the one that has saved most lives
column3: >” by poverty researchers and M.I.T. professors Abhijit Banerjee

column1: and Esther Duflo).  Because our
health workers are from the communities they serve, they are able to establish
strong and trusting relationships with their patients, and greatly influence
their behavior in terms of seeking preventative healthcare.  The acceptance and success of our health
workers is reinforced by our decades-long relationships with villages on
all-around village development.

column3: ><b>Pinki Devi, one of our infant health workers, lives and works in a village

column1: called Kochla.
She recently went to visit a new-born girl, and during her check-up
found that the girl was in the lowest weight grade in her age-growth monitoring
chart.  Pinki discussed and explored the
reasons behind the girl’s poor health with the mother, and counseled her on the importance of exclusive breastfeeding and of keeping the child
warm using a baby warmer (pictured below). Pinki Devi then followed up with regular
home visits to monitor the child’s health. After one month, the child’s weight
increased to 2.8 kgs. This improvement helped boost the morale of the mother
and she began to religiously followed Pinki’s advice. By the end of the second month the child’s weight was 3.5 kgs,
and had increased to 4.5kgs by the end of the third month. The family credits
and thanks Pinki for their child’s healthy recovery from a weak start.
Pinki demonstrating the baby warmer for a family.  The basic medical knowledge offered by the infant health workers can make an outsize difference in the remote villages that Seva Mandir serves.

","In the remote
villages of Southern Rajasthan in India, many people do not have access to
public hospitals and doctors. The lack of care is especially dangerous for
pregnant women and infants, when basic medical care can make an outsize difference
to the health of mother and child.  Our
400 maternal and infant health workers, who are all from the 150 villages they
serve, are trained to provide vital health services and create a bridge between
rural communities and the public health system.
Every year they oversee 4,000 safe deliveries and guide over
2,000 mothers through the first year of their child’s life, significantly
reducing infant mortality and malnourishment.
Your donation will directly support training,
salaries, and medical supplies for our 400 maternal and infant health workers,
benefitting over 6,000 mothers and children per year.  A little goes a long way in rural India – just look at the numbers at right.
Maternal health worker Ganga Bai
examining a patient, 8 months pregnant
Infant health worker Pinki weighing a child as part of
a regular check-up
Maternal health workers’ kits include medicines,
gloves, an apron, and a mask.
Seva Mandir (www.sevamandir.org) has been working in rural Rajasthan for the past 45
years.  We currently work with 360,000
people in 700 of the world’s most impoverished communities where people live on
an average of $0.35 a day. We
take a holistic approach to community development.  Our programs provide critical maternal and
infant health services, ensure families have clean drinking water and can grow
enough food to eat, offer disadvantaged students a quality preschool and
primary education, empower women, and strengthen participation in village level
democracy.  We place paramount
importance, in keeping with Gandhian ideals, on enabling common citizens to
assume responsibility for development work in their community and take
ownership over building a better life for themselves.
Seva
Mandir has an annual budget of $3.2 million, 250 full time employees, another
1,000 part-time employees who live in its partner villages, and has received
recognition and funding from some of the world’s top organizations such as the
Ford Foundation, MacArthur Foundation and the World Bank.
Friends of Seva Mandir, Inc. (www.friendsofsevamandir.org) is a U.S.
501(c)(3) charitable organization.  It
makes grants  to support Seva Mandir’s programs in India. Contributions from
U.S. taxpayers to Friends of Seva Mandir, Inc. are deductible for  U.S. tax
purposes.
NEED
In remote
villages, there is a lack of education and awareness surrounding the care
needed during and after pregnancy.  This
is compounded by the prohibitive distance to most government medical
facilities, cultural norms that make it hard for women to talk openly about
their body and pregnancy, and by institutionalized discrimination against
tribal women. As a result, home deliveries by untrained local women are common,
leading to enormously increased risk to both mother and child.  After birth, there is little postnatal care,
even though most maternal deaths happen in the postnatal period, and an equally
huge lack of knowledge surrounding proper breastfeeding, nutrition, and
immunization regimes that are essential to getting a healthy start in
life.  For example, a survey of Seva Mandir’s partner villages by M.I.T.’s Jameel Poverty Action Lab found that 75%
of children were anemic and only 19% were fully immunized. OUR RESPONSEMaternal Health Workers: We provide
training, medical equipment, stipends and supervision to over 300 traditional
birth attendants from our partner villages.
In the 152 villages where these women live and work, they remain the
primary providers of maternal healthcare.
They perform home visits to women throughout their pregnancy, accompany
them to receive antenatal immunizations, encourage women to deliver at
hospitals and advocate for them there, and can recognize complications and
refer women when necessary.  Where
institutional delivery is not an option, our health workers conduct hygienic
and safe home deliveries using medical kits supplied by Seva Mandir. Infant Health Workers: After birth,
our 100 infant health workers counsel mothers on critical aspects of newborn
care including breastfeeding, weaning and appropriate nutrition.  They also chart child growth, refer serious
cases of malnutrition to hospitals, and link mothers to Seva Mandir’s
immunization camps (called “the most impressive we have ever evaluated, and probably the one that has saved most lives” by poverty researchers and M.I.T. professors Abhijit Banerjee
and Esther Duflo).  Because our
health workers are from the communities they serve, they are able to establish
strong and trusting relationships with their patients, and greatly influence
their behavior in terms of seeking preventative healthcare.  The acceptance and success of our health
workers is reinforced by our decades-long relationships with villages on
all-around village development.       OUR IMPACT, 2012-13
Our
323 maternal health workers provided ante- and postnatal care for over 4,000 women
Our maternal health workers did more than 2,000 hygienic and safe home deliveries,
and have significantly increased the percentage of safe deliveries in our partner
villages
Our infant
health workers gave 2,000 mothers and newborns counseling and preventative
care throughout the first year of life
This has
resulted in decreased child malnourishment and higher child immunization rates in
our work area
Pinki Devi, one of our infant health workers, lives and works in a village
called Kochla.
She recently went to visit a new-born girl, and during her check-up
found that the girl was in the lowest weight grade in her age-growth monitoring
chart.  Pinki discussed and explored the
reasons behind the girl’s poor health with the mother, and counseled her on the importance of exclusive breastfeeding and of keeping the child
warm using a baby warmer (pictured below). Pinki Devi then followed up with regular
home visits to monitor the child’s health. After one month, the child’s weight
increased to 2.8 kgs. This improvement helped boost the morale of the mother
and she began to religiously followed Pinki’s advice. By the end of the second month the child’s weight was 3.5 kgs,
and had increased to 4.5kgs by the end of the third month. The family credits
and thanks Pinki for their child’s healthy recovery from a weak start.
Pinki demonstrating the baby warmer for a family.  The basic medical knowledge offered by the infant health workers can make an outsize difference in the remote villages that Seva Mandir serves.

 Hi we're Megan and Justin and this is our story.
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >All  we have ever wanted was to be parents. I never could help but think we were being punished for something. I always imagined as a little girl that I was going to have a huge family. That I would treat and love my children unconditionally, I never imagined all the pain I would feel not being able to carry, raise, and watch my child grow. I have suffered many different kinds of pain, but I would have to say this is the biggest yet. It’s hard to explain to another woman the pain that one carries with them. The pain of never getting the chance to pee on a stick, to make the phone call to your spouse, to feel the baby’s first kick, to show off the ultrasound, to find out the sex of your child, to spend countless hours arguing over names, to dream about how you would raise your child and what you hope they become. It’s hard to hang out with other mothers and listen to their stories of long hours of Labor, or can you believe my child did this. When all the stories you have our about work and pets. It’s easy to fit in when your problems are normal everyday issues, But when you sit back and desire a child and all your friends and family are getting theirs, It’s hard not to be angry,sad, resentful,and stand offish. Some people think your mad about them having a baby and others don't want to tell you they're pregnant because they don't want to upset you.In reality, your just a woman who desires something so strong it hurts to watch others be so happy.

column1:
We started trying for a baby back in 2008, we got pregnant right away, but miscarried at 7 weeks. After 2 failed IUI's, we got pregnant naturally, but again miscarried at 12 weeks. My husband has had surgery to try to improve his fertility but nothing seems to work for us. So now I'm trying to raise money to do a third IUI, with a donor.
If you help fund us, PLEASE know that you have helped a couple who has tried everything else that was affordable. We need help raising the money, I need to know and feel that I have tried everything in my power, to make my dream come true. Please find it in your heart to help. Thank You for reading our story.

Short Summary

On Thanksgiving evening, 2012, Amber Chandler was driving her kids home from a family dinner when she was involved in a horrible accident.  Her 2 daughters, ages 7 and 6, had to be airlifted, spent many days in ICU and experienced many surgeries.  Amber and her 5 year old son were admitted to the hospital with significant injuries as well.  The girls, especially, have a very long road ahead of them with substantial injuries that will require ongoing care and numerous surgeries.  The seven year old daughter will be in a wheelchair for the forseeable future.  The six year old girl has a nephrostomy bag and a urostomy bag and will require numerous surgeries to (hopefully) repair the extensive damage.  The entire family will need to process the events of that evening and learn how to live their lifes outside of the hospital.  This will, undoubtedly, have huge mental and financial impacts to the whole family.
<div>
What We Need and The Impact

Funds are needed to support the Chandler family in their recovery.  Amber and the children will have extensive medical bills.  Their house will need to altered to accommodate a wheelchair.  The wheelchair needs to be purchased/rented.  Nursing help will be needed.  Amber's car will need to be replaced.  YOU can help this family feel normal and safe once again!  Every penny helps!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
You can also stop in to any 5/3 branch and donate to the ""Amber Chandler's Kids benefit account"" if that is easier!

We appreciate your support of this wonderful family more than you know!

Going The Distance (GTD) is a book about developing a functional body, a healthy mind set and an intelligent approach to deal with changes that occur in your body and in your life. GTD addresses the essential foundational issues in any movement routine

Although the core of the book deals with a substantial amount of exercise science specifics, it also confronts the very real issues of loss and change that are part of the maturing process for all of us.

The spirit of Alexander Pope's words, ""Hope Springs Eternal"" flows through the pages of GTD. It is not a dry narrative or a list of how to's on the most radical exercises I could choose, instead it's an interactive book about building a balanced and durable body and spirit, starting at the foundational level.
<div>

Fitness and movement have been my primary tools to heal, connect and make a meaningful difference in people's lives since I was a kid. GTD meets the reader wherever they are at on their own journey to smarter fitness and better health and wellness. The simple but transformational message is as important and relevant for elite athletes as its for people who are trying to just get going in a way that is logical and safe.
The secret to achieving any goal is no secret at all, it's actually visible everywhere you look in nature. Mountains, rivers, oceans, deserts, the human body
column2: the most profound changes generally occur in small increments, often over a significant period of time. I first learned this lesson from the men who helped raise me when my father died very young. I have continued to learn and experience this truth as I have walked, climbed, ran, swam, paddled and recreated in some of the most precious goelogical settings on the planet. This steady, and gradually progressive approach is the way I manage my own health and fitness and is at the center of the recipe I lay out in GTD.

column1: My aim is for GTD to be an extension of my hand, heart and my life's message to you and to people all over the world.  An encouraging tone, a focus on proximal steps, and most importantly, a book that honors that fact that the first step in any pursuit is often most difficult to take.

The video below, shot by my dear friend and environmentalist Peggy Peattie (who also shot the primary video for this campaign), shows just how important and how far I am willing to go to get my message of small steps and fitness as an integral part of mental health, out to the world.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8XYJy95tG1k
<div>

Wether you choose to formally ""join the team"" by contributing to this campaign or just think good thoughts, maybe tell a friend, repost, or say a prayer, believing it has already been answered, you are part of The GTD Team. Your support matters a great deal and will make a meaningful difference.
I welcome to you visit my site and read my blogs to get a broader picture of my mission to educate and inspire.
http://monumentalresults.com/blogs/
http://monumentalresults.com
Thank you for considering helping me advance my personal and professional goal of serving as a contemporary Jack Lalanne to our nation. Your partnership on this venture will help create that reality.
Stay Well and Stay Young, Coach Cris

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Short Summary

Ow! This really hurts. I repeat: Ow! Hopefully, I will be able to recover fully in a couple of months. I have finally earned my own business location and, as much as I hate to ask, would like to get back to serving my clients and community as soon as possible. I'm not looking to make a profit, just to pay my basic bills and keep my salon. I believe in my friends and family, good Pearland people, and no matter what happens, I'm going to make it.  I've been involved in these types of programs in support of some of my other friends, and I know how fulfilling it is to be able to help your friends when they need it.

This was an emergency surgery, which, to my understanding, was necessary to keep me from becoming paralyzed! I was unprepared for this, but I have already been blessed with help from my husband and my grandkids! Even though it was a terrible inconvenience, I can't tell you how much of a relief it is to know that I should not be experiencing anymore numbness in my hands and feet. Praise the Lord!

Furthermore, I feel so blessed, again, to be working with my current landlords who have offered to help me during this tough time with helping me with rent structure and prayers. There is quite a bit working in my favor, but there are still needs that must be met.
So, here's where the money will go over the next two months (anticipated recupertation time):
1. Salon rental @ $205/week
2. Car payment @ $389/month
3. Light bill @ $130/month
4. Gas bill @ $50/month
5. Water bill @ $40.00/month
6. Food @ $350/month
7. Car Insurance @$115/month
8. Student Loan @ $50/month
9. My wedding ring is in pawn shop @ $300
10. My husband, Robert Peacock's, tools are in pawn shop @$61
OW!

My husband is out of work right now (the economy), but he is managing to find odd jobs here and there and is helping where he can. Mostly, though, he is being great to me as a caregiver and he should know that I love him very much. Thank you Pop Pop!

Thank you so much for your contributions. There are perks listed which I will deliver first come first served as soon as I can get back on my feet. Thanks to my brother, James Coate, for managing this Indiegogo account for me.
And THANKS TO YOU MY FRIENDS! :)

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
The Disaster

On May 1st, Western Uganda was swept by devestating and destructive flooding that has left nearly 7,000 displaced, 10 dead, 19,000 effected economically, and millions of dollars of property devestated.

The floods impacted a community that lives on or below the poverty line, meaning that their entire lives and livelihoods were washed away. Victims walked to town without shoes or clothes on their back, having fled from the horror of the rushing waters.
They have nothing left.
Photo Credit: New Vision
The need for recovery and relief efforts are critical for the thousands of people affected.
<div>
The Need
In the aftermath of the disaster, we need support for the following:
<ul>
<li>
Health education to prevent cholera, promote sanitation, and ensure we mitigate the risk of disease outbreak
<li>
Supplies for women and children who are most marginalized--soaps, sanitary pads, clothes, diapers, etc.
<li>
Basic food and water for our counselors working 24 hours to provide support to those who lost their homes.
<div>
The Impact
The people of Western Uganda face poverty on a daily basis, subsisting on the small food they can grow, their land, and the animals they rear.

But now, in the aftermath of the flooding, all of those have been washed away. The people of the communities affected have lost everything--their clothes, their land, their crops, and their homes. Most importantly, they have lost hope.
Your support is needed to help these people recover all that they have lost, including their pride and hope.
You can donate online, or via mobile money or in-kind donations. For more information, email info@acodeuvganda.org
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Just because can’t contribute, doesn’t mean you can’t help:
<ul>
<li>
Send this campaign to your friends and family for their support
<li>
Post on facebook, twitter, and other social media sites
<li>
Follow the ACODEV Facebook for updates on the crisis
Thank you for your support!

Short Summary
Never Feel Alone Again,... Someone's Always on the Other End!
This is all about getting the real security the other pendants offer but don't deliver.

I know what you thinking…the market is flooded with these kinds of emergency lifelines, and you are right, however there is nothing on the market like this today. This is a full functioning cordless telephone that utilizes the
column2: >proven cordless telephone technology which immediately offers extended range with 2 way voice communications from the pendant/communicator. In addition
column3: big button, large LCD display, 40+dB volume boost for the hearing impaired, and an additional emergency  lifeline button on the back of the phone. This is the only system like this in the world.

column1: Rick Greene, the founder, moved to a retirement community to be near his parents. He thought all was great until one day his father fell in the garage and that was when Rick learned the real limitations of the ""I've Fallen and I Can't Get Up"" devices. There was no real two way voice communication from the pendant, no one to help the person stay calm and, the kicker, you pretty much had to fall in the same room as the base. Luckily the signal went through but his father could not in any way communicate with the emergency technicians on the other end. At that moment he realized people were being taken advantage of, not offered any real freedom just a slightly wider radius to be worried in. He scoured the technology all over the world to find a system that made sense. Now it is his personal goal to get these systems to the marketplace so that everyone has the opportunity for freedom and safety. So that any person can know they are never alone in their home and surrounding area.

By sponsoring an elderly person you get them a year of 24/7 monitoring service as well as the equipment for them to live in the security of their home and neighborhood and they will experience true Peace of Mind With the Touch of a Button.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

We need $60,000 to get this new state of the art 2 way voice communicator technology product launched in the United States. Why be in the dark ages with an analogue outdated emergency alert system when the new digital DECT 6.0, 1.9GHz products will be available for your loved ones now? Two way voice communication with a trained emergency call center technician directly from the COMMUNICATOR around the neck when you are in or around your house.

Unlike a personal emergency response pendant, which does not allow you to hold a meaningful conversation with the other end, you have no idea how long it will take them to respond or if they have even understood what is wrong. Pendant is an outdated word in the world of antique jewelry and these other systems are just as outdated and useless. The cordless phone allows real voice communications. This new system allows you to stay on the line with the emergency responders so you are no longer in the dark wondering if someone is really coming. The technology reaches through walls, the garage, front yard, back yard, out to the mailbox and to your neighbor's house 2 doors down. This is cutting edge and far surpasses the analogue systems with a range 3x less than this new system
column2: ultimately giving the wearer more freedom so movement does not have to be limited. The user can go on with daily life knowing they will be heard. Did you realize that the old systems truly require you to fall in the same room as the ""system"" in order to have any type of communication? In the days of pocket sized computer cell phones, this is an outrage!

column1: Another amazing feature is the ability to place the communicator on its base for recharging every night. There is no concern about battery compartments or other hard to handle replacements. Some of these systems are designed in a way that is spring loaded, causing older hands extensive trouble if the batteries run out. if the battery ever runs low on this system a voice reminder will remind them to charge their communicator. Each person owns their equipment so they are never forced into upgrades or higher prices for the services provided.
By supporting the campaign you will provide
-250 units to the elderly in need
-A year’s worth of 24/7 trained monitoring service for each person
-They will own the equipment forever and can continue the service as long as they need.

If we don't reach our goal, we will provide units to as many people as possible with the funding we do raise. Our goal is to make living alone a safer endeavor for every elderly person who is capable of it. There is no reason they should live in fear and they should never be alone.
<div>
The Impact

By sponsoring an elderly person you are changing their life! They can live in their home and be safe. There are many things you don't think about until they happen to you or someone you love. As you age, your ability to take care of yourself is compromised due to balance issues, heart conditions or other problem health areas. Because of this, people are often ripped from their homes and forced into uncomfortable and undesirable living situations. This campaign, this product, can change this for hundreds of people.

Although we are recognized by a few Medicaid programs nationwide, not one Medicare program acknowledges the importance of a life saving device such as ours and as a result there are many needy seniors who can't afford a communicator. By getting this product on the market we hope to be recognized by Medicare and begin providing units to all those in need. We intend to continue our charitable contributions as well once we are acknowledged by Medicare. Our ultimate goal is to provide a free unit to a person in need for every two units purchased either by an individual or insurance company. We won't be happy until every person who is at risk has a consistent and reliable lifeline to the outside world so they can go on with their lives with confidence.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to sponsor an elderly person in whole, any dollar amount will help. If you can't afford anything right now, we know times are tough, then spread the word! Help us reach others who might be able to see the value in this campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools in order to help us reach our goal and become a featured campaign...this will only grow our outreach and allow us to keep everyone safe.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Thanks for visiting!  Please visit again soon, we'll have a video up asap!
We are NuNa Wellness - an integrative holistic wellness clinic in Madison's Downtown area.

Our mission is to create a nurturing and empowering space where we will provide quality, integrative care, and where we will raise funds to help those who are suffering and can't afford the treatment they need.
We recognize THREE NEEDS in our community:
1) A way to give people who are disabled and/or unable to work access to holistic wellness care, despite financial hardship

After living with a disability in my early 20s, I am intimately aware of the struggles faced when one is unable to work.  I also know that very often, traditional western medical treatments offer little hope for those living with chronic pain disorders, and holistic, natural care is needed to recover true wellness.
2) Better opportunities for fair income and personal growth for holistic health care providers

I witness a great deal of new massage therapists and yoga instructors on the scene getting taken advantage of because they are eager to work, or because they have no personal knowledge of business operations.  I want to create a place for them to build their clientelle, their confidence, and their income!
3) An uplifting environment for healers to collaborate and synergize, allowing for greater healing of their patients

Natural medicine works synergistically.  That means that the mind and body work together, and must be addressed from many angles for effective healing.  Our clinic will encourage a spirit of collaboration with regular team trainings, community workshops, and integrative treatments.  The more we work together, the greater good we can provide to our community, and the stronger our business will be.
By supporting this project, you will be part of something amazing!
<ul>
• You will help create a nurturing and empowering space for the community.
<ul>
• You will be helping improve the job market, and the workplace environment for many healing professionals, who are often taken advantage of and not paid what their work is worth.
<ul>
• More importantly, you'll be helping to set the foundation for an inclusive health care model for ALL.

By creating a non-profit fund, we will be able to donate a portion of our clinic's proceeds to those struggling to afford holistic treatment.  We will be able to offer comprehensive treatment options for people in our community who are dealing with debilitating chronic illness or other health issues keeping them from being able to afford the care they need.

That means that people who are so sick that they are not able to work will, for the first time, have a resource to receive much needed holistic care.  We will take applications on a case-by-case basis, and review each applicant based on financial need, health needs, and the resources we have available.

Each applicant who is chosen by our team will receive a treatment package of a variety of healing modalities.  We believe in integrative medicine because the body is an intricately connected and affected organism that requires care from many angles, and over a period of time.  By providing multiple treatments to individual applicants, we believe our resources will be used most effectively.
Our goal will be to donate 75 free treatments each month by the end of our first year!!
This is totally do-able, if we are able to expand our clinic from the two rooms we have now, to a fully integrative 6 room facility.

Can you imagine all the people who are suffering with chronic pain that could live fuller, more satisfying lives!? 

How many parents who are living with chronic disease could finally be more a part of their children's lives? 

Soldiers disabled from service could learn methods to alleviate symptoms of PTSD and get natural therapies to help physical injuries heal!
I found the perfect location, the perfect space, and have a team of talented and passionate holistic care practitioners.  We just need some startup funds!
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
If you can spare some money, this is what we'll use it for:
<ul>
• The money will make it possible for us to expand our lease in a prime retail location with a private entrance, parking, soundproofed walls, and really great energy :)
• We will furnish the new clinic to make you feel at home when you visit, with cozy furniture and inviting ambiance.  We plan to use locally sourced sustainable items when possible.
• We will paint the facility to enhance the healing effects of the space
• We will use some of the money to roll out a fierce but friendly advertising campaign about a month before our grand opening to ensure the clinic's success
• We will invite the community to a fun-filled appreciation event for our Grand Opening, and of course, have a private, pre-opening party for contributors!
• If we reach our goal, we'll also invest in a Full Spectrum Infrared Sauna to enhance clinic services!!!  If our goal is reached, EVERY donor will receive a free treatment in the sauna!*******
<div>
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
<li>

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! 
Tell anyone you know who you think will be excited too!  You don't have to donate a lot of money to raise a lot of money!  I can even get you a bunch of flyers to pass out!!
<li>

Use Social Networking Share Tools
Share our campaign on Facebook!  Twitter!  All those other social media tools the kids are using these days - get on there and share!  Email your friends if you really want to help!
<li>
Schedule a massage or yoga private NOW!
• Any income now helps us reach our goal sooner!  Come get immediate rewards by scheduling an appointment at www.tinyurl.com/nunawellness
<li>
**PAY BY PAYPAL!**  The sooner we have some of this moola, the sooner we can open the clinic and start offering services!  When you pay by PayPal, we get the funds right away!!
<span style=""color: #df7401
column3:
>*You can also pay by check, though it won't count toward the online goal due to the way fees are set up... you will still get the rewards listed!!  Make checks out to NuNa Wellness or Sabrina Bodden*
Send checks to:
ATTN: Sabrina Bodden
NūNa Wellness
600 Williamson Street Suite F
Madison, WI 53703

Did you miss the Indiegogo Campaign?

Not to worry! Go to http://www.race-capture.com to be notified when Race Capture is available for general sales. As soon as the indiegogo perks are fulfilled, we will open our online store for direct sales and through our distributors.
Got general questions on Race Capture? Visit the forums at http://www.autosportlabs.org, join the discussion, ask your questions and learn more from other enthusiasts!

Thank you,
The team at Autosport Labs
Notes!

Many have asked if the $429/$449 ""I Can Haz Realtime Data"" perk levels includes a Race Capture Pro unit. Yes: it does include the Race Capture Pro unit, in addition to the  telemetry module, t-shirt, decals and early access to our beta program for the real-time data web service. Thanks!
Updates!
<div class=""firstword"">

Get a Sequential Shift Light Free! If we reach our $30K goal we will include a 3-stage sequential shift light with all perks $279 and higher! This sequential shift light will be compact (4.8x0.6""), light and will be easily attach to your dashboard. Race Capture Pro will control it via 3 programmable outputs. Awesome! So spread the word far and wide about Race Capture Pro!
<div style=""background-color: e0e0e0

We just added a new perk! Add this $55 perk on top of your existing Race Capture Pro perk to get a bluetooth adapter that plugs into Race Capture Pro,  and get early access to our mobile app which gives you a Lapping/AutoX/Rally dashboard! You'll also be able to configure and monitor Race Capture Pro, all from your Android phone or tablet!
<div style=""background-color: e0e0e0
<div style=""background-color: e0e0e0
column2: >

column1: Data that Drives You

""I was already on pole, then by half a second and then one second and I just kept going. Suddenly I was nearly two seconds faster than anybody else, including my team mate with the same car."" -  Ayrton Senna
You didn’t spend all that time and money to come in second. You play to win, you always have.

A small change in performance can be the difference between winning and not. This is true for driver or car. If you’re a good driver in a good car, it’s hard to know exactly what change is needed. Maybe it’s tire pressure, a suspension tweak, a different line through corner 5 and 6, who knows? Occasionally you stumble across the solution, but much of the time it goes unnoticed or unresolved. None of this is a mystery to a professional race team. They know exactly what’s going on. They’ve spent the money. They’ve got all the data.
If you had this kind of data, if you knew exactly what was going on, you could make the change, big or small, that makes the difference.
Lucky you! Collecting that data just got a lot more affordable.
Meet Race Capture Pro
Race Capture Pro collects data. Lots of it. It’s a powerful, multi-channel data acquisition and control system designed to be installed in your street or race car.
We’ve packed it with advanced features normally reserved for high end systems.
Race Capture Pro puts at your disposal:
<ul>
• High Frequency 10Hz GPS for accurately tracking your position in the world
• Precision 3 Axis digital accelerometer to measure G-forces in all directions
<li>
Yaw Sensor to measure car rotation and detect oversteer and understeer conditions
<li>
Sensor Inputs to measure engine temperature, throttle / brake position, boost pressure, wheel speed, RPM and more
<li>
Hardware expansion to add OBD-II and CAN interface upgrades
• All in a compact, rugged enclosure you'd be proud to show off.
What you can Log
Here's just an example of what kind of data you can record with Race Capture Pro:
Software

A data acquisition system like this wouldn't be complete without software. Race Capture Pro includes software which allows you to configure the hardware settings as well as perform analysis on your racing data. Read on for more details!
Control your world
Race Capture Pro doesn't only collect data
column2: it can process it in real-time and control devices on your race car.

column1: With Race Capture Pro’s control capability you can do things that range from simple to sophisticated. Things such as:
<ul>
<li>
Activate a fan when a temperature threshold is exceeded
• Log data at a higher resolution near a certain GPS coordinate, like at that one problematic corner of the track
<li>
Control an intercooler sprayer based on temperature and boost level
<li>
Intercept and re-map an OEM sensor to override stock engine management behavior
• Experiment with active aerodynamics by controlling a wing based on GPS velocity
• Lay down a thick smoke screen against your competitors
How does this work?

We've embedded a simple yet powerful scripting language right on board called Lua, which lets you easily create commands to read sensors and activate outputs based on logic you define. It’s easy, and you don’t have to be a firmware developer!
And if you need help getting something to work, our community will get you started with sample scripts, help and reference - sharing at its best.
Open to the Core
Race Capture Pro isn’t just a powerful data acquisition and control system
column2: It’s an Open Source Hardware and Software project. We will open the design for your inspection, tweaking, and customization. No secret file formats and no expensive, proprietary add-ons. Frankly, we think this is silly and it’s time that a project like this exists to serve the enthusiasts first. And we’re excited to share it and see where we all can take it together!

column1: When will we release source code and hardware design files? Our plan is to release source code and designs upon fulfillment of the last funded Race Capture Pro unit, before we make it available in our regular store and via distributors.
Software / Firmware Features
Race Capture Pro includes software that allows to to configure the system and perform analysis on your recorded data: Race Analyzer.

The powerful 32 bit ARM processor combined with the onboard firmware allows Race Capture Pro to record real-world values in real time - not just raw values that have to be dechiphered later as found on other, even more expensive systems.
Configuration
GPS
<ul>
• Configure Latitude, Longitude, Velocity and Time channels. Logging rate of 1, 5 and 10Hz are supported
• Configure start / finish line detection for Lap Count and Lap Time
Accelerometer / Yaw
Measure G forces in 3 axis using one of the most precise digital accelerometers in the industry. A yaw sensor measures car rotation to detect oversteer / understeer conditions.
<ul>
• Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
• Re-map accelerometer channels so the enclosure can be mounted in any orientation
Analog Input Channels (1 - 8)
Measure sensors for engine temperature, air intake temperature, suspension travel, boost pressure, oil pressure, and much more.
<ul>
• Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
• Map the input to real-world representations of pressure, temperature and so on using these 3 options:
<li style="""">
<ul>
• Raw Value
• Linear Scaling (simple)
• Mapped Value (using a interpolated table)
• Channel 8 is a dedicated channel for measuring battery voltage
Pulse Input channels (1 - 3)
Measure engine RPM, wheel speed, and any other pulse or frequency signal.
<ul>
• Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
• Configure the channel scaling so real-world values are logged, such as RPM, MPH, frequency, etc.
General Purpose Input / Output Channels
These channels are individually configurable for input or output (jumper configurable).
When configured as output, these can be used for activating accessories, such as video cameras (e.g. GoPro) , warning lights, relays, and more.
When configured as input, these can be used to read a switch, the state of a low speed sensor, and so on.
<ul>
• Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
• Set for input or output mode in software (also requires jumper setting)
Analog / Pulse output channels
The analog / pulse output channels can be used to provide a variable voltage or pulse for controlling other system or devices.  This can be used to control external systems, override ECU settings
Analysis
Race Capture Pro's included analysis software, Race Analyzer, lets you import data from multiple sessions and compare them side by side, using a variety of charts, gauges and visualization tools.
Furthermore, Race Capture Pro records data in a simple comma-separated value (CSV) format, allowing you to load your data into a variety of other tools.
Expandability
Real Time Telemetry

In beta testing now is a dedicated cellular module that allows streaming of race car data right to the internet, allowing monitoring from the pits or anywhere else in the world. With just a pre-paid SIM card, race cars can now have a dedicated connection to the internet! Plans such as T-mobile offer unlimited data at $3 a day - $6 for an entire weekend of racing.
Do you want early access to what high-end race teams use every time? We have a special, limited perk level for adding telemetry capabilities to your Race Capture Pro.
Race Capture Pro Technical Specifications
Race Capture Pro offers over 25 input and output channels, enough to handle complex logging and control tasks.
7 dedicated 0-5v analog input channels + Battery Voltage
Measure sensors or process input from other devices.
3 dedicated 0-5v frequency input channels
Measure RPM, wheel speed, or any kind of periodic pulse.
4 configurable 0-5v analog or pulse output (PWM) channels
Control other systems, re-map OEM sensors or even control servo motors
3 configurable digital input or output channels
Receive input from switches or digital signals
column2: or configure as output and use to activate accessories, relays or drive indicator lamps with internal 1A self-protected mosfet drive

column1: 3 channel digital accelerometer module plus Z-axis gyro (+/- 2G per axis)
Measure and log 3D G-force in real-time with one of the industry's most accurate accelerometers. Z-axis gyroscope measures yaw/drift in real-time.
High resolution 10Hz GPS module
Plot location, speed and time. Onboard detection of start/finish line for automatic lap count and lap time
Serial expansion port
Provides connectivity expansion for Real Time Telemetry (see funding options), digital dashboard integration or smartphone integration via future bluetooth module.
Digital sensor expansion port
A high speed port provides the ability to add OBD-II, CAN bus expansion, more analog or digital channels, integrate specialty sensor hardware such as thermocouple amplifiers, and so on
Logging
SD memory card slot for data acquisition. Store up to 32GB of logging data. Logging rates up to 100Hz are supported.
CPU
48Mhz 32 bit ARM processor. Enough juice to perform high resolution logging and running complex, user-defined actions
Input/Output Protection
45v protection on all input pins
Analog outputs protected by auto-resettable fuses
Digital outputs are rated at 1A with self-protected mosfets
Over-current protection on 5V reference
2A internal switching power supply
Mechanical
Compact, rugged design
Dimensions: 5.5 x 3.3 inches (140 x 84 mm)
Weight: 8.6 oz (1oz in removable/re-configurable flanges) (244 gm / 215 gm)
Easy to use screw terminal block for wiring
On-board 'action' switch to start/stop logging (or other use)
On-board Status LEDs
Production Plan
Better Faster Stronger
Since 2008 Autosport Labs's misson has been to develop affordable, open technologies for race and street applications, starting with the popular Megajolt crank fired ignition system.

The Megajolt was designed to solve an individual problem and then grew into a global business. We went from ecking out a small space in our garage to expanding to commercial space, where our manufacturing equipment resides side by side with our test benches: race cars in various states of build. As with Megajolt, we are our own first customer, and we're just as proud of the community of customer users supporting and sharing with each other as we are of the products that got us here.

We come to you, Indigogo community, to help us get Race Capture Pro into as many hands (cars) as possible as fast as possible, to create the rich and robust user community to share data, collaborate on command scripts, cheer over victories. This is the real value of Race Capture Pro, and crowd-funding seemed to us the best way to launch an open source project, to hit the track at full speed.
About the Autosport Labs Team

Founded by Brent Picasso and Kelley Picasso in 2008, Autosport Labs is passionate about developing open source technology for motorsport and street applications. We started off small, providing kits for the early version of the Megajolt Ignition controller, and developed our knowledge of what it takes to design and deliver across the entire product lifecycle.

Along the way we developed the expertise and capacity to do assembly of our own electronics. This gives us a tremendous advantage in both agility and removing variables in the process of delivering finished items. In our Lynnwood, WA facility we have a full range of electronic assembly equipment including a solder stencil printer, robotic pick and place machine, and reflow and through hole solder machines.
We run our technology by campaigning our own race car in the demanding and fun 24 Hours of Lemons endurance racing series.
We are all Race Car Drivers
Meet the team
Brent Picasso
Founder, CEO, Race car driver, Chief Mouth Frother and Engineer - responsible for hardware, software, firmware designs
Kelley Picasso
Founder, COO, Race car driver, Chief Ass Kicker - responsible for ideation, production expert, business management
Scott Miller
Race car driver, Heroic race car fabricator, production assembly, ideation
Fred Schechter
Race car driver, industrial designer secret weapon, product design, social media, marketing, testing, ideation
Brian Lalor

Race car driver, software and firmware engineering, hardware design, fabrication.  Releaser of magic smoke.  Dammit, am I bleeding again?!

","Did you miss the Indiegogo Campaign?

Not to worry! Go to http://www.race-capture.com to be notified when Race Capture is available for general sales. As soon as the indiegogo perks are fulfilled, we will open our online store for direct sales and through our distributors.
Got general questions on Race Capture? Visit the forums at http://www.autosportlabs.org, join the discussion, ask your questions and learn more from other enthusiasts!
Thank you,The team at Autosport Labs
Notes!

Many have asked if the $429/$449 ""I Can Haz Realtime Data"" perk levels includes a Race Capture Pro unit. Yes: it does include the Race Capture Pro unit, in addition to the  telemetry module, t-shirt, decals and early access to our beta program for the real-time data web service. Thanks!
Updates!

Get a Sequential Shift Light Free! If we reach our $30K goal we will include a 3-stage sequential shift light with all perks $279 and higher! This sequential shift light will be compact (4.8x0.6""), light and will be easily attach to your dashboard. Race Capture Pro will control it via 3 programmable outputs. Awesome! So spread the word far and wide about Race Capture Pro!

We just added a new perk! Add this $55 perk on top of your existing Race Capture Pro perk to get a bluetooth adapter that plugs into Race Capture Pro,  and get early access to our mobile app which gives you a Lapping/AutoX/Rally dashboard! You'll also be able to configure and monitor Race Capture Pro, all from your Android phone or tablet!
Data that Drives You

I was already on pole, then by half a second and then one second and I just kept going. Suddenly I was nearly two seconds faster than anybody else, including my team mate with the same car."" -  Ayrton Senna
You didn’t spend all that time and money to come in second. You play to win, you always have.

A small change in performance can be the difference between winning and not. This is true for driver or car. If you’re a good driver in a good car, it’s hard to know exactly what change is needed. Maybe it’s tire pressure, a suspension tweak, a different line through corner 5 and 6, who knows? Occasionally you stumble across the solution, but much of the time it goes unnoticed or unresolved. None of this is a mystery to a professional race team. They know exactly what’s going on. They’ve spent the money. They’ve got all the data.
If you had this kind of data, if you knew exactly what was going on, you could make the change, big or small, that makes the difference.
Lucky you! Collecting that data just got a lot more affordable.
Meet Race Capture Pro
Race Capture Pro collects data. Lots of it. It’s a powerful, multi-channel data acquisition and control system designed to be installed in your street or race car.
We’ve packed it with advanced features normally reserved for high end systems.
Race Capture Pro puts at your disposal:
High Frequency 10Hz GPS for accurately tracking your position in the world
Precision 3 Axis digital accelerometer to measure G-forces in all directions
Yaw Sensor to measure car rotation and detect oversteer and understeer conditions
Sensor Inputs to measure engine temperature, throttle / brake position, boost pressure, wheel speed, RPM and more
Hardware expansion to add OBD-II and CAN interface upgrades
All in a compact, rugged enclosure you'd be proud to show off.
What you can Log
Here's just an example of what kind of data you can record with Race Capture Pro:
Software

A data acquisition system like this wouldn't be complete without software. Race Capture Pro includes software which allows you to configure the hardware settings as well as perform analysis on your racing data. Read on for more details!
Control your world
Race Capture Pro doesn't only collect data
column2: it can process it in real-time and control devices on your race car.

column1: With Race Capture Pro’s control capability you can do things that range from simple to sophisticated. Things such as:
Activate a fan when a temperature threshold is exceeded
Log data at a higher resolution near a certain GPS coordinate, like at that one problematic corner of the track
Control an intercooler sprayer based on temperature and boost level
Intercept and re-map an OEM sensor to override stock engine management behavior
Experiment with active aerodynamics by controlling a wing based on GPS velocity
Lay down a thick smoke screen against your competitors
How does this work?

We've embedded a simple yet powerful scripting language right on board called Lua, which lets you easily create commands to read sensors and activate outputs based on logic you define. It’s easy, and you don’t have to be a firmware developer!
And if you need help getting something to work, our community will get you started with sample scripts, help and reference - sharing at its best.
Open to the Core
Race Capture Pro isn’t just a powerful data acquisition and control system
column2: It’s an Open Source Hardware and Software project. We will open the design for your inspection, tweaking, and customization. No secret file formats and no expensive, proprietary add-ons. Frankly, we think this is silly and it’s time that a project like this exists to serve the enthusiasts first. And we’re excited to share it and see where we all can take it together!

column1: When will we release source code and hardware design files? Our plan is to release source code and designs upon fulfillment of the last funded Race Capture Pro unit, before we make it available in our regular store and via distributors.
Software / Firmware Features
Race Capture Pro includes software that allows to to configure the system and perform analysis on your recorded data: Race Analyzer.

The powerful 32 bit ARM processor combined with the onboard firmware allows Race Capture Pro to record real-world values in real time - not just raw values that have to be dechiphered later as found on other, even more expensive systems.
Configuration
GPS
Configure Latitude, Longitude, Velocity and Time channels. Logging rate of 1, 5 and 10Hz are supported
Configure start / finish line detection for Lap Count and Lap Time
Accelerometer / Yaw
Measure G forces in 3 axis using one of the most precise digital accelerometers in the industry. A yaw sensor measures car rotation to detect oversteer / understeer conditions.
Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
Re-map accelerometer channels so the enclosure can be mounted in any orientation
Analog Input Channels (1 - 8)
Measure sensors for engine temperature, air intake temperature, suspension travel, boost pressure, oil pressure, and much more.
Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
Map the input to real-world representations of pressure, temperature and so on using these 3 options:
Raw Value
Linear Scaling (simple)
Mapped Value (using a interpolated table)
Channel 8 is a dedicated channel for measuring battery voltage
Pulse Input channels (1 - 3)
Measure engine RPM, wheel speed, and any other pulse or frequency signal.
Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
Configure the channel scaling so real-world values are logged, such as RPM, MPH, frequency, etc.
General Purpose Input / Output Channels
These channels are individually configurable for input or output (jumper configurable).
When configured as output, these can be used for activating accessories, such as video cameras (e.g. GoPro) , warning lights, relays, and more.
When configured as input, these can be used to read a switch, the state of a low speed sensor, and so on.
Configure channel name and logging rate (1, 5, 10, 20, 30, 50, 100Hz)
Set for input or output mode in software (also requires jumper setting)
Analog / Pulse output channels
The analog / pulse output channels can be used to provide a variable voltage or pulse for controlling other system or devices.  This can be used to control external systems, override ECU settings
Analysis
Race Capture Pro's included analysis software, Race Analyzer, lets you import data from multiple sessions and compare them side by side, using a variety of charts, gauges and visualization tools.
Furthermore, Race Capture Pro records data in a simple comma-separated value (CSV) format, allowing you to load your data into a variety of other tools.
Expandability
Real Time Telemetry

In beta testing now is a dedicated cellular module that allows streaming of race car data right to the internet, allowing monitoring from the pits or anywhere else in the world. With just a pre-paid SIM card, race cars can now have a dedicated connection to the internet! Plans such as T-mobile offer unlimited data at $3 a day - $6 for an entire weekend of racing.
Do you want early access to what high-end race teams use every time? We have a special, limited perk level for adding telemetry capabilities to your Race Capture Pro.

Hello, I am Joseph McGavern, the ex-husband to Rose McGavern.  I am starting this campaign for Rose, because she is the mother of my kids, and I care for her deeply.  She is good mother, and always puts our kids, and others first.  She will often times do without just to see them happy.

She has been suffering with a condition called Sarcoidosis for about 10 years now, and it has recently gotten worse.  It affects her ability to breathe, and can lead to other problems within her body as time goes on.  She recently had a Bronchoscopy procedure that caused her lung to collapse partially.  So this was 2 surgeries just a few days apart!
Whether giving or not, please get the word out, and share the link to this campaign with your friends and loved ones.  The more that know=the more that may be able to help.
<div>
Prayers would also be much appreciated even if you cannot give!  Thank you very much, and God bless! :-)
