Raul's Story

Raul was born in Barlad, Romania, on October 19th 2009. He was born with a severe form of the rare genetic condition Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB), as was his sister who passed away at one month old. He lived in the hospital for four months, when he was then transferred to Tutova Clinic. I met Raul the day he arrived in Tutova, and immediately fell in love. At the time he was in very poor condition, and EB was not widely known in the area. I was in contact with doctors in the United States during my time in Romania to help find ways to improve his quality of life. Once home I began working on getting Raul a medical visa to come to the U.S. for a short time to receive more expansive testing and wound care. Raul was loved by his caretakers in Romania, but due to the lack of knowledge about EB he was isolated, and did not receive optimal care. After a lengthy, year long, process, Raul was denied a medical visa by the U.S. Embassy in Bucharest. I came home from Romania after the denial, and began the application process for his Humanitarian Parole. Thankfully, this was granted in a matter of weeks, and last July we were able to bring Raul here from Romania! We spent almost five months at Colorado Children's Hospital receiving care for Raul from their EB specialists, and are now home in Boston. While there is no cure for EB, Raul has improved greatly with a feeding tube for nutrition and extensive wound care! We are currently working through some of his developmental delays with Early Intervention (PT, OT, Speech).

Raul has struggled greatly, mainly with infection in his many non-healing wounds, yet he faces everything with great courage! We were finally able to obtain a biopsy to determine his sub-type of EB, which will help him to take part in trials working towards a cure for EB, yet the results were not 100% conclusive. We know he has severe dystrophic EB, but it appears he may have multiple subtypes/mutations. To get a more accurate portrayal, we now need to do DNA testing. Because of his immigration status, Raul is not able to have insurance, so we need to pay our of pocket for this, which is why we need your help! Please help us to help Raul!
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

-The lab, GeneDX, has offered us a discount due to Raul's situation. This brings the cost of the testing from $6,000 down to just over $3,000. We will also have to pay for shipping, but that should not be too expensive.
-As a perk, we will send one of Raul's awareness t-shirts to the top 10 donors! These shirts are also available to be purchased here for those who are interested.
We will continue to fundraise until we reach our goal, as it is important to us that Raul receive this testing!
<div>
The Impact

This testing will give us the information we need to fully understand his condition, and to enroll Raul in future EB trials. These trials will not only help him, but will help future children born with this horrible condition!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Share this page, and share Raul's blog: My Romanian Butterfly! Epidermolysis Bullosa needs more awareness. Please take the time to educate yourself and others about this condition by visiting the website for the Dystrophic Epidermolysis Bullosa Research Assosciation (DEBRA). ","Raul's Story

My Story

Hi! I am Kathryn, I am 29 years old and I have been suffering from a debilitating invisible chronic illness for more than 2 years. After being told I had Lupus, or possibly Rheumatoid Arthritis I agreed to a blood test. It came back negative and I was then referred to a psychiatrist. Many blood tests later I finally had an answer: Lyme Disease, Babesiosis and Bartonella. My titers were so high I was even considered positive according to strict CDC standards. I was relieved to hear this, after all Lyme disease is very easy to cure...right?

Unfortunately so much time had passed between transmission and diagnosis, the bacteria had disseminated and crossed into my brain. I now have late stage (also known as Chronic) Lyme Disease. I would also soon find that Lyme Disease is incredibly controversial and despite strong medical and scientific evidence to the contrary, the Infectious Disease Society of America (IDSA) denies the existence of Lyme disease that persists after 28 days of antibiotic treatment. The IDSA is who insurance companies listen to when it comes to covering treatment. The Social Security Administration also follows their guidelines when reviewing applications for disability.

Before I became sick, I had a promising career in the Film Industry. I had done research for movies that are now in theaters. I also sat in the writers room and helped craft the first 6 episodes of a TV show that will debut in March. I spent my free time volunteering with children and at homeless shelters. I conducted fundraisers to help victims of Human Trafficking. I played the violin and had an organic garden.

I also loved hiking and backpacking and would try to hike as much as possible on the weekends. Symptomatic but not yet diagnosed, I completed a 144.7 mile section hike of the Pacific Crest Trail. Those that hiked with me can attest to the fact that something was wrong. It has always been a dream of mine to complete a thru hike (2,650 miles) of the Pacific Crest Trail.

In February of 2011 my illness became so severe that I had no choice but to quit my job. I immediately filed for Social Security Disability and went on temporary disability in the meantime. Despite treatment, I seemed to be steadily getting more and more sick. It became clear that my particular case was beyond the knowledge of my Dr and after making a few calls, I became the patient of one of the top Lyme Dr's in the Country. By the time I had my first appointment with him, I was a complete mess. Here is a list of my symptoms:
Severe joint, bone and muscle pain (8 out of 10)
Brain Fog
Memory Loss (I routinely forget simple things like my phone number or where I live)
Seizures
Stroke Symptoms
Tachycardia
Migraines
Severe Fatigue
Depression and Suicidal fantasies
Tremors in the hands and legs
Digestive issues
Hair loss
Panic attacks
The list goes on...

In June I had a minor surgery where they placed a port-a-cath in my chest. I now am able to do home IV infusions. I do up to three infusions of various medications a day. An alarm is constantly going off to remind me to take a medication or supplement. I spend most of my time in bed, unable to move. Right before Christmas I was hospitalized  as I could not walk, my legs had become too weak and the pain too great. I left the hospital with a walker.
The Impact

I am trying to raise funds for treatment because I lost my appeal with Social Security Disability. Despite letters from several Dr's and tests that prove my dire medical situation, SSDI has determined that I am not disabled. I am awaiting a hearing where I will go before a judge and plead my case. They are so backlogged I must wait up to a year for my court date.
My temporary disability ran out in August and I have gone through my savings trying to keep a roof over my head, insurance paid and treatment covered.
I can no longer do this alone -

column2: >At this time I face losing my health insurance, homelessness and ultimately leaving treatment for a curable disease. Without treatment I will continue to get worse. Without treatment this disease can be fatal.

column1: What You Can Do
With your help, I can pay for my health insurance, medications and ultimately get my life back. Even a contribution of $1 will add up. Please help me get my life back!
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help my campaign reach as many people as possible. Please share my campaign via twitter, facebook or even email.
For more information about Lyme Disease please visit www.lymedisease.org or www.ilads.org

I was relieved to hear this, after all Lyme disease is very easy to cure...right?

Unfortunately so much time had passed between transmission and diagnosis, the bacteria had disseminated and crossed into my brain. I now have late stage (also known as Chronic) Lyme Disease. I would also soon find that Lyme Disease is incredibly controversial and despite strong medical and scientific evidence to the contrary, the Infectious Disease Society of America (IDSA) denies the existence of Lyme disease that persists after 28 days of antibiotic treatment. The IDSA is who insurance companies listen to when it comes to covering treatment. The Social Security Administration also follows their guidelines when reviewing applications for disability.

Before I became sick, I had a promising career in the Film Industry. I had done research for movies that are now in theaters. I also sat in the writers room and helped craft the first 6 episodes of a TV show that will debut in March. I spent my free time volunteering with children and at homeless shelters. I conducted fundraisers to help victims of Human Trafficking. I played the violin and had an organic garden.

I also loved hiking and backpacking and would try to hike as much as possible on the weekends. Symptomatic but not yet diagnosed, I completed a 144.7 mile section hike of the Pacific Crest Trail. Those that hiked with me can attest to the fact that something was wrong. It has always been a dream of mine to complete a thru hike (2,650 miles) of the Pacific Crest Trail.

In February of 2011 my illness became so severe that I had no choice but to quit my job. I immediately filed for Social Security Disability and went on temporary disability in the meantime. Despite treatment, I seemed to be steadily getting more and more sick. It became clear that my particular case was beyond the knowledge of my Dr and after making a few calls, I became the patient of one of the top Lyme Dr's in the Country. By the time I had my first appointment with him, I was a complete mess. Here is a list of my symptoms:
Severe joint, bone and muscle pain (8 out of 10)
Brain Fog
Memory Loss (I routinely forget simple things like my phone number or where I live)
Seizures
Stroke Symptoms
Tachycardia
Migraines
Severe Fatigue
Depression and Suicidal fantasies
Tremors in the hands and legs
Digestive issues
Hair loss
Panic attacks
The list goes on...

In June I had a minor surgery where they placed a port-a-cath in my chest. I now am able to do home IV infusions. I do up to three infusions of various medications a day. An alarm is constantly going off to remind me to take a medication or supplement. I spend most of my time in bed, unable to move. Right before Christmas I was hospitalized  as I could not walk, my legs had become too weak and the pain too great. I left the hospital with a walker.
The Impact

I am trying to raise funds for treatment because I lost my appeal with Social Security Disability. Despite letters from several Dr's and tests that prove my dire medical situation, SSDI has determined that I am not disabled. I am awaiting a hearing where I will go before a judge and plead my case. They are so backlogged I must wait up to a year for my court date.
My temporary disability ran out in August and I have gone through my savings trying to keep a roof over my head, insurance paid and treatment covered.
I can no longer do this alone - I need your help!

At this time I face losing my health insurance, homelessness and ultimately leaving treatment for a curable disease. Without treatment I will continue to get worse. Without treatment this disease can be fatal.
What You Can Do
With your help, I can pay for my health insurance, medications and ultimately get my life back. Even a contribution of $1 will add up. Please help me get my life back!
Other Ways You Can Help
Please help my campaign reach as many people as possible. Please share my campaign via twitter, facebook or even email.
For more information about Lyme Disease please visit www.lymedisease.org or www.ilads.org",0.0,0,"7 Campaigns
|","East Palo Alto, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/stuck-between-diagnosis-and-cure/pica

The Project

Hello! My name is Nicole Teufel and I am a certified yoga teacher with Yoga Alliance (RYT). I have created a weekly volunteer yoga workshop for Vista Maria. Vista Maria is a home for girl's from 11yrs-18yrs  old who have been removed from thier home for various reasons such as volience, neglect or other trauma. These young girls are in need of healing and I have chosen to offer what I can to them- Yoga. I have also earned a Writing Certificate from the University of Michigan- Dearborn, and I will be incorporating journaling and other forms of creative writing to offer the girls skills to assist in thier healing.

The project will offer each girl 2 hours of yoga/writing workshop per week for at least eight-weeks. This will give them a strong understanding of yoga postures and breathing techniques, and how it can benefit them emotionally as well as physically. The project will also give the girls ample time to develop creative writing skillls that can assists them throughout thier life in manging thier emotions and self-healing.

Vista Maria houses 160 girls. I hope to be able to provide them each with thier own yoga mat and composition book for decoration and journaling. I have found yoga mats for $10 at Target, and T.J. Maxx. I hope that we can pull together to help raise the funds needed to buy 160 mats, as well as 160 composition books and supplies to decorate them.

I believe that the privilege we are given in our life via education, money, or other gifts should be used in part to help those who have not been so privilegded. I understand this practice to be one way to slowly improve life for all people. It feels good to give what you can, and it feels good to get what you need. It is that simple. I wish to give yoga, and my time...can you help me give them the mats they need to make this opprotinity real for these 160 young girls?
Any additional funds raised will be split among the 160 girls for thier personal spending...they deserve a little extra love :) and it will be quite a wonderful surprise I think!

If you would like, please visit the Vista Maria website to see what the home's history is and why the girls need this healing. Please note, all donations for THIS project must go to this Indiegogo campaign in order to help with the workshop. If you would like to donate additional funds directly to the home, that can be done via thier website. http://www.vistamaria.org
To legitimize the project if you would like to do so, please email Becky Herman at rhermann@vistamaria.org.
If you would like to know more about me feel free to visit my blog: www.ToGetInspired.com
Or send me an email: Nteufel@gmail.com
<div>
<div>
The Impact

Yoga and writing have both been proven to be incredible tools for self-healing. The girls at Vista Maria could only be there for six months (possibly less) or perhaps up to two years. This means that it is important for them to get as much as they can to help them while they are at the home. Vista Maria's goal is to work with the Michigan court system to get the girls back into their home, or a new good home. I want to give them something they can rely on for comfort and assistance even after they leave the girls home. Because of what some of these girls have endured, they will need much longer recovery time than Vista Maria can usually offer...it is so critical that they have these tools for when they must leave...and their own yoga mat to take with them :)
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Please get the word out to all your peeps! This is a time-sensitive project and I would love to get the goal met, and the mats out to them asap! :)

You can also donate old magazines or art supplies you do not need, to contribute to the supplies for the girls to decorate their journals! A couple days during the project we will actually have an Art Therapy student in to teach the girls how to use art for healing!!!

Nicholas Svaikauskas

Nicholas has been training for this season since Canadian Nationals last year. He has put countless hours into skiing and shooting training. This year he was excited to compete in the Junior World Trails in Canmore, Alberta, the first race of the season for him.
The Story

On the 31st of December he and other members of Biathlon Ontario flew halfway across the country from Ontario to Alberta to be able to acclimatize to the higher altitude before the race. Nicholas has been working hard to raise enough money to pay for expensive equipment and flights. After three days of excellent training in the beautiful mountains, Nick had the misfortune of wiping out on the way back to the chalet, and snapped one of his very expensive race skis.
What We Need &

Now Nick needs a new pair of skis and he doesn’t have the cash, seeing as he already spent most of his funds on the tickets out here. He will buy a new pair of race skis locally, and your contributions will help cover only the cost of those skis.

If he doesn’t have enough to cover them, he will have to borrow a pair of skis, but race skis involve a huge number of variables, including weight, height, temperature ranges, and the skis shape, so it is difficult to find a perfect match.
Any left over money will go straight to his racing fund and pay for other race fees and the trip to Nationals.

This is quite short notice, but part of the sponsorship package I had previously prepared included pictures from races I can send out, and I will keep a race blog with updates during Junior World trials and the rest of the race season.
I greatly appreciate each and every donation, and please feel free to contact me with any questions or for more information about my sport.
Sincerely, Nicholas Svaikauskas.
Nicholass_ca@hotmail.com
www.facebook.com/NicholaSvaikauskasBiathlon
Twitter @SvaiksBiathon
http://nicholassvaikauskas.wordpress.com/
<div>

Three amazing memorial services were held for Obo this past weekend – and what memorable services they were – all so different and heartfelt. We truly thank all of you for coming out to celebrate &
column2:
remember Obo’s life with us.

On Friday night the Ghanaian community organized a traditional Ghanaian wake keeping – that included much drumming, dancing, wonderful food and pageantry. Our speakers honored Obo on behalf of the Sierra Leone community, the Nigerian community and the Ghanaian community. On Saturday evening we held a public memorial at Lewis &
column3:
Clark Agnes Flanagan Chapel where we were able to remember Obo’s contributions to many areas of the music and the arts with a multitude of beautiful performances and spoken tributes. On Sunday we were able to memorialize Obo in the faith he practiced SGI Buddhism held at the Oregon Buddhist Center.

We, his family, want to thank all of you who have shared your memories of Obo either with us directly, through cards or by posting on the Caring Bridge site. We encourage you to continue to post memories and stories of your time with Obo on www.caringbridge.org/visit/oboaddy as we plan to put these posts into a book to take to Ghana to share at the large memorial service to be held in Accra. (Please do not donate funds on the Caring Bridge website).

After all of these wonderful remembrances here in Portland we have one goal left to attain for Obo. We are now in the final stretch of fundraising to allow us to honor Obo’s legacy with a traditional ceremony in Ghana appropriate for his position as a Chief in the Sowutuom region of Accra. For this ceremony, Susan and a family member will need to fly to Ghana for traditional services as Obo’s title of Chief is passed from him to the next chosen person.
Please help us reach this goal by Saturday, October 20th. Any amount will help – we are very close to our goal.

column1: For those who have already contributed – we sincerely thank you for your generosity. Your gifts enabled us to present these memorial services in Portland and to assist with covering the expenses associated with Obo’s illness.

Obo worked as long as his body allowed, realizing that continuing to play and listen to his music was cathartic as he moved through this final step of this illness. His most recent performance was August 19 with Portland Taiko at the Mt. Scott Community Center. He is still hoped to record one last song he wrote at Falcon Studios.
 
A vigorous supporter of world music, Obo has been extremely active in bringing that style of music to Portland and Oregon, where he has lived with his wife Susan since 1978. Through numerous in-school residencies, performances and workshops, Obo has affected hundreds of thousands of lives in the Pacific Northwest and beyond. It’s difficult to find a child who grew up in Portland in the 80s and 90s that doesn’t hold fond memories of Obo and his drumming.

Obo's charismatic spirit, rapid-fire hands, and powerful voice have led him to receive the National Heritage Fellowship Award from the National Endowment for the Arts under President Bill Clinton, the Governors Award for the Arts in Oregon, The Masters Fellowship from the Regional Arts and Culture Council and the Masters Fellowship from the Oregon Arts Commission.

He was on the faculty at Lewis &
column2:
Clark College until his passing, and was the artistic director of the Obo Addy Legacy Project, formerly known as the Homowo African Arts and Cultures, a not-for-profit organization founded by the Addys in 1986 as a virtual cultural center with offerings in schools, parks, community centers and performance venues all over the country. The organization put on an annual Homowo Festival in Portland for nearly 15 years with music and dance, food, vendors and art demonstrations from various countries within the continent of Africa and the African Diaspora.

ABOUT OBO ADDY
Born in 1936 in Accra, the capital of Ghana, Addy is the son of a Wonche medicine man, and by the age of six was designated as a drummer. Addy’s family was part of the Ga ethnic group, and he was raised playing in the musical traditions of the Ga people.

Addy got his professional start in Ghana by playing with the Joe Kelly Band, the Ghana Broadcasting Band, and the Farmer’s Council Band, which played popular American and European music. In 1969, he was hired by the Arts Council of Ghana as a Ga master, and he received his first international exposure at the Munich Summer Olympics in 1972. Addy lived in London and spent six years touring internationally until 1978, when he moved to Portland. There he met and married his wife Susan who began managing his career.

Addy has maintained two different ensembles: Okropong, which means “eagle” in the Ga language, and Kukrudu, which is Ga for “earthquake.“ Okropong relies on traditional instrumentation, using hand and stick drums, bells, and shakers to create a layered rhythmic effect. Dance is also an important part of the performance, along with singing. Kukrudu is an eight-piece African jazz group that relies on a mix of European and African instruments.

For more information on Obo's music, visit www.oboaddylegacyproject.org.

Lily Dahl's heart surgery campaign

I am asking for your support on behalf of Lily Dahl. I am Lily's Grandmother, Dawn. Lily was born May 31st missing two heart valves which created the need for close to 4 weeks in the hospital far from home. Update: physicians will also be building a wall currently missing in the center of her heart...
Here is the major difficulty:
<ul>
• Lily was born with multiple heart defects

• Lily's family lives on an island in Hawaii that does not have a hospital with specialized instruments and facilities for teeny tiny hearts that newborn and small children need along with skilled pediatric cardilolgists.

Before 6 months of age (when congestive heart failure begins for this condition), the family: Lily, her mother and possibly her father and two year old sister will need to fly to Portland OR  and stay for her recovery where pediatric surgeons are skilled and practiced at open heart surgeries and have the required facilities. (SCARY for grandmothers to think about) This is just one of the needs that exist for Lily but it is the most pressing and will arrive the soonest.
<div>
What We Need
Here are the biggest needs:

We would like to support the kids  with money (ok they are 30 year olds...I shouldn't call them kids lol) past the amounts we, as family have each pledged, to get Lily to the mainland and for the family to have ways to get around. We think there is a Ronald McDonad House available but if all rooms are taken we will have to make other plans.

Although the family planned for Mom to have time off from work to attend to Lily, the needs have swamped their budget and the month in the hospital after her birth set them back financially. There will be more of the same in the next few months with only a short time for work and recovery.

A trip to the mainland was NOT anywhere in their plans and in addition Lily must be flown from Big Island, Hawaii to Manoa, Oahu monthly until her surgery, for assessments by the doctors there and probably for some time after.
<div>
The Impact
<ul>

• If you have had a sick or special needs child in your life you have valuable insight the kids need and we hope you will encourage them with ideas as well as any funds you may contribute. Every dollar and word of encouragement counts.

• As a fund raiser for Florida Children's charities I am aware of the toll on family life and impact on finances brought on by a need like this. It's killing me to sit here on the East Coast but fund raising is my contribution. If you are moved but cannot contribute please consider helping me get the word out.

• Anyone who can donate airline miles please contact me at here at Indiegogo and we will get a plan going. I am aware of United, Hawaiian and possibly soon Southwest although I'm not sure that's in place yet
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute right now, prayers, encouragement and publicity about the need is most valuable as the time is short:
<ul>
• Please Pray! As you send the link around please pause to pray for Lily and her parents as well as her sister who has been without her parents for the first time in her short life.

• Exciting news! If you know or are a Marine art collector we have been given the go ahead to offer copies of the dolphin painting ""Side By Side"" of a mother and baby dolphin for a larger donation.  A smaller size giclee is available for a one thousand dollar donation and a larger size for two thousand.  The giclee is sent rolled in a tube for you to have framed the way you want. (Any negotiation within those amounts are possible as well)

Thank you for your time reading this and any thing you can possibly do. Big Hugs, Dawn

Thank you all who have so far supported my fundraising call.
Justus Weijagye are my names.I live in Uganda
On 26th September last year, I was involved in a road traffic accident (RTA).
It left me with a fracture of the left knee joint, some deep wounds and minor injuries on other parts of the body especially the limbs.

As of now I have partially recovered after multiple treatments and of course involved personal expenses given the nature of the health system in our country where much of the medical care is financed by self and not government and I am in no health insurance scheme.
At the moment I need some operation on the left knee to remove foreign bodies and re-handling of the fracture.
I am a medical worker by profession, a radiographer. I am also an entrepreneur and a human rights activist as well apart from being a mere member of the working class.
In my life I have done much for self improvement and well being and as well being of others both near me and from far.
I have donated blood, provided food and clothing materials to the very needy.
I have helped many members of the working class to organize themselves and secure their rights at work and out of work.
Provided free accommodation, food and drinks to many travelers traveling at very minimum costs an those that become ill or sick across the way.
I have helped many members of the working class to get skills especially in photography, income generating projects, computer applications and many others.
As a medical worker I have provided voluntary services to those who cannot afford to pay for them and given free medical advice to many ignorant and ill people.
I have paid school fees for some needy students and orphans as well as struggled and got education sponsorship for others to mention but a few.
I am therefore calling for humanitarian support to regain my health by supporting and contributing to my medical bills.

I need USD 800 to clear the already remaining unpaid bills and also USD 1200 to move to the national referral hospital some 400km from where I live and get the operation and treatment I need as well as related expenses such as meals, drinks, nursing care etc.
This totals to USD 2000.
I have so far raised USD 1002 as follows:
Funds from previous campaign (UBUNTU) USD 622
(705.00: Amount raised by credit card
-$35.25: Indiegogo platform fee (5.0%)
-$22.65: Payment processing fee (3.0% + $0.30 USD)
-$25.00: Non-U.S. wire fee
=$622.10: Net amount disbursed to your bank account on Thu Feb 02.)
Funds locally raised from relatives, friends and well wishers: USD 380
Total funds still required = USD 2000-1002  = USD 998
Plus Indiegogo platform fees of 5% and
Payment processing fees of 3% totals to 8% more of 998 = USD 1078
Plus USD 25 fee for Non  US wire fees ,TOTALS to USD 1103
*The word UBUNTU is a Bantu speaking language word that means being humane.
NEW: This campaign ended.I thank you all who contributed to this and my previous campaigns.THANK YOU.

Our Story

For the past 6 years, I have been teaching yoga at a local recreation center. My mission is to create community-based classes that are high quality and also affordable. I really believe that yoga should be accessible and not only a luxury available to few. Due to declining circumstances at the city and recreation center, the environment I have been teaching in has become increasingly unsuitable. I think that there is a middle ground--again, I am not looking for luxury, but do want to provide a safe and clean environment where people can heal, and create lasting health and enjoyment through yoga.

I have decided to move my classes out of the city recreation center and rent a space to teach in several hours per week. I will be running the classes based on a sliding scale, meaning that people will pay for class according to what they can afford. My larger hope is that this is a first step towards a business that continues to create opportunities that are affordable. I am passionate about making spaces where people can create, organize, play, do inner work and work through the body that is so essential to living consciously. I think that more spaces like that are needed.
The Impact

Your contribution will help these classes move to a better situation. It will subsidize the costs of running the class allowing students to participate who cannot pay very much. In the past, these low cost classes have been subsidized by city funds, but I am now hoping to create a community support system in new ways. If you are local and plan to attend classes, your contribution will be to your own benefit as well. I really feel these classes will be of great service.
<h3>What We Need &amp
column2:
What You GetI have set a goal of $2000 which reflects the start up costs of making this move. This number includes the purchase of eco-friendly supplies (yoga blocks, straps, and blankets) that will last for a long time, funds a bit of advertising, and covers the first 2 months of rent. Money received won't be used for any purposes other than these. If I do not reach this funding goal, I will go forward as best possible with whatever funds I gather. The main purpose of asking for this funding is to have a strong start to get the supplies and resources necessary to make these classes self-sustaining, as I do not have this much of my own money to spend at this time.

The perks below offer you ways to get some yoga yourself while giving to others. They reflect discounted rates for classes, so that you are getting a deal by helping me get started. The perks also give you ways to share information on your links or services with others.

column1: Other Ways You Can Help
""Do it with others"" is such a great idea. If you just give a few dollars, and tell your friends to do the same, we will make it!

Do you have a dumb bottle? Get a smart one! The worlds first smartbottle! Keep hydrated and help save planet Earth at the same time!!
<div class=""full-description"">
<div class=""user-content"">
The ILUMI Bottle. The worlds first Smartbottle!
STRETCH GOALS
If we can hit $16,000 by next Friday, July 26th, then we will add a 6th color to our cap lineup... of your choice!

$40,000 - The first 100 backers $31 and above get bumped up to the ULTIMATE level for free! (ILUMI with end cap color of your choice, ILUMI I HELPED MAKE THIS HAPPEN t-shirt, ILUMI stickers, thank you email from the crew, AND listed as an ULTIMATE SUPPORTER on our website!)

We have smart phones, smart watches, and smart tvs, so why not a smartbottle!? The ILUMI Bottle is the first and only of its kind in the world! With ILUMI and our free app you can connect via Bluetooth, enter your weight, get a water intake recommendation, set reminders and notifications, track your overall weight loss and hydration, see your bodies estimated hydration level based off of how much you have drank updated live from your ILUMI, and get important facts and news about water and hydration! (ILUMI will MSRP at $70 in stores so help spread the word and get it for half the cost!)

EASY TO USE
ILUMI is extremely easy to use. There is only one button... The ON/OFF button! It easily connects to your bluetooth capable device and integrates with our straightforward, easy to use, free app. No complicated manuals or diagrams to figure out!

You set your goal on your device under the ""Settings"" tab, then click ""Save and Update"" to send it to your ILUMI... You are ready to start drinking! ILUMI's LED ring will slowly change colors as you drink from red to yellow to green indicating how close you are to your goal and our app will send you notifications to update you live as well!

HOW IT WORKS                                                                                      ILUMI comes with a flow sensor built in to the lip of the bottle. When you take a drink, ILUMI automatically registers how much water you took in during your sip and then updates its LED ring to the right colors. At the same time it will sync with your phone over Bluetooth so that you can get a live update and know exactly how much water you have taken in.
When you reach your goal you will get a notification on your phone stating you have hit your goal for the day and ILUMI's ring will be completely green.

The ILUMI is powered by a rechargeable battery which currently is estimated to have a lifespan of 2-3 days (we are working to increase this). There is a plug on the bottom of the cap where you can hook the cord in to charge your ILUMI when it starts to get low.
MADE IN THE USA
ILUMI will be made in the USA and we are proud of it! Support US jobs and economic growth! We are located in Boise, ID.

GUARANTEED FOR LIFE
If anything on your ILUMI ever breaks, we will be happy to replace any part for free as part of our LIFETIME GUARANTEE. No questions asked.

MULTIPLE COLOR OPTIONS
Multiple cap colors currently available and more to be added soon! Current colors are: Red, Blue, Lime Green, Orange, and Pink.

ILUMI ECONOMIC AND GREEN INITIATIVE
ILUMI is made entirely with recycled BPA-free plastic. We are dedicated to preserving the planet and its wildlife, reducing our economic dependancy on foreign oil, and providing US jobs.
Some interesting facts:
-The US uses 1500 plastic bottles every SECOND! 80% of these end up in a landfill even with our current recycling programs.
-17 MILLION barrels of oil are used to produce bottled water every year!
-Pre-bottled water costs us 1,000 times more than drinking tap water!

By using an ILUMI bottle you are helping to eliminate the buildup in our landfills that will be there for hundreds of years to come! We use recycled BPA-free plastic  in all of our bottles, thereby helping to lower dependency on foreign oil and preserve our fossil fuels longer. You will also be helping to create new US jobs.

ERGONOMIC SHAPE
It's like your hand was made to carry it. ILUMI fits perfectly in everyone's hand.  Our unique tapered lip and depressed threads ensure you never spill water when taking a drink.

HEALTH AND FITNESS FOCUSED
2 out of 3 people do not drink enough water a day to support the needed functions of their body. Hydration is vital for your health, there is a reason 50-65% of your body is made of water. Water is used to transport nutrients, minerals, amino acids, and other extremely important items around your body. If you do not keep hydrated you are much more prone to becoming sick, catching a disease, and it has even been reported that women will experience mood swings due to dehydration. It is key to be able to keep track of how much water you are taking in daily.
That is why we developed the ILUMI bottle, to help battle the dehydration epidemic that is facing humans.
Besides water ILUMI can also be used for people that drink protein shakes or any other type of liquid. You set the goal so you have complete control over how you use it!

FITS INTO CUP HOLDERS
Sleek compact design fits easily into the majority of car cup holders.

INNOVATIVE DESIGN
The ILUMI's lip is the first of its kind with a taper and depressed threads, and the bottle body is sleek enough that anyone can carry it! It has a larger capacity with over 24 ounces, a unique look, plus it is the worlds ONLY smartbottle! You will never want to go back to your old bottle! You aren't like everyone else so shouldn't your bottle be just as unique?
We need your help!

We have spent a large amount of time and a good amount of money developing ILUMI.  Now we need your help to fund our tooling costs and be our initial purchase order. Even if you cannot donate help us out by spreading the word! Click like or tweet above or click this link: http://clicktotweet.com/N3xOa.
PRODUCTION OUTLINE

We have worked almost everything out and we are ready to be funded! All stages have extra time added to provide for setbacks (if any). If everything goes smoothly you could be enjoying your ILUMI even sooner than estimated! As soon as Mid October! Consistent updates on where we are at will be provided to all of our backers!

SPECS:
Capacity: 24 ounces (709.77ml)
Weight: 0.68 lbs 
Dimensions: 10 inches tall by 2.5 inches wide
Origin: Designed and made in the USA!
Materials: The entire bottle is made from RECYCLED BPA-free plastic.
Warranty: Guaranteed for Life.  We will replace any part at any time
Dishwasher safe: The bottle itself is dishwasher safe. Because of the electronic components, the cap should be washed by hand.
THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!
Risks and challenges

As with any new project there are always potential obstacles, However, we believe that we covered all our bases and then some. If anything does arise we have already added cushion time to all phases of our plan so your estimated delivery time should not be affected. If everything goes as planned you could actually get your ILUMI up to a month early! We plan to remain completely transparent with our backers throughout the entire “kickstarter to shipping” process. Your funding will go straight to manufacturing costs and shipping.

Thanks for your support!

It's been almost 2 months since I returned to the United States after spending a year overseas on a missions trip called The World Race. And it was one of the hardest, most incredible adventures I've ever been on with the Lord. But during the last year, the Lord has taught me so many things.

One of the biggest takeaways for me on the Race, outside of having my identity as a daughter of the King firmly rooted and established in my heart, was that I have a voice that is both powerful and carries authority. And it is coupled with a deep conviction to live out Proverbs 31:8-9: “Open your mouth for the mute, for the rights of all who are destitute. Open your mouth and judge righteously. Defend the rights of the poor and needy.”

Over the last year, the Lord has been calling me out of hiding and calling me out of silence. And I believe that He is calling me to use my voice to fight against oppression and injustice. To open my mouth and speak up for those whose voices have been stripped away. For those who have lost the will to fight for themselves. That is the Lord’s call on my life and I believe that He is calling me to Beauty from Ashes Ministries to begin living that out.
 
Before this year, I’d never really had a heart for women. In fact, after spending four years attending a women’s college, I was quite sick of hearing people talk about women’s right and fighting against women’s oppression. But during this past year, the Lord began to break my heart for women, specifically those trapped in the sex industry and the sex trade.

While in the Philippines, I got the opportunity and distinct privilege of working with a ministry called Wipe Every Tear. While there, I lived with women who had been bought, sold, and forced into the sex trade. Women who had been betrayed by the very people who were supposed to love, care for, and protect them. I met girls on the street who looked like they had barely hit puberty. 12 and 13-year olds who climbed into cars with grown men who took them to God knows where for the night.

And my heart broke. And it still breaks. Because they are worth SO. MUCH. MORE. They were created for more. They were designed for more. They were made for freedom. Radical, life-altering, liberating freedom. The kind of freedom that sets others free. And more than anything, I desire for their hearts to be set free.

That is my desire for my own heart as well and what I hope to acquire by interning at BFA. My desire is to spend another year being discipled and working in an environment where the truth about my worth and my value will continue to be ingrained in my own heart and where I will be pushed to deeper levels of freedom in Christ.

In doing so, my prayer is that the Lord would use me, my story, and my voice to pour into the lives of the women I get to meet over the next year and that they would encounter the God of the universe who desperately longs to fulfill the promises of Isaiah 61 in their lives.
If you would like to be a part of this journey and join in on the fight to rescue women from the sex trade, please check out My Campaign and pray about what God would have your role to be.
Financial Breakdown  and Deadlines
<ul>
<li>
$1250/month (Rent, Utilities, Food, Gas, Ministry Supplies)
<li>
September 30th - $4000 (This will cover the first 3 months and get me moved to Fort Myers)
<li>
December 31st- $8000 (total raised)
<li>
March 31st- $12,000 (total raised)
<li>
June 30th- $15,000 (total raised)

In fact, after spending four years attending a women’s college, I was quite sick of hearing people talk about women’s right and fighting against women’s oppression. But during this past year, the Lord began to break my heart for women, specifically those trapped in the sex industry and the sex trade.

While in the Philippines, I got the opportunity and distinct privilege of working with a ministry called Wipe Every Tear. While there, I lived with women who had been bought, sold, and forced into the sex trade. Women who had been betrayed by the very people who were supposed to love, care for, and protect them. I met girls on the street who looked like they had barely hit puberty. 12 and 13-year olds who climbed into cars with grown men who took them to God knows where for the night.

And my heart broke. And it still breaks. Because they are worth SO. MUCH. MORE. They were created for more. They were designed for more. They were made for freedom. Radical, life-altering, liberating freedom. The kind of freedom that sets others free. And more than anything, I desire for their hearts to be set free.

That is my desire for my own heart as well and what I hope to acquire by interning at BFA. My desire is to spend another year being discipled and working in an environment where the truth about my worth and my value will continue to be ingrained in my own heart and where I will be pushed to deeper levels of freedom in Christ.

In doing so, my prayer is that the Lord would use me, my story, and my voice to pour into the lives of the women I get to meet over the next year and that they would encounter the God of the universe who desperately longs to fulfill the promises of Isaiah 61 in their lives.
If you would like to be a part of this journey and join in on the fight to rescue women from the sex trade, please check out My Campaign and pray about what God would have your role to be.

$1250/month (Rent, Utilities, Food, Gas, Ministry Supplies)
September 30th - $4000 (This will cover the first 3 months and get me moved to Fort Myers)
December 31st- $8000 (total raised)
March 31st- $12,000 (total raised)
June 30th- $15,000 (total raised)",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

A HOME for HEALING


Imagine…
                    your home burns to the ground...
                                                                                  and you are left with nothing.
Imagine…
                   an earthquake takes out your entire home…
                                                                                  and you are left with nothing.
Imagine…
                   a hurricane rips your home to pieces…
                                                                                  and you are left with nothing.

This does happen.
This is why we have insurance.  
You count your blessings.
You hold your family members close.
You watch the sun continues to rise every morning.
You replace what was lost.
It's not easy.  
Life goes on.  

Now... Imagine being left with less than nothing.

Imagine insurance does not recognize or cover whatever happened to you and your family.

I don’t have to imagine this – my family and I lived this!

My passion, my mission, is to help others in similar situations as I was – to have a safe environment in which to heal.  

Our Story

In 2011, we lost our home and all of our belongings to toxic mold.  Much like a fire, we were suddenly made homeless and we lost most of our belongings.

Insurance did not cover any of the loss.  
Medical insurance did not cover much of the treatment.  
Financially it was crippling... but we made it through.  
We had each other.
We rebuilt our home and our life.


Our Mission

Not everyone has the ability to do what is needed.
Not everyone has the knowledge to do what we did.

We want to change this!

This is not about us.  
This is about helping other people in similar situations.

We cannot do this alone.

Imagine if it was you.
Imagine it was someone you know or love.  

We need your help!


What it looked like for us

When we left our house with nothing, our 12 year old son was in a wheelchair, throwing up every day and having seizures, facial tics, extreme pain and fatigue.  His white blood cell count was dangerously low and there were many days we thought we might lose him.  

We lived in a toxic house for 4 1/2 years before we figured out mold was what was making us sick.  I had been hospitalized 4 times and been to dozens of doctors.  None of these doctors ever suspected or suggested toxic mold might be making me sick.

After getting to the lowest of lows, I now KNOW this was the cause behind my chronic illness and my son's near death experience.

The road to recovery was long.

For 10 1/2 months, we lived between motel rooms and tents while my husband worked nights and weekends to fix our home.  He suited up in a full hazmat suit and a moldex 9000 mask and did whatever it took to make our home livable.  I was so sick I couldn't help him physically – I did all the research.  Recovery and remediation wasn't easy.  It wasn't cheap.  It took a lot of hard work and a lot of money.  

We did it.  We refinanced our home and we are all back to happy, healthy, productive lives.

What do we do now?

I help other people with similar situations. I am one person with a passion to help others who do not have the knowledge or the resources.

I am looking for others to stand with me.

First we confirm whether mold is making the person sick. We do a mold test on their home. The next step is to get out of the home that is making them sick.  They cannot bring anything with them.  

This is what I have asked you to imagine. It’s not something easily done.  

Where do they go?

Many stay in the home that is causing their health challenges.

This is what I am on a mission to change.  

No doctor in the world can help a person get well if they continue to live in a home that is poisoning them.

Most people I help have been sick a long time.  
They are so sick by the time I find them that they cannot work.  
They cannot function in society as most people do.  
Most days they cannot make it out of bed.  
Many have trouble making a meal, showering and doing simple everyday tasks.
The longer they stay in their home, the sicker they get.  
Some die. God Bless!
Some get out and they find they cannot recover.  
They are already too sick from the toxins.  
They are in constant pain, have vertigo, light sensitivity, migraines, insomnia, fatigue, neuropathy, seizures, nausea, confusion, dyslexia, and some have been diagnosed with cancer, pancreatitis, heart disease, strokes, MS….so many diagnoses I cannot list them all.   

Whether they own or rent...with no job... no income...leaving the home they do have seems insurmountable.  Living in a tent is inconceivable for someone who is barely surviving day to day.  


THE SOLUTION

Establish a safe house where people affected by toxic mold have a place to go to, to get well.  

A Home for Healing

My long term goal is to raise millions – creating safe houses for healing across this country.

Right now we need $75,000

This will be enough to establish one mold safe home.
One family would stay in the house at a time.
It will include equipment needed for rehabilitation.
An outer building will be set up to house the tools which assist with detox.
It would need to include the necessities needed by the family to live.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get
We will begin with ONE safe healing home:

column1: • Our first home will be in upstate NY, close to the Vermont border.  The air is clean and there are a few houses available for under $50,000.

• We have a house under contract, and have done an ERMI (mold test) on it. 
    If this test is acceptable we will move forward on this house.  If not we will find another house.  It's a buyer's market.

• To make it livable for someone who is chemically sensitive, we will use no VOC paints and Vermont Natural Coatings polyurethane on the woodwork.  There will be other specialty building materials and procedures ($5,000-$10,000)
• Pre and post testing for mold, Volatile Organic Compounds and formaldehyde ($2,000)
• We will have HEPA air filters in all the living spaces, a HEPA vacuum... as well as Propolis diffusers to clean the air. ($2,000)
• We need to furnish the living area with chemical free furniture and bedding.  Buy new clothing, shoes and other necessities for 1-2 people. ($3,000-$6,000)
• Most Importantly, we will provide a sauna for sweating the toxins out and supplements to aid in the detoxing.  ($5,000-10,000)
• If we EXCEED our goal... the excess will go toward future family necessities, housing expenses and additional housing.

• I would like to be able to provide housing RENT FREE or on a sliding scale according to what an individual or family can reasonably afford or can get assistance with... the cost for future residents is dependent on donations.

• Right now we are NOT a non profit... donations are not tax deductible and we will pay taxes on any donations.  I would like to establish a non profit organization ($3,700) under the name ""Global Homes for Healing.

The Global Impact
The goal here is to save as many lives as possible.  Environmental Illness (EI) is a silent epidemic.  People are getting poisoned in their homes and offices and they need safe places to live, detox and ultimately heal.
<li>Future projects may include tiny houses, porcelain trailers, land
purchases, community initiatives, and more environmentally friendly
housing.
<li>I have partnered with real estate investors who are
teaching me what they know so that we can build a network of safe havens
across the United States, Canada and eventually around the world.
Learn more about Environmental Illness:
<li>
Department of Defense, Chapter 34 Trichothecene Mycotoxins - this is the document with stated symptoms cited in the video.

• Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
• Get the word out and make some noise about our quest to save lives.
• Use the Indiegogo share tools!
• Share on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus and other social networks
• Email your friends

• If you know any real estate investors, have them get in touch with me.  I am looking to network around the globe to help people everywhere find safe housing and repair their existing housing which have made them sick.
• If you have ideas, ""perks"" or give away items that can enhance our project, please contact Heather at help at moldsupport.org (email), or through the comments.

Daily practice of the Tibetan rites will provide students and staff with many benefits to health.  It is my hope and expectation that the whole community will benefit from my little studio.

Up to a dozen good quality part-time jobs per studio.

Free, or nearly free classes for recovering addicts in a recognized program.
Risks &
column2:
ChallengesThe biggest challenge is to ensure that there are enough students to make the studio viable. 

It has been my experience that the one thing that will consistently generate a large amount of interest is the possibility of getting a good job.  Assistant Teacher at Tew Tibetan Studio is a very good job indeed, and I believe that possibility will be sufficient to ensure a steady stream of new students, all of whom will benefit from the technique, and some of whom will be able to earn good money, and receive the significant improvements in health which result from daily practice.

column1:

Please, share this project with people you know who would benefit from daily yoga practice.

Short Summary

• My name is Emily Hahn and I am currently a Junior at the University of Central Oklahoma. I play on the university soccer team here, and soccer has always been a passion in my life. I first felt the Lord calling my to use my passion beyond the limits of my city when I got to college. Ever since then the Lord has continuously urged me to step outside of my comfort zone and use the gift he has given me to glorify his name globally.

• On this mission trip to Telpaneca, Nicaragua, I will lead a soccer camp for the children of the city with the help of others, and my prayer is that through their love for soccer the children can see the love their Lord has for them!
• In order to do this I not only need prayers from everyone, but I also need funding to GO for the Lord!

What I Need

Break it down for folks in more detail:

• The funding for this trip goes to my plane ticket, all extra travel costs, food in the village for the week, and the church we will be sleeping in for the week. I need $1,000 in addition to the $600 I have already raised. None of the money will personally go in my pocket, it is all towards the mission trip.
<li><span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
• This trip is not about me. It is about bringing the powerful love of the Lord to this remote village in Nicaragua. This trip can help impact the lives of hundreds of people in such positive ways!
• I have in the past led soccer camps here in the United States, and cannot wait to take my experience and what I have learned to Nicaragua.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

• If you could please pray that the Lord does marvelous works through this medical missions team on this trip. Pray the Lord guides the hands and hearts of everyone involved and shows himself to the people of Nicaragua!
• Please use the indiegogo.com share tools!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a="""">Hi everyone, my name is Rebecca and I hope that you will
take a few moments to read Heather’s story and see what you can do help her
beat Lyme disease. I urge you all to watch the video above.
Heather's friend Vicki has kindly donated her time to help you all
understand more about Lyme disease and the battle that Heather is

fighting.

Heather is a gifted photographer and you can view her work can be viewed here:
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl

Heather
was diagnosed with Lyme disease in 2012 after years
of misdiagnosis. It took roughly 100 doctors, specialists, and hospital
visits
to finally be given a correct diagnosis for her illness. I have
personally witnessed the tragic effects of Lyme in Heather with my own
eyes. I have seen her at her very best and her very worst.
If a patient knows that they have been bitten by a tick
and seek immediate treatment protocol in Canada will allow the doctor to treat
the patient with a course of antibiotics for a few weeks and the patient will recover.
However, not everyone bitten by a tick will have the classic “bullseye” shaped
rash that commonly accompanies a tick bite. If the patient does not know they
have been bitten the tick will then infect its host with bacteria and the end
result can be catastrophic.
When Lyme reaches the chronic state it has the ability to
attack the joints, muscles, heart, brain and organs. Lyme is a great impostor, mimicking
symptoms of other up to 300 other illnesses such as cancer, lupus, MS,
fibromyalgia, arthritis, cardiac disease, brain tumor, Alzheimer’s, mono and Epstein
Barr just to name a few. Diagnosing Lyme disease is a long and terrifying road.
Lyme testing and treatment protocol in Canada is severely
outdated. The blood tests available often return a false negative and patients
go on to suffer without answers while their health rapidly deteriorates. Many
doctors will tell the patient that the symptoms are all in their head and
should see a psychiatrist.
Protocol in Canada states that doctors should either treat
as they see fit or do nothing as statements from infectious disease departments
insist that chronic Lyme doesn't exist. This is because patients suspected of
having chronic Lyme failed to recover after being treated with the basic course
of antibiotics. The failure to recover is due to the fact that the patients did
not receive the correct antibiotics, the correct dosage or the correct amount
of time to allow the antibiotics to work. Lyme also brings with it many
co-infections. If these infections are not isolated and treated the patient
will not make any improvement. The Lyme bacteria is corkscrew shaped giving it
the perfect defense, <b>it has the ability to drill into the muscles, joints and
organs and hang on for as long as it possibly can, reproducing and spreading in
the process.

Doctors in Canada have lost their license for treating patients with long term antibiotics for Lyme. Doctors can and will refuse to see a patient once it is discovered that they have chronic Lyme even if the patient is seeking help for something completely unrelated to Lyme. This is why many patients, Heather included, have to seek treatment from Lyme literate doctors in the USA and pay out of pocket for their treatment.

Heather spent 4 years in excruciating physical pain and her body began to breakdown and deteriorate. She had hundreds of doctor appointments, emergency transport by ambulance to hospitals, meetings with neurosurgeons, MRI scans, xrays, CT scans, infectious disease consultations, painful procedures and tests all resulting in no answers. Time and time again her symptoms were blamed on anxiety.

In 2009 Heather had a gym membership, she hiked, walked five miles a day, she spent time in nature and has produced some of the most breathtaking works of art and photography I have ever seen. Now she becomes fatigued so quickly she can’t walk more than 20 minutes at a time. She has difficulty breathing, chest pain, migraines, severe joint pain and stiffness, cognitive impairment resulting in brain fog, difficulty communicating and finding the right words to express herself. Her body swells head to toe with edema, she requires help with household chores, cooking, cleaning and getting to medical appointments. She has experienced hair loss, chronic sore throat, searing neck pain, sensitivity to light and sound, numbness and tingling in her body. She has panic attacks, dental problems, several bouts with shingles resulting in nerve damage, sleep apnea, and most recently she has started to suffer from possible partial seizures. She is awaiting a proper diagnosis for the strange out of body experiences. Heather describes it as ""being trapped between two worlds"" or feeling like she is falling out of her body. It goes without saying that this is a terrifying situation and they can strike without warning at any time.

Heather started making good progress with her Lyme treatment and became 50% better over time thanks to her wonderful Lyme doctor and health team in Canada. Heather was on the same antibiotics for 18 months only to suffer a serious decline in March 2014. Heather was bitten by an unknown bug causing her ankle to swell double its size and turn red with intense itching. She was taken to hospital emergency three times in the span of a week and received no help, no treatment, no diagnosis. She went from  being 50% better to 10% with 80% of her Lyme symptoms returning.

Heather desperately needs your help. Her health is declining at an alarming rate. Her body no longer responds to her current course of antibiotics and she is now having to take even stronger antibiotics with incredibly alarming side effects and herxheimer reaction while the antibiotics do their job. It is possible that Heather is going to get much worse before she gets better. Heather is allergic to most antibiotics and it is currently unknown if she will have a life threatening reaction to these new drugs. Heather is unable to work due to her health and has no blood family to support her. She relies on the few close friends to help her get through when possible but we cannot do it all on our own. We need your help.
As of June 2015 Heather received information
from blood tests that her liver enzymes are elevated. She began to experience
severe back pain and feeling like someone had beat in her kidneys. Alone and
afraid Heather went to the hospital. Her pain was ignored by hospital staff
even when it made it impossible for her to walk. Eventually she was given an
injection of an unknown substance, doctors would not tell her what she had been
injected with. Heather informed the hospital staff that her liver enzymes are
elevated however they refused to run any further blood tests. She was told that
she made the decision as a Canadian to seek health care in the United States
and she decided to take all these antibiotics so she can just go back to the
USA for medical care. Heather has been denied treatmet yet again in her home
country. Since this hospital visit Heather was able to have blood tests ran
elsewhere and found out that her liver enzymes have doubled since the first
test.
Heather has it in her to fight but we need your help to keep the fight going. Even for the cost of a beer or a cup of coffee you can help save a life.
July 4th 2012 CBC News ran a story on Lyme featuring Heather.
November 20th 2012 Heather was featured inThe Ward Ottawa's Health Weekly to discuss her battle with Lyme.
May 10th 2013 the Ottawa Citizen featured an article on Lyme including Heather's story.
March 3rd 2014 CTV News Ottawa featured a story on Lyme in Canada and included Heather in their report.
Here we have a YouTube video featuring Heather on what it's like to live with Lyme.
WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Donating and sharing this campaign on social media.
PERKS:

$5 emailed photograph:
a photograph of Heather holding a thank you note with your name on it emailed to you.

$15 handmade card:
A handmade wildlife thank you card with a hand written note to you written by Heather snail mailed to your door.

$20 audio/voice email from Heather:
A one-two minute audio/voice email of Heather thanking you and acknowledging gratitude for your help.

$40 photography print:
A 8x8, 8x10 or 8x12 photograph, your choice from the 'gallery' tab on her website
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your choice of print. Please do not order off Redbubble. We will take your requests, professionally print and snail mail them to your door. 

$50 personal video:
A personal thank you video made especially for you from Heather and myself as well as a personal handmade card/written note snail mailed to your door.

$100 LARGE photographic print:
A 12x12, 11x14 or 12x18 signed photographic print of your choice from the pictures/gallery on here or Heather's gallery at 
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
snail mailed to your door. 
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your photographic choice, do not order off Redbubble. We will professionally print and snail mail the beautiful signed print to your door.

$250 photographic prints:
Ten 8x8, 8x10, 8x12 photographic prints of your choice snail mailed directly to your door! You can choose from the photos in the gallery here or on Heather's website 
www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirl
PLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your choice of print. Do not order off Redbubble. We will professionally print and snail mail your photographs directly to your door.

$1000 mechanic/electrician/welder
If you live in the Ottawa/Montreal area Heather's friend has 20 years experience as a plumber/electrician/welder and he would work for you for a day doing whatever repairs/renovations you wish.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
If you can’t contribute financially, we understand. Spreading the word through social media can make a profound difference.

When out in nature always check yourself, your loved ones, and your pets for ticks. They are small, about the size of a poppy seed. Always wear insect repellent containing DEET when hiking, camping, spending any time out in nature where ticks can be found. Ticks are spreading rapidly across Canada and the United States. A tick check could save your life.

Monthly costs in Canada (all out of pocket):

-travel expenses to medical appointments, specialists, etc. $200
-vitamins, supplements, tinctures, specific probiotics $500
- chiropractic / naturopathic / acupuncture treatment $1000

Every 3 months trip to USA:

-travel expenses $100
-doctor visits $500
-antibiotics $1500-$2500

Please help us change the life of dear Heather.

If you need to get in touch please email Rebecca at snowymomma777@yahoo.ca
It would also be helpful if you select a perk to also email the address above with your name and shipping information so we do not forget you!
","Hi everyone, my name is Rebecca and I hope that you will
take a few moments to read Heather’s story and see what you can do help her
beat Lyme disease. I urge you all to watch the video above.
Heather's friend Vicki has kindly donated her time to help you all
understand more about Lyme disease and the battle that Heather is
fighting.Heather is a gifted photographer and you can view her work can be viewed here:www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirlHeather
was diagnosed with Lyme disease in 2012 after years
of misdiagnosis. It took roughly 100 doctors, specialists, and hospital
visits
to finally be given a correct diagnosis for her illness. I have
personally witnessed the tragic effects of Lyme in Heather with my own
eyes. I have seen her at her very best and her very worst.
If a patient knows that they have been bitten by a tick
and seek immediate treatment protocol in Canada will allow the doctor to treat
the patient with a course of antibiotics for a few weeks and the patient will recover.
However, not everyone bitten by a tick will have the classic “bullseye” shaped
rash that commonly accompanies a tick bite. If the patient does not know they
have been bitten the tick will then infect its host with bacteria and the end
result can be catastrophic.
When Lyme reaches the chronic state it has the ability to
attack the joints, muscles, heart, brain and organs. Lyme is a great impostor, mimicking
symptoms of other up to 300 other illnesses such as cancer, lupus, MS,
fibromyalgia, arthritis, cardiac disease, brain tumor, Alzheimer’s, mono and Epstein
Barr just to name a few. Diagnosing Lyme disease is a long and terrifying road.
Lyme testing and treatment protocol in Canada is severely
outdated. The blood tests available often return a false negative and patients
go on to suffer without answers while their health rapidly deteriorates. Many
doctors will tell the patient that the symptoms are all in their head and
should see a psychiatrist.
Protocol in Canada states that doctors should either treat
as they see fit or do nothing as statements from infectious disease departments
insist that chronic Lyme doesn't exist. This is because patients suspected of
having chronic Lyme failed to recover after being treated with the basic course
of antibiotics. The failure to recover is due to the fact that the patients did
not receive the correct antibiotics, the correct dosage or the correct amount
of time to allow the antibiotics to work. Lyme also brings with it many
co-infections. If these infections are not isolated and treated the patient
will not make any improvement. The Lyme bacteria is corkscrew shaped giving it
the perfect defense, it has the ability to drill into the muscles, joints and
organs and hang on for as long as it possibly can, reproducing and spreading in
the process.

Doctors in Canada have lost their license for treating patients with long term antibiotics for Lyme. Doctors can and will refuse to see a patient once it is discovered that they have chronic Lyme even if the patient is seeking help for something completely unrelated to Lyme. This is why many patients, Heather included, have to seek treatment from Lyme literate doctors in the USA and pay out of pocket for their treatment.

Heather spent 4 years in excruciating physical pain and her body began to breakdown and deteriorate. She had hundreds of doctor appointments, emergency transport by ambulance to hospitals, meetings with neurosurgeons, MRI scans, xrays, CT scans, infectious disease consultations, painful procedures and tests all resulting in no answers. Time and time again her symptoms were blamed on anxiety.

In 2009 Heather had a gym membership, she hiked, walked five miles a day, she spent time in nature and has produced some of the most breathtaking works of art and photography I have ever seen. Now she becomes fatigued so quickly she can’t walk more than 20 minutes at a time. She has difficulty breathing, chest pain, migraines, severe joint pain and stiffness, cognitive impairment resulting in brain fog, difficulty communicating and finding the right words to express herself. Her body swells head to toe with edema, she requires help with household chores, cooking, cleaning and getting to medical appointments. She has experienced hair loss, chronic sore throat, searing neck pain, sensitivity to light and sound, numbness and tingling in her body. She has panic attacks, dental problems, several bouts with shingles resulting in nerve damage, sleep apnea, and most recently she has started to suffer from possible partial seizures. She is awaiting a proper diagnosis for the strange out of body experiences. Heather describes it as ""being trapped between two worlds"" or feeling like she is falling out of her body. It goes without saying that this is a terrifying situation and they can strike without warning at any time.

Heather started making good progress with her Lyme treatment and became 50% better over time thanks to her wonderful Lyme doctor and health team in Canada. Heather was on the same antibiotics for 18 months only to suffer a serious decline in March 2014. Heather was bitten by an unknown bug causing her ankle to swell double its size and turn red with intense itching. She was taken to hospital emergency three times in the span of a week and received no help, no treatment, no diagnosis. She went from  being 50% better to 10% with 80% of her Lyme symptoms returning.

Heather desperately needs your help. Her health is declining at an alarming rate. Her body no longer responds to her current course of antibiotics and she is now having to take even stronger antibiotics with incredibly alarming side effects and herxheimer reaction while the antibiotics do their job. It is possible that Heather is going to get much worse before she gets better. Heather is allergic to most antibiotics and it is currently unknown if she will have a life threatening reaction to these new drugs. Heather is unable to work due to her health and has no blood family to support her. She relies on the few close friends to help her get through when possible but we cannot do it all on our own. We need your help.
As of June 2015 Heather received information
from blood tests that her liver enzymes are elevated. She began to experience
severe back pain and feeling like someone had beat in her kidneys. Alone and
afraid Heather went to the hospital. Her pain was ignored by hospital staff
even when it made it impossible for her to walk. Eventually she was given an
injection of an unknown substance, doctors would not tell her what she had been
injected with. Heather informed the hospital staff that her liver enzymes are
elevated however they refused to run any further blood tests. She was told that
she made the decision as a Canadian to seek health care in the United States
and she decided to take all these antibiotics so she can just go back to the
USA for medical care. Heather has been denied treatmet yet again in her home
country. Since this hospital visit Heather was able to have blood tests ran
elsewhere and found out that her liver enzymes have doubled since the first
test.
Heather has it in her to fight but we need your help to keep the fight going. Even for the cost of a beer or a cup of coffee you can help save a life.
July 4th 2012 CBC News ran a story on Lyme featuring Heather.
November 20th 2012 Heather was featured inThe Ward Ottawa's Health Weekly to discuss her battle with Lyme.
May 10th 2013 the Ottawa Citizen featured an article on Lyme including Heather's story.
March 3rd 2014 CTV News Ottawa featured a story on Lyme in Canada and included Heather in their report.
Here we have a YouTube video featuring Heather on what it's like to live with Lyme.
WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Donating and sharing this campaign on social media.

Please do not order off Redbubble. We will take your requests, professionally print and snail mail them to your door. $50 personal video:A personal thank you video made especially for you from Heather and myself as well as a personal handmade card/written note snail mailed to your door.

We will professionally print and snail mail the beautiful signed print to your door.

You can choose from the photos in the gallery here or on Heather's website www.redbubble.com/people/locustgirlPLEASE EMAIL ME DIRECTLY with your choice of print. Do not order off Redbubble. We will professionally print and snail mail your photographs directly to your door.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
If you can’t contribute financially, we understand. Spreading the word through social media can make a profound difference.

When out in nature always check yourself, your loved ones, and your pets for ticks. They are small, about the size of a poppy seed. Always wear insect repellent containing DEET when hiking, camping, spending any time out in nature where ticks can be found. Ticks are spreading rapidly across Canada and the United States. A tick check could save your life.

Monthly costs in Canada (all out of pocket): -travel expenses to medical appointments, specialists, etc. $200 -vitamins, supplements, tinctures, specific probiotics $500 - chiropractic / naturopathic / acupuncture treatment $1000 Every 3 months trip to USA:
