","Summary

Worldwide, an estimated 15 million babies are born too soon every year. That is more than one in 10 babies. Around 1 million children die each year due to complications of preterm birth. Many survivors face a lifetime of disability, including learning disabilities and visual and hearing problems. Globally, prematurity is the leading cause of newborn deaths (babies in the first four weeks of life) and the second leading cause of death after pneumonia in children under the age of five.Preterm birth occurs for a variety of reasons. Common causes of preterm birth include multiple pregnancies, infections and chronic conditions, such as diabetes and high blood pressure
column2: however, often no cause is identified. There is also a genetic influence. Our scientists are trying to understand of the causes and mechanisms that will advance the development of treatments to prevent preterm birth.

column1: What We Need & What You Get We need funds to enable research to continue at The Women's Health Research Centre at Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea Hospital. All funds raised will go directly to the centre to support the Prematurity Research Theme. This includes researching ways to predict the onset of Early Preterm labour, research into the role of vaginal microbiome in premature labour and research to understand the risk of preterm labour due to cervical precancer and treatment.
Please help fund this vital research.
For every donation of £20 and over you will receive a Family Portrait Voucher worth £160.00 for Barrett & Coe Photographic Studios. There are 28 outlets throughout the UK. Barrett & Coe
Our Impact

Our track record in this research area is exemplary. Our research unit at Imperial College has been responsible for such successes as developing the cervical cancer smear test, development of preimplantation genetic diagnosis (PGD) and early work on the development of ultrasound.

Recent success stories in prematurity research includes for example the work Professor Bennett and his team who discovered that a protein system which controls gene expressed called ‘Activator Protein One’ plays a very important role in the onset of both term and preterm labour. Previous work funded by Genesis Research Trust undertaken by Professor Edwards and Professor Henrik Hagberg had already shown that Activator Protein One also plays a role in perinatal brain injury. A full description of our successful research is available here. Our achievements.
Other Ways You Can HelpYou can always sign up for one of our challenges and raise funds via sponsorship for the Genesis Research Trust. Our patron explains why here.
If you would like further information about our challenge events then go to our events page.
For instance if you would like to Trek Morocco with popstar Michelle Heaton then here's your chance. Trek Morocco May 2015.
If you are inspired by this cause please share with Indiegogo share tools below!",3.0,1,"1 Campaign
|","London, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/helping-life-begin/pica

My name is Nate, and I love life. But I haven't always. 

I love it so much that I have followed my dreams to pursue a career in linguistics, and am in the best place I have ever been in my life.
column5:
>However, all my life I have dealt with depression. It is kind of like an ogre that I've gotten used to following me around, sometimes trying to take me out of this game of life that I love, or confining me to my bed till two in the afternoon.

This past year when I was volunteering at a summer school for linguistics in North Dakota, that ugly monster of an ogre reared its head and put me in a hospital for three days as I was at risk of committing suicide. 

I got the help I needed, and everyone told me that I did the right thing.
column9:
>I stand by my decision to have gotten help when I needed it, but apparently my insurance company doesn't think so. 

When I received the bill in the mail, I was astounded to see that insurance did not consider my stay an emergency. I have appealed their decision multiple times and have made countless phone calls to try to resolve this. The hospital's charity declined to help me because I was not from North Dakota
column10:
everything has been so incredibly difficult. 

The closest hospital I could have gone to and been covered under insurance was thousands of miles away. Despite the fact that I have insurance that says they will provide out-of-network coverage in an emergency, I did not receive help from them.

I desperately need your help. I don't want to have to declare bankruptcy at 23 years of age because my insurance company does not consider suicide an emergency. I didn't choose depression, but I must deal with it. 

Anything you can give to help me will aid me in getting out from underneath the massive and crippling effects of this medical debt, as well as allow me to continue attending graduate school unfettered by the oppressive decisions of my insurance company.

I'm alone in this fight, and would love to have any support you can spare. 

Thank you.

Laura is fighting her second battle with breast cancer. She was first diagnosed with metastatic breast cancer in January of 2010. She went through radiation treatement. She had a reprieve and had some time without needing medical treatment and then in March of 2012 it returned and it is attacking her liver and in her bones.
Laura St. Jacques is a mom of 5 kids ages 9-18 and is fighting stage 4 metastatic breast cancer. This is a long term fight and the medical bills are catastrophic.
To add insult to injury on father's day their van was totalled in a a car accident and her daughter was lifeflighted to a nearby hospital. The stress just continues to mount...
Her husband, Robert St. Jacques is a history teacher and the medical insurance is not great with out of pocket expenses in the 10s of thousands.
Two of her young nieces ages 12 and 14, started a campaign to help their Aunt Laura with some overwhelming medical bills. They were able to raise $1,000 with some raffles, a 5k run and carnival.

They have made a dent in the amount needed, but there is still more needed to help this family. The medical bills are a heavy weight on her and her family and it is important that this stress doesn't interfere with her health and her battle through the chemo treatments and her time with her family. You can help make a difference in their lives and bring a little relief and sunshine for them.

Our goal of $25,000 is to help them cover some of these bills and give them some relief to continue the fight. This is the time for all of us to come together to make a difference for a family that is already to the limit.
Thank you for being a part of something wonderful.

Help us turn one shared Dream into a Reality...

Hello, we are Jake and Megan Guillen from Las Vegas, Nevada.  We have been together for five years, married for two and a half, and have shared a longtime desire to become parents - a desire that continues to grow more and more each and every day.  Unfortunately, the natural way of creating a life is out of the question for us.  The only way we (Megan) will be able to conceive is through donor sperm and IUI treatment.  Some days, the inability to become pregnant the natural way is bothersome to the both of us, but most days we support each other in staying positive and excited because there is still hope.  The hope of starting our own family and becoming the parents we have always dreamed of being is still alive
Aid that we need...
We need to raise $5,000 to get a start on the next chapter of our lives.  A breakdown of cost allocations is as follows:
<ul>
• $1,300 - two vials of donor sperm (the recommended minimum by our doctor)
• $200 - cost of return shipping on the tank that is used to deliver the donor sperm
• $1,750 - one IUI injection (crossing my fingers it only takes one!)
• $750 - fertility medication (Clomid), pre-prenatal vitamins, and prenatal vitamins
• $1,000 - co-pays for doctor office visits, pre injection and post injection tests/monitoring

The above listed is an approximate cost for one IUI injection treatment.  If a second and third IUI treatment, or an IVF treatment is needed, it will be an additional cost of somewhere between $2,000 and $10,000 more, so raising anything over our $5,000 goal mark will be a tremendous help!  Every dollar raised that doesn't end up needing to go towards IUI treatment(s) will be spent on purchasing high quality healthy foods for Megan during her pregnancy as well as getting items needed for our baby.
What your donation means...

There will never be enough words that could be put together to describe how grateful for and thankful we would forever be of your donation.  Even a $5 donation could change the world for us and make our dreams realities, every little bit helps!  Growing up as a Transgender person, Jake often times felt that he would never be comfortable with his body, be alone all his life, and forget the chance of a child ever knowing him as Dad.  Almost immediately after starting his transition, Jake began to see dramatic differences as his body changed into his true self.  Jake found a soul mate for life in Megan, and will never be alone.  With your help, Jake now has the opportunity to become the Dad he has always wanted to be and further his belief that there is hope out there for Transgender persons!  Five years ago, as a young 20 year old, Megan was convinced that her future would never include children because it simply wasn't a want of hers.  Three years ago, as a maturing 23 year old, Megan's wants started to change, and the idea of having children and becoming a Mom began to take over her brain!  A year and a half ago, the desire to have children burned deep inside both Megan and Jake, but was a long shot to happen due to stress related issues with Jake's transition and with Megan being at a very unhealthy weight.  Fast forward a year and a half to today, Jake is four years into his transition and has seen many of the stresses subside.  Megan has lost nearly 150 pounds, on her own, no weight surgeries!  She is currently the healthiest and most confident in herself that she has ever been.  Megan looks and feels like a completely different person  from the person she was less than two years ago - stunning and one of the most amazing self willed transformations ever.  We have stood together for five years while facing lots of adversity, accepting challenges, and jumping over hurdles.  We stand together today, stronger because of it, with an even greater desire for children, and truly believe that having a child is meant to be.  Your help, regardless of amount, will never be forgotten!
All forms of support are helpful...

Although financial support would benefit us the most, we understand that not everyone is able to provide that.  A key part in attaining our financial goal is getting the word of our campaign out and about.  If you are able to, please share word of our campaign with others that you may know, and encourage others to share with others and so on.  Indiegogo share tools are a fast and easy way to share our campaign with others, so please feel free to use them!  Also, feel free to share our story with any Transgender persons, overweight persons, or any persons in general that are feeling the struggles of life rip away at their hopes and dreams.  If Jake can overcome, and Megan can overcome, any and everyone can overcome!

Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
<ul>
• Introduce yourself and your background.
• Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
• Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.
Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<ul>
• Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.
• Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
• Describe where the funds go if you don’t reach your entire goal.
<div>
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>
• Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
• Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
• Make it real for people and build trust.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div> <h3>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column7: >BodyCount is the only private app tastefully dedicated to your reproductive health.  BodyCount will help you be more mindful and reflective when it comes to your sexual behaviors.  Use the app to keep track of partners, get detailed data and insights on testing and doctor's visits, and most importantly gain control over your intimate life.

column1:
• There are many apps out there to help you hook up, but none dedicated to your reproductive health
  • Being healthy is more important than being active, and shows respect for your partners, numerous or few
  • The app will help you to monitor your behaviors, remember important dates related to your sex life, and gain insights into your tastes, habits, and risk factors

What We Need 

Backing BodyCount will allow us to develop the basic functionality/working prototype of the app and build partnerships with public health institutions
• I am not a developer, the money will fund a working prototype/beta

• We want BC to be your one stop shop for reproductive health
  • Your support will allow us to expand the reach of the app, and awareness about reproductive health
  • Our end goal is simple
column2: to help people be more mindful about their sexual behaviors and create stunning visualizations of the aggregated data

column1:
The Impact

Sex is essential to our existence, yet it's often treated as a taboo subject in polite conversation.  While the details of specific acts are best shared among friends, gaining data-driven insights into your experiences and keeping track of the people with whom you share them is important.

• People in the U.S. lose their virginity at 17 and have between 5 and 16 partners on average.  In populous areas, the average number of sexual partners is even higher.   Though it's not always possible to remember everything, we learn and grow from these experiences.  BodyCount helps quantify that knowledge

• 83% of Americans look for health information online.  Mobile is an increasingly important channel: we will provide comprehensive, personalized, on-the-go access to sexual health information when and where people need it most
  • Keeping track of your sexual information will not only give you key health insights, but also help you learn more about your preferences and needs, giving you control and power to modify behaviors where appropriate
  • Another impetus for the project is the rise in AIDS cases among young people and the elderly.  The app will also inform you if your behaviors are risky, though getting tested for STIs is, of course, a personal choice
Key Features
<ul>
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Pin-secured login for people aged 18 and older (each time the app opens)

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
• Word tagging
<li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
• Data visualizations of metrics
• Journaling/notes
• Ability to track and measure information over time
• Partner/instance map
• Health alerts/notifications
• Access to sexual health information/guides
• Way-finding for public health centers
• *Body count is not a social network, but we want to provide user-to-user sharing of information between verified sexual partners
<h3 style=""font-weight: bold

column2: >Apps like these can easily be misused.  We've planned measures to ensure information remain private:

column1: <ul>
• Users are required to sign-in using a secure pin number
• Information can only be shared between two members who are logged in, and each instance requires members to consent to receiving information
• Users are able to block incoming notifications of other users that they don't want to communicate with
• Age verification required (18+)
• Shared information is only available for 1hr after opening
• Information shared with a user can not be passed on, or re-shared
<div>
The Future of Body Count: Public Health

The future of this app is uncertain, as things are somewhat experimental at the moment!  Our hope is to help people.  With that in mind we'd like to provide users with ability to link the app to their medical records:
<ul>
• Automate visit tracking and scheduling
• Share verified check-up results with partners
• Schedule doctor's visits within the app
<li>
<span style=""font-size: 16px
column3: >Ask questions, and get answers, to sexual health related issues

column1: • Prevent and detect potential epidemics (at the aggregate data level)
<div>
Sexual Exploration
There is also the possibility of using the app for responsible sexual exploration, via tagging and instance tracking:
<ul>
• Log and tag individual instances with the same partner
• Create micro journals of non sexual acts
• Track other intimate relationships, even those that were unconsummated
• Couple journals with other health information to more deeply explore individual needs/wants (or those of a partner)
• Build empathy and understanding with a long-term partner
• Use as a tool to rekindle passion as part of a comprehensive therapy program
What's In a Name?

BodyCount is an intentionally ironic play on words, re: Shakespeare, ""will live in your heart, die in your lap, and be buried in your eyes.""  It's a polysemic, double entendre that directly, and intentionally misrepresents the term ""quantified self"".  There were innumerable choices when naming this app, but we chose something that would make someone take pause and feel in hearing it, as uncomfortable as people often feel when talking about sex.
<h3><b>Risks &amp
I've been an analyst and digital strategist for my entire career, but I can't build this alone.  Finding the right group of developer/marketing partners is essential to the success of the project

• Time to market:  under funding will mean increased dev time/costs
  • Scale: depending on the popularity of the app it may be difficult for our small team to manage over time

<li>Perception: since introducing this concept there has been pushback from individuals that think that it's a seedy subject, at least a low-level degree harassment is anticipated (but truthfully it's nothing we can't manage
Other Ways You Can Help

• If you can't back the project, help us get the word out!  Post the campaign to your social media accounts, tell your friends in person, or simply drop me a line @artperson100 if you have questions, want to show support
• If you'd like to be involved with the data visualization/development drop us a line E: info@bodycount.me
• Credits:  Stock Photos for Mock-ups via http://imcreator.com/free

","BodyCount is the only private app tastefully dedicated to your reproductive health.  BodyCount will help you be more mindful and reflective when it comes to your sexual behaviors.  Use the app to keep track of partners, get detailed data and insights on testing and doctor's visits, and most importantly gain control over your intimate life.

There are many apps out there to help you hook up, but none dedicated to your reproductive health Being healthy is more important than being active, and shows respect for your partners, numerous or few The app will help you to monitor your behaviors, remember important dates related to your sex life, and gain insights into your tastes, habits, and risk factors

column1: The Impact Sex is essential to our existence, yet it's often treated as a taboo subject in polite conversation.  While the details of specific acts are best shared among friends, gaining data-driven insights into your experiences and keeping track of the people with whom you share them is important.

People in the U.S. lose their virginity at 17 and have between 5 and 16 partners on average.  In populous areas, the average number of sexual partners is even higher.   Though it's not always possible to remember everything, we learn and grow from these experiences.  BodyCount helps quantify that knowledge

83% of Americans look for health information online.  Mobile is an increasingly important channel: we will provide comprehensive, personalized, on-the-go access to sexual health information when and where people need it most Keeping track of your sexual information will not only give you key health insights, but also help you learn more about your preferences and needs, giving you control and power to modify behaviors where appropriate Another impetus for the project is the rise in AIDS cases among young people and the elderly.  The app will also inform you if your behaviors are risky, though getting tested for STIs is, of course, a personal choice
Key Features
Pin-secured login for people aged 18 and older (each time the app opens)
Private/secure storage of information
Word tagging
Image uploads
Data visualizations of metrics
Journaling/notes
Ability to track and measure information over time
Partner/instance map
Health alerts/notifications
Access to sexual health information/guides
Way-finding for public health centers
*Body count is not a social network, but we want to provide user-to-user sharing of information between verified sexual partners
Security and Privacy
Apps like these can easily be misused.  We've planned measures to ensure information remain private:
Users are required to sign-in using a secure pin number
Information can only be shared between two members who are logged in, and each instance requires members to consent to receiving information
Users are able to block incoming notifications of other users that they don't want to communicate with
Age verification required (18+)
Shared information is only available for 1hr after opening
Information shared with a user can not be passed on, or re-shared
The Future of Body Count: Public Health

The future of this app is uncertain, as things are somewhat experimental at the moment!  Our hope is to help people.  With that in mind we'd like to provide users with ability to link the app to their medical records:
Automate visit tracking and scheduling
Share verified check-up results with partners
Schedule doctor's visits within the app
Ask questions, and get answers, to sexual health related issues
Prevent and detect potential epidemics (at the aggregate data level)
Sexual Exploration
There is also the possibility of using the app for responsible sexual exploration, via tagging and instance tracking:
Log and tag individual instances with the same partner
Create micro journals of non sexual acts
Track other intimate relationships, even those that were unconsummated
Couple journals with other health information to more deeply explore individual needs/wants (or those of a partner)
Build empathy and understanding with a long-term partner
Use as a tool to rekindle passion as part of a comprehensive therapy program
What's In a Name?

BodyCount is an intentionally ironic play on words, re: Shakespeare, ""will live in your heart, die in your lap, and be buried in your eyes.""  It's a polysemic, double entendre that directly, and intentionally misrepresents the term ""quantified self"".  There were innumerable choices when naming this app, but we chose something that would make someone take pause and feel in hearing it, as uncomfortable as people often feel when talking about sex.
Risks & Challenges
I've been an analyst and digital strategist for my entire career, but I can't build this alone.  Finding the right group of developer/marketing partners is essential to the success of the project
Time to market:  under funding will mean increased dev time/costs Scale: depending on the popularity of the app it may be difficult for our small team to manage over time

Perception: since introducing this concept there has been pushback from individuals that think that it's a seedy subject, at least a low-level degree harassment is anticipated (but truthfully it's nothing we can't manage
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't back the project, help us get the word out!  Post the campaign to your social media accounts, tell your friends in person, or simply drop me a line @artperson100 if you have questions, want to show support
If you'd like to be involved with the data visualization/development drop us a line E: info@bodycount.me
Credits:  Stock Photos for Mock-ups via http://imcreator.com/free",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Brooklyn, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/bodycount-reproductive-health-app/pica

About The Team

The U12 Team is a very elite soccer club that competes at the highest level of youth soccer in California.  The boys come from across Southern California to try and earn a spot on the roster.  Once selected, the boys under the guidance of top flight coaches, travel to tournaments and games throughout the region.

The team is coached by two of the best coaches in the country. 

Head Coach Greg Curry is currently the Assistant Coach for the University of California, Santa Barbara (UCSB) Men's Soccer Team, which is one of the top NCAA Division I teams.  He also was Team Captain, and a member of their 2006 National Championship team.  He then played professionally for the San Jose Earthquakes, before starting his coaching career as an Assistant Coach for Sacramento State.

Assistant Coach Tim Vom Steeg is currently the Head Coach for the UCSB Men's Soccer Team, and is the most successful coach in the history of UCSB.  He was the Head Coach of UCSB's 2006 National Championship team, and UCSB's 2004 National Championship runner-up team.  He was also named the 2004 and 2006 NCAA Division I National Soccer Coaches Association of America (NSCAA) Coach of the Year.

To kick off the season, the team competed in it's first tournament in early September, and came home undefeated with the Championship Medal!
About The Club

Santa Barbara Soccer Club (SBSC) is a non profit organization, dedicated to helping soccer players develop the proper fundamentals, skills, confidence, and maturity to be successful on the field, and most importantly, off of it.  Through the teaching of it's members and coaches, each player learns how to improve as an athlete, as a teammate, and how to build friendships.

The Santa Barbara Soccer Club has produced three consecutive National Championship soccer teams.  Many players who have participated on teams throughout the organization, have gone on to college scholarships, and some, have even made the professional level.
Going To London!

Almost every soccer player (especially in this age group), dreams of playing in Europe and becoming the next ""Messi,"" ""Ronaldo,"" or even ""Pele!""  Well, the U12 Team has the chance to do this...or at least play in Europe!

The team has the opportunity to train with, and compete against Academy Teams of professional clubs. The boys will get the chance to see how they ""measure up,"" against other boys who are being groomed by professional teams.

But, like everything else, dreams don't come cheap.  Between tournament fees, transportation, referee fees, coaches, hotels, meals, and other expenses, the cost per player is expected to be $3,500.  Without the help and support of parents, friends, sponsors, and fundraisers, some players won't be able to participate.

This is where you can help! 

Please consider giving a tax deductible donation to help the boys.  All donations through this fundraiser go directly to the Santa Barbara Soccer Club U12 Boy's Team, and as mentioned, are tax deductible. Any donation you can give to help the team will be greatly appreciated, and we have some great items to give you to thank you for your support.

Air Meditator™ is the first-ever inflatable Meditation cushion on the market. It is mindfully designed for your ultimate comfort. The patented, crescent-shaped cushion has three separate easily adjustable air chambers allowing for customized size, comfort, and stability.

Everyone has their own preferences on how they like their mediation cushion to feel.

Air Meditator’s three separate air chambers allow you to adjust the cushion to your comfort level.

Adjust the center chamber for optimal cushioning, spine support and pelvic tilt.

Adjust the two side chambers for hip and thigh support.

Proper position of the hips and thighs allow the knees to naturally rest comfortably.

The three separate air chambers allow for stability even when the cushion is partially inflated.

Maximum inflated size: 18” wide and 7” tall in the rear x 2.5” tall in the front (46 x 18x 6 cm). Carry case included.

We have listened to feedback from our customers and have spent the last two years diligently working to improve Air Meditator. The new version has several fantastic improvements.

1. Double welded seams for extra durability: We have contracted with a new factory that has the technology to seal each of the seams of the three air chambers with double welds creating a stronger and more durable cushion than the single weld of the original version.

2. State of-of-the-art-valves: Air Meditator’s new state-of-the-art valves are a vast improvement over our previous valves and those of traditional inflatable products. Instead of biting and pinching to inflate and deflate the cushions, you simply have to blow into the valve to inflate it and push the button to adjust or deflate it. It’s that easy! The new valve allows Air Meditator to be inflated/deflated in just seconds with far less effort than in the past.  

3. Air Meditator is lighter. The double welds create a more durable cushion allowing us to use a lighter material making Air Meditator easier to travel with.

4. New color options: The beige cushion seen in the video and photo is an example of a new color option that we are offering.
• Proper body alignment is achieved when the hips and thighs are elevated allowing the knees to rest comfortably.
• Correct posture: Air Meditator's adjustability results in a perfect seated posture, distributing your weight and therefore alleviating stress in the back, body, and legs.
• Comfort and stability: When the body and spine are aligned, it allows for proper circulation, thus eliminating stress and numbness.

Air Meditator weighs less than a pound (450 g) and folds nicely into a 9” x 9” x 2” (23 x 23 x 5 cm) pouch saving you space and weight in your luggage.

Our newly designed valves make inflating and deflating simple. Just blow into the valve to inflate it and push the button to deflate it.

There is no need to pinch or bite the valve as with old-school designs. Adjustments are easy. Just push the button to let out the air so that the cushion deflates to the size you prefer.

 

Sit in absolute comfort. Take Air Meditator with you everywhere you go and sit in comfort anywhere, any place any time!

Hi, I’m Scott Salzman!

For more than two decades, I have been practicing meditation. My practice often takes me on retreats, to the outdoors and to local classes. When I travel, I continue my practice wherever I happen to land. Depending on the location, the available cushions were too big, too small, the wrong shape or not available at all.

My profession as a full-time inventor has spanned almost as much time as my meditation practice. Therefore, designing the best meditation cushion was right up my alley. I designed Air Meditator for a number of reasons. First, so that I could sit on something that met my comfort needs. It was hard for me to find a cushion that allowed me to sit without discomfort in my knees, back. buttocks, and legs. Portability was important to me as well. I needed a cushion that I could travel with and that didn't take up a lot of space and weight in my bags. Voila, Air Meditator was born.

While the cushion I designed worked wonderfully for me, I knew that not everyone would want a cushion exactly like mine. Therefore, the single air chamber was split into three, making it adjustable so that anyone who uses Air Meditator would have personalized comfort. The three chambers also add stability, keeping the air from moving back and forth, when the cushion is not fully inflated.

If you want to learn more about my other inventions, feel free to check out: Spotless Paw®, Purrfect Cat Box®, Spotless Swing®, and Groovy Glove™.

We are raising funds to buy a recumbent tricycle and accessories for Bill, a
family member in Deland, FL who suffered from a stroke some years back.
Bill is only able to use one side of his body, but does amazingly well in
spinning classes, and would like to be able to ride a recumbent trike on bike
trails. He is not able to work and has limited income.
The amazing and inspiring thing about Bill is that despite his physical
limitations, he has a great deal of fun, a positive attitude, and a wonderful
sense of humor. Bill has worked hard to re-learn how to walk and to improve his
speech. He shows incredible determination and never complains.
Bill works out regularly at the YMCA in Deland, and has a host of friends
there who love to be around him. I started this campaign to allow friends and
family to contribute to the cost of a Catrike recumbent trike and the
accessories needed to customize the Catrike for Bill's needs (one hand operation
of controls).  Members of Bill's immediate family are paying for the bulk
of the costs, but would appreciate support from the wider community.

• 50 percent of the plastic we use, we use just once and throw away.
• Enough plastic is thrown away each year to circle the earth four times.

I NEED YOUR HELP
I am having a serious surgery on  Wed, Feb 19th at Noon. They will be cutting
me open and possibly removing all of both my ovaries, hopefully we can
save some of one of them.  I will then have a 6 week recovery time

during which I will be mostly helpless and unable to work
WHAT YOU CAN DO:
1) Pray, meditate, cast spells, chant, send good juju to me while it happens
2) Help me raise $4000 to pay for the surgery and medical bills. I will not be able to work, and I will still need to pay for things.

Namaste and thanks for checking out our page.

We need your help in keeping local Nepali riders
in the running to dominate the Yak Attack in 2014,www.yak-attack.co.uk/. Since
the beginning the race has been won year in and year out by local riders - makes
sense as it is their home ground, but when you see their bikes and become aware

of the nutrition and training they have, you cannot help but be blown away.

As with all things in the current financial
crisis sponsorship is difficult to find, just to enter the race without support
is out of reach for locals, let alone ensuring your bike is in good working
order and accessing adequate nutrition and training to ensure you are at your
best. Whilst some of the funds from international competitors is used to
subsidize the entry for locals it is not enough.
We are asking for donations that will be used to
provide the Single Track Team, http://singletrackteam.com/, entry
and support before and during the race. Your donation will go towards a variety
of things including spare parts, training consultations, nutrition and of
course entry to races (when necessary
column2: some riders have already secured entry

column1:
sponsorship).

Anyone who has visited Nepal will appreciate its
beauty, those of you lucky enough to spend any time here will probably be more
aware of the challenges it faces as a country and how so many people get by
just living day to day. It is true that sport is a luxury, a luxury most of us
enjoy without thought, for the local riders here it is one they live for,
completely devoted to the sport and wanting to achieve their full potential and
ensure that everyone finishes the race with as much of a smile as possible
(they get up to 5400m, it is tough to smile up there).
And for the country, national sporting champions are exactly that, champions –
role models, people that the youth can look up to, and see that with hard work
and determination you can achieve your dreams. Local sporting achievements are pretty
special and have enormous power in countries where life can be tough like

Nepal.

The 2014 Yak Attack will see the stiffest
international line up yet, with Canadian, American and European Professionals entered, ex Tour de
France rider turned Olympic mountain biker and the only
international to ever gain an overall podium position, returning,
this will be a fierce battle for podium spots
All donations are warmly welcomed, to give you
an idea of what things cost:
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >20 Pounds (30 USD) will fund general repairs and maintenance

column1: <li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >50 Pounds (80 USD) will get a good set of racing tyres

column1: <li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >100 Pounds (160 USD) will provide sufficient nutrition for the team for

column1: 1 month of training
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >250 Pounds (400 USD) will allow comprehensive maintenance, repairs and

column1: replacements for 6 months.
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >500 Pounds (800 USD) allows upgrades of parts to lighter, better quality

column1: systems
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >1000 Pounds (1600 USD) will enter a rider in the Yak Attack and equip

column1: them with energy gels, clothing and essential spares for racing
<span>With the Government of Nepal unable to provide
much support we rely on international friends and sporting enthusiasts to
help make dreams come true. The Yak Attack is the next big event for these
guys, help them achieve their best.
We thoroughly appreciate everyone’s thoughts,
wishes and donations, we are lucky we have so many supporters out there. We
look forward to watching these guys develop and will keep you posted on their
progress.
After the Yak Attack the next big event will be the
World Championships in South Africa and the 2016 Olympics are not just a dream, big things are starting to happen.

Have fun out there.

1 month of training
250 Pounds (400 USD) will allow comprehensive maintenance, repairs and
replacements for 6 months.
500 Pounds (800 USD) allows upgrades of parts to lighter, better quality
systems
1000 Pounds (1600 USD) will enter a rider in the Yak Attack and equip
them with energy gels, clothing and essential spares for racing
With the Government of Nepal unable to provide
much support we rely on international friends and sporting enthusiasts to
help make dreams come true. The Yak Attack is the next big event for these
guys, help them achieve their best.
We thoroughly appreciate everyone’s thoughts,
wishes and donations, we are lucky we have so many supporters out there. We
look forward to watching these guys develop and will keep you posted on their
progress.
After the Yak Attack the next big event will be the
World Championships in South Africa and the 2016 Olympics are not just a dream, big things are starting to happen.
Have fun out there.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Reading, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/single-track-team-2014-yak-attack/pica

column23:
>I've been living with AIDS for almost twenty-four years. During that time I've lived through tuberculosis, pneumocystis pneumonia, depression and suicidal thoughts caused by medication, liver cirrhosis, a stroke, speech and cognitive therapy, and sometimes painful neuropathy plus osteoporosis. I've had great medical insurance which alleviated a lot of the financial stress and help me to recover.  It's only the cirrhosis which caused my teeth to decay at such a rapid pace that I'm in this predicament.  Unfortunately, I have no dental insurance.  Plus all of my surgeries are performed by specialists rather than a general dentist so none of their services would be covered anyway.  

Months before I started the procedure I had to take almost half my teeth out of my mouth to eat.  Not only was this embarrassing, as most of my friends and acquaintances can verify, but I had difficulty chewing.  To this day I'm always carrying around Fixodent where ever I go.
column24:
>Please support me to finish all my dental surgeries so I can stop looking like the poster from ""Silence of the Lambs."" (My friend created this for impact. Is it working? lol) Furthermore rid me of that gummy pink paste. I'm not an old man yet.

Specifics About The Dental Work

The total cost of the mouth reconstruction is $51,435.  Yes, even though I'm going to New York University Dental School that's still the cost.  If I saw a private dentist the price would be two or three times more.  Other advantages are the school has the latest in dental technology and every type of specialist under one roof.
column27:
/>

Right now I'm about $14,000 in and a year and a half through the surgeries.  First my bite needed to be corrected.  My mouth had a combination of some solid teeth, while others demand root canals and five are intended for implants.  My lower gums will have to be trimmed and my under gums with have to be lengthen by a skin graph. Additionally, I required an impacted tooth which worked through the roof of my mouth.  This was causing a painful infection that I had been walking around with for a few years.  Finally, all of my teeth will need to be re-crowned.  This is a large undertaking overseen by a prosthodontist working with several specialists.
column28:
>I haven't been able to chew for close to five years without something falling out of my mouth.  Plus most of my meals are soft food or soup.  Hopefully with your help, I'll be able to continue through the process without additional financial stress.  Please remember each and every dollar counts.

Perks &
column29: Other Ways You Can Help
column38:
>I'm a bit of an amateur photographer with over 1,500 followers on Instagram.  If you have an IG account @il_david is my name.  I put together a few perks using my photographs.  A lot of my photos are architectural abstractions, scenes of New York streets and my travels.

If you are not interested in donating than please spread the word.  Maybe you're part of an HIV positive community.  Quite possibly you know a dentist that cares about everyones teeth.  Also, use the Indiegogo share tools!

I'm grateful to my friends and family for supporting me in posting this campaign.  It wasn't easy revealing my financial dilemma for the world to see.  

Thank you for reading my story!

My dear friend Michelle Fedder who's a license acupuncturist is providing sessions of treatment for a donation of $200.  Her company's called Reclining Buddha and that's how you'll feel after the session is over.  This is for NYC donations only.  For more information www.recliningbuddhaacupuncture.com

MMA 4 A CURE was designed to help bring donations and awareness to the American Cancer Society particularly for the research and study of various types of childhood cancer.

With your donation, you will not only receive some of the incentives listed on the right side of the screen, but you are helping to generate a steady flow of traffic to the mma4acure.org website where one can donate to the American Cancer Society.
MMA 4 A CURE is organized by fight fans, but not specifically for fight fans. This is for anyone and everyone who wants to help deliver a knockout blow to childhood cancer.
Donations will help pay for the pamphlets, flyers and t-shirts to help promote the awareness of the website where people can donate. It will also help with the development of mma4acure.org website.

We all know someone who has been affected by cancer. With your help and the collaboration of the MMA community and those who want to help fight childhood cancer, we can develop enough promotional material to help benefit those children and families in need.

Thank you.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
We're Baking and Making Memories

Welcome to our campaign to raise production funds for the 2013 Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge semifinals and finals events in Washington, DC.  The contest's featured dessert in 2013 is PIE.  THE Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge has been a labor of love for me with enthusiastic help from our co-presenter Eatonville Restaurant, beneficiaries like Martha’s Table, top rate judges including award winning cookbook authors Joan Nathan and Lisa Yockelson, and my baking family and friends.  This campaign aims to match and keep pace with the baking challenge’s own growth.  Success in 2013 brings the baking challenge closer to the ultimate goal -- Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenges in more regions looking to grow a community with bakers around food.

Having worked in public media, outreach, the arts, and event production over the years, “foodlorist” was added to my plate when I began collecting stories and memories about men and women who bake from scratch.  Fortunately it is not a lost art.  The Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge invites home bakers to share the baking traditions and stories that enhance the enjoyment of their desserts.  It also makes the winning dessert a best-seller for our co-presenter Eatonville Restaurant.
What Happens at the Baking Challenge

The Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge is for dessert lovers of all ages.  The semifinals on March 23, 2013 is a ticketed fundraising event held at our beneficiary's site (Martha’s Table, 2013 beneficiary). Our official star judges will select 4 finalists
column2: the 5th finalist will be selected by “The Peoples Choice” to go to the Final Five in April.

column1: Martha’s Table receives a generous portion of the proceeds from online and onsite ticket sales to support their programs that help people deal with the immediate effects of poverty and works to find long-term solutions with education, nutrition, and famliy support services.

On April 23, 2013, the 5 finalists will bring their desserts to Eatonville Restaurant for  “Happy Hour.”  The official guest judges will award the blue ribbon to the baker with the best pie in the show.  A percentage of restaurant sales during the event will benefit Martha’s Table.
What We Need

$3500 is a modest amount for promotion and production of two delicious, fun-filled semifinals and Final Five events.  But you will help us make the magic with funding to purchase the following supplies and services:
<ul>
• Graphic Design
• Printing:  postcards, contest forms, flyers, poster, and programs, general photocopying
• Promotion:  Facebook ads, community newspaper ads (printed and/or online)
• Banners to display outside and inside event venues
<li>Semifinals supplies:  Ballot boxes, green disposable plates, cups, forks, napkins, table coverings for guests and judges
column3: supplies for our children’s table(s) during the semifinals.

column1: <li>Finals supplies: prize ribbons
• Audio/Visual:  videographer, photographer, and audio technician for the events
• Event Insurance
• Modest stipends for key production staff
You Get
All contributors get a special SHOUT! out on our www.shoutbakingchallenge website.  But the more you give, the more SHOUT! you get.  Complete details are in the side bar.  Here are the highlights:

BLUE RIBBON support of $1,000 gets you behind-the-scenes with our official star judges at the semifinals and finals to have the final word on who has the best pie in the show.  Use your VIP status to host your friends at the event.  You’ll be acknowledged on the challenge’s digital and program promotion along with our official sponsors.  You also get the winning pie made by special order, plus gifts from King Arthur Flour.  This is the loudest SHOUT!

A contribuiton of $500 is a MAIN INGREDIENT for a big SHOUT! that everyone will notice at the semifinals and finals.  You and three friends get VIP tickets to the challenge events including a complimentary featured appetizer or drink at Eatonville Restaurant for the finals
column2: plus a special gift from King Arthur Flour.

column1: $100 TOPPING - You and a guest cast your votes at our semifinals and have a guaranteed reservation at Eatonville Restaurant for the finals.  We’re going to give you a SHOUT! in the program, social media, online, and a gift from King Arthur Flour.

For $25 - $50, you get to cast your vote for the “Peoples Choice” at the Semifinals March 23, 2013 and a guaranteed seat at the finals to see who gets the blue ribbon.  Pie samples are shared with the audience after the official judges submit their scores. ($50 contributors receive a King Arthur Flour Baking DVD featuring the 2012 winner)
Give us a $10 SHOUT! and we’ll give you a special SHOUT! on our website.
<div>
In the event that we don’t reach our campaign goal, we'll work with what we've raised and continue seeking sponsorship support to make the Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge a success.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute to the campaign at this time, here are other ways you can give us a SHOUT!
<ul>
• Share the Indiegogo link and news for this campaign with dessert lovers you know.  Use the Indiegogo share tools.
• Like us on Facebook.  We post recipes, recommendations, and news about the challenge here.
• Follow us on Twitter (see Twitter link)
• Encourage the home baker you know in the DC metropolitan area to enter the 2013 baking challenge.  The entry form will be posted on www.shoutbakingchallenge.com in November 2012.
<li>Attend our events.  The semifinals is March 23, 2013 at Martha’s Table (75% of  ticket sales benefit Martha’s Table)
column2: and the finals is April 23, 2013 at Eatonville Restaurant (a portion of food and beverage sales benefit Martha’s Table)

column1: • Volunteer - If you’re in the DC, MD, VA area during our events, we can use your help.  Use the campaign contact link to get more information.
MAKE BAKING DREAMS COME TRUE
Baking challenge winners are on the road of their baking dreams with cooking demonstrations, television appearances, news features, and artisan enterprises.

2011 winner Decoyise Brown, a law firm receptionist, was a judge for the 2012 challenge.  Her traditional coconut cake was a best seller at Eatonville Restaurant and featured in a Washington Post Food article titled ""The Cake Whisperer.""  Her recipe got a special mention in the New York Times ""Diners Journal.""  Decoyise now receives referrals from Eatonville Restaurant while 2012 winner Austin Brown’s Chocolate Trio Cake takes its place as the next best-selling dessert.  Austin, a green energy analyst (no relation to Decoyise) gave away samples of the winning Chocolate Trio Cake and copies of the recipe at Whole Foods Market.  He continues his victory lap and will make his television appearance on a CBS affiliate station.  Austin will be a judge for the 2013 challenge.

In addition to the cash and gift card prizes (donated) the 2013 Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge winner will receive a one-on-one consultation with a restaurant business company on starting their own food business.

The Makes-Me-Wanna SHOUT! Baking Challenge is ready to take its next steps. Your contribution to produce our 2013 challenge will help make this business, baking, community building model grow and a win-win for everyone.
Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign.  Enjoy our videos of the last two baking challenges.  Thank you for your support.
Michon Boston, Creator/Producer

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h3><span style=""font-size: 10px
column2: >Be a reason to fight the cancer

column1: In the Gaza Strip, like everywhere in the world, the number of cancer patients is increasing. If compared to other countries, the difference is that it’s not easy to get required medicine inside the Strip and in most cases people cannot afford to buy them due to the big percentage of poverty.

One of the cases is Maria , a 13 years old girl from the middle of Gaza. She is a smart little girl, with a big mind and optimistic soul. Maria started to feel sick about 4 years ago. Her parents took her to the hospital in Gaza but due to the situation in the Ministry of health - Gaza is so critical because the blockade and siege which have been imposed by Israel in 2005/2006 -  the doctors advised her to go to Egypt.

The doctors in Egypt made her a CT- Scan. The results showed a tumor in the left optic nerve. The size of the malignant cell was 2.5 cm and it was going to metastasize more. Maria started to lose her vision by the time and the doctors prescribed her immediately oral chemotherapy.
The medicine she is using are:
1-  Temodal 100mg (Temozolomide ) each box contains 5 capsules.
2-  Zofran 8mg (Ondansetron Hydrochloride) each box contains 10 tablets.
She started taking Temodal 100mg with the dose 3 capsules/week and  Zofran 8mg 2 tab/week.
So she needed 2 ½  boxes of Temodal and one box of Zofran per month.

Her parents started to search for the medicines in private pharmacies but they found out that are too expensive. Her father decided to sell his car and some other stuff from the house to be able to cover the expenses for the medicines since his salary wasn't enough to cover the daily life expenses.
In that time I got a phone call from her dad asking me for help. Someone suggested me as a link because I’m a pharmacist and have contacts with different medical drug stores.

I started to work hard to find it out asking organizations in and outside the Gaza Strip for help. Then I started to make urgent calls to all my friends across the world to donate money and to help this way to buy the medicines. Luckily I got some funds which were enough to cover the cost of the drugs for a few months. Some other friends managed to send this expensive medicine directly from their country.

A couple of months ago Maria went again to Egypt for another check up. The results were  amazingly changed. The tumor’s size reduced from 2.5 to 1.5 cm and hopefully it will reduce more and disappear. Since the medicine worked well for her, the doctors decided to let her  continue with them for 3 more months but with an increased dose.
The new doses are:
Temodal 100mg 4 capsules/week and Zofran 8mg 4 tablets/week. In total it's 9 ½ boxes of Temodal and 5 boxes of Zofran for 3 months.
After these 3 months she will have another check up in Cairo. We all hope that the Cancer will disappared forever.

I’ve been helping Maria for a year and a half (with a big support by my friends) and she became part of the family. It is hard to see a child suffering where general life conditions are also difficult. If you consider her as your daughter or sister you will always do what you can to help her survive. This can only happen if all of us work united to reach the goal and supply her with the very expensive medicine necessary for the treatment. Make a difference, help her now. Please make a donation, any amount is most appreciated.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, we understand, but please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.
Funds Raised Above Goal and Extra money.

Any funding raised for Maria that exceeds the total amount of the medicines and our goals will be used to bring the medicine to Gaza, help Maria to get to Italy for more check up and her family for the daily expenses and  hers and her brothers education . Thanks again for your generosity and support for Maria, as it motivates her even more to stay happy.
","Be a reason to fight the cancer

In the Gaza Strip, like everywhere in the world, the number of cancer patients is increasing. If compared to other countries, the difference is that it’s not easy to get required medicine inside the Strip and in most cases people cannot afford to buy them due to the big percentage of poverty.

One of the cases is Maria , a 13 years old girl from the middle of Gaza. She is a smart little girl, with a big mind and optimistic soul. Maria started to feel sick about 4 years ago. Her parents took her to the hospital in Gaza but due to the situation in the Ministry of health - Gaza is so critical because the blockade and siege which have been imposed by Israel in 2005/2006 -  the doctors advised her to go to Egypt.

The doctors in Egypt made her a CT- Scan. The results showed a tumor in the left optic nerve. The size of the malignant cell was 2.5 cm and it was going to metastasize more. Maria started to lose her vision by the time and the doctors prescribed her immediately oral chemotherapy.
The medicine she is using are:
1-  Temodal 100mg (Temozolomide ) each box contains 5 capsules.
2-  Zofran 8mg (Ondansetron Hydrochloride) each box contains 10 tablets.
She started taking Temodal 100mg with the dose 3 capsules/week and  Zofran 8mg 2 tab/week.
So she needed 2 ½  boxes of Temodal and one box of Zofran per month.

Her parents started to search for the medicines in private pharmacies but they found out that are too expensive. Her father decided to sell his car and some other stuff from the house to be able to cover the expenses for the medicines since his salary wasn't enough to cover the daily life expenses.
In that time I got a phone call from her dad asking me for help. Someone suggested me as a link because I’m a pharmacist and have contacts with different medical drug stores.

I started to work hard to find it out asking organizations in and outside the Gaza Strip for help. Then I started to make urgent calls to all my friends across the world to donate money and to help this way to buy the medicines. Luckily I got some funds which were enough to cover the cost of the drugs for a few months. Some other friends managed to send this expensive medicine directly from their country.

A couple of months ago Maria went again to Egypt for another check up. The results were  amazingly changed. The tumor’s size reduced from 2.5 to 1.5 cm and hopefully it will reduce more and disappear. Since the medicine worked well for her, the doctors decided to let her  continue with them for 3 more months but with an increased dose.
The new doses are:
Temodal 100mg 4 capsules/week and Zofran 8mg 4 tablets/week. In total it's 9 ½ boxes of Temodal and 5 boxes of Zofran for 3 months.
After these 3 months she will have another check up in Cairo. We all hope that the Cancer will disappared forever.

I’ve been helping Maria for a year and a half (with a big support by my friends) and she became part of the family. It is hard to see a child suffering where general life conditions are also difficult. If you consider her as your daughter or sister you will always do what you can to help her survive. This can only happen if all of us work united to reach the goal and supply her with the very expensive medicine necessary for the treatment. Make a difference, help her now. Please make a donation, any amount is most appreciated.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate, we understand, but please share this link with your friends, be it by e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, Reddit, etc.
Funds Raised Above Goal and Extra money.

Any funding raised for Maria that exceeds the total amount of the medicines and our goals will be used to bring the medicine to Gaza, help Maria to get to Italy for more check up and her family for the daily expenses and  hers and her brothers education . Thanks again for your generosity and support for Maria, as it motivates her even more to stay happy.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Gaza, Palestine, State of",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/be-a-reason-to-fight-the-cancer/pica

UPDATE: PLEASE STOP FUNDING THIS. MY FLIGHT WAS CANCELLED AND I WAS UNABLE TO ATTEND THE FUNERAL. I AM TRYING TO FIGURE OUT HOW BEST TO GET YOUR MONEY BACK TO YOU. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR KINDNESS OF HEART AND GENEROSITY OF SPIRIT. I WILL INFORM ALL OF YOU AS TO HOW YOU'RE GETTING YOUR MONEY BACK. 

Hi. My Nonno, Pelino Gentile, died earlier this week. He was the kindest, funniest, sweetest, most hardworking man i've ever known, and we were extremely close. 

He was born in Italy 93 years ago. He was a POW in WWII and emigrated to Canada in the 50's with my nonna, my dad, and my uncle. He was essentially a peasant all his life, even in Canada. He taught me so much about hard work, humour in difficult times, self-reliance, and resilience. I loved him so much. 

 I am in Minneapolis visiting my fiancee, to whom I proposed the day before Nonno died. I have very limited funds, but would very much like to attend his funeral and support the rest of my family. The funeral is in Montreal on Monday, January 6 2014.

 The flight to Montreal is 775$. the remainder of the 1000$ will be used to pay indiegogo, and buy a bus ticket from Montreal to Owen Sound, where i attend school.

Thank you for any contribution you might be able to make.

Summary

My little and bright sister Elaine Vasconcellos de Menezes is a young, only 35 years old, lovely daughter, and terrific friend. She lives in Brazil, city of Jaú, Sao Paulo State, and used to teach history for young kids.   She is married with a highway security policeman, a career that is also her passion and she almost embraced it, she passed a national qualification exam, but was still waiting to be drafted for the job . However, her dream was interrupted because in 2011 she was diagnosed with Hodgkin Lymphoma, a blood cancer that affects the lymphatic system.

Since then she is fighting with exceptional courage and enthusiasm against this disease: she is not giving up. Her doctors at Amaral Carvalho Hospital (http://www.amaralcarvalho.org.br/) have been using different chemicals and also radiotherapies to try to stop her disease, which would enable her to make a marrow transplant. Unfortunately, both our brother and me proved to be incompatible with her.

The auto-transplant, however, could be a possibility IF her tumors disappear. There is a strong possibility if we make feasible a purchase of a newly produced drug very expensive, available in Europe and the US. Although there are two top-level hospitals in the Sao Paulo State that agrees to take care of the problem through assistance of their specialists, they cannot import the drug: the patient has to do that. But the family can't afford it, and I am working for a PhD in Oceanography at the University of Tasmania, still having about a year to go. I cannot help financially her very much at the present time.

The different treatments didn't work for her, and now she therefore needs urgently to buy this very expensive medicine called ADCETRIS (http://www.seattlegenetics.com/adcetris). 

Because this drug is not in the list that the Brazilian government buys, her doctors said that she needs to buy the required pack of medicine by herself to stop the development and cure of this infection, to be able to do an auto-transplant, which is already known to be the proven route to survival.

Unfortunately, we don't have money to buy it. Please help us to save the life of Elaine in this Christmas, giving even a small quantity!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!    A big pie is made of small pieces :)

What We Need
<li>
• We need to import to Brazil the Adcetris drug !!!!!
•  Her doctors state that about 8 units of the drug are required, and each unit costs around $ 6000, including the taxes, plus the firm that takes care of paperwork.
•  For 6 months, she needs 8, so the total is equivalent to US$48,000.00.
•  We have already US$13,000.00 available, so we need to find more US$35,000.00

•  I am launching this campaign to get at least $12,000.00 the equivalent only for 2 doses     
    •
The Impact
Elaines' life now depends totally on our ability to buy this
drug and this must be fast. We are running against time
Please help us!

She creates a Facebook page in portuguese: https://www.facebook.com/CruzadadeElaineMenezes 

This is her face: https://www.facebook.com/elaine.menezes.5688

column13:
>In Portuguese (Em portugues):

AJUDE A SALVAR MINHA VIDA!!!!

Olá, meu nome é Elaine Vasconcellos de Menezes, tenho 35 anos e em abril de 2011 fui diagnosticada com um câncer no sistema linfático (conhecido como Linfoma de Hodgkin), por sinal foi meu presente de aniversário, já que nasci dia 4 de abril e recebi o diagnóstico dia 5. Achei que o mundo tinha se aberto sob os meus pés, mas tive coragem de lutar. Passei por um primeiro protocolo de quimioterapia conhecido como ABVD, que é o mais indicado para o tratamento da minha doença, foi prevista 12 sessões desse quimioterápico, mas, infelizmente, o tratamento não deu certo e eu tive que mudar para outro chamado GDP, seriam mais 6 sessões para, finalmente, me ver livre dessa doença. Mas também, não consegui. Parti para uma radioterapia, com vista à definitivamente me livrar da doença (20 sessões). Sofri, passei muito mal, fiquei careca, perdi a produção de saliva e no mês de fevereiro de 2012, consegui entrar em remissão, ou seja, ficar sem doença. Fiquei tão feliz e realizada, que achei que poderia retomar a minha vida, fiz planos de um futuro repleto de realizações. 

No entanto, novamente, na época do meu aniversário, mas precisamente 7 de abril deste ano fui surpreendida com um novo diagnóstico: A DOENÇA HAVIA VOLTADO. E agora, lamentavelmente, de maneira mais agressiva, febres e dores começavam a acompanhar meu corpo. Fui internada, pois estava muito debilitada e precisava iniciar o novo protocolo de quimioterapia DHAP (um protocolo extremamente penoso que durava 48 horas), parecia que eu tomava água com açúcar, enquanto outros pacientes respondiam a quimioterapia, meu tumor se espalhava de maneira acelerada. Após algumas sessões, veio à confirmação: EU HAVIA PIORADO, trocou-se o quimioterápico novamente, agora era o INFO VP, um protocolo novo e o sonho e esperança de me ver curada se renovaram. Mas, novamente nenhum resultado, os tumores aumentaram e não conseguia mais andar, dores e morfina foi o que me restou, a médica me desenganou: NÂO HAVIA MAIS O QUE FAZER. Após muito insistir e saber que não havia mais quimioterápico que pudesse tratar minha doença, a médica voltou para o GDP e uma resposta parcial foi conseguida. Uma recomendação para um transplante de medula veio, cujos doadores seriam um dos meus irmãos, no entanto, novamente um balde de água fria NENHUM DELES ERA COMPATIVEL. Continuo no GDP

Hoje eu já fiz 42 sessões de quimioterapia, ao todo, e 20 de rádio e mesmo assim não consegui terminar com essa doença, minha quimioterapia hoje tem pura e simplesmente a função de permitir eu não piore, mas não me cura. Até quando meu corpo vai suportar? Até quando eu vou viver?

Após pesquisar e conversar com os médicos descobri que há uma chance para mim, eu tenho a chance de viver e de me curar. Um medicamento que não é autorizado ainda no Brasil, seu nome é Brentuximab, nome comercial ADCETRIS, e é a minha única chance. No Brasil tudo é complexo e demorado, vou até entrar na justiça, mas preciso iniciar meu tratamento o mais rápido possível. 

Para isso preciso importar frascos do remédio, que custa em torno de 6 mil dólares cada. Para iniciar meu tratamento seriam 104 mil reais. Parece muito, eu sei. Mas, QUANTO CUSTA UMA VIDA?

Pensei na seguinte proporção: se eu conhecer 2000 pessoas e cada uma delas me der 50 reais eu consigo 100 mil reais......

Se você não puder me ajudar com 50 reais, mas puder me ajudar com 10 reais e conseguir mais 4 pessoas para lhe dar 10 reais, você já fez os 50 reais.

Eu não quero morrer, me de uma chance, me ajude....
column14: font-family: Arial, Helvetica, Verdana, Tahoma, sans-serif !important
column25:
>Elaine's Motto

Invictus, William Ernest Henley. 1849–1903

OUT of the night that covers me,

Black as the Pit from pole to pole,

I thank whatever gods may be

For my unconquerable soul.


In the fell clutch of circumstance

I have not winced nor cried aloud.

Under the bludgeonings of chance

My head is bloody, but unbowed.


Beyond this place of wrath and tears

Looms but the Horror of the shade,

And yet the menace of the years

Finds, and shall find, me unafraid.


It matters not how strait the gate,

How charged with punishments the scroll,

I am the master of my fate:

I am the captain of my soul.

Sence: The Evolution of Mindfulness and Productivity

Sence contains an unbelievable technological breakthrough that is capable of giving you more emotional insight than ever before so you can be your most productive, caring and happy.
column2:
>

  But, how the heck can a wearable be used to track emotions?

Sence can track emotions by very closely listening to your heart beat. Every emotion causes your heart to beat in a slightly different way. Think about how differently your heart beats when you are in a rage versus when you are in a calm state of serene happiness.

These, tiny changes in the heart rate are untraceable with traditional wearables. Sence uses revolutionary technology that allows it to track these differences using ECG (aka EKG) signals. ECG analysis is 250 times more precise that existing fitness trackers and smart watches and Sence is the first to release a technology that can measure ECG from one wrist. With this unprecedented level of accuracy it is not surprising people are calling Sence a “breakthrough”.
column3:

Sence’s insights can give you more data about your wellbeing than ever before. Sence can track precisely when and where you experience:

Sence can recognize the minute variations in between your heart’s contractions. Using ECG (also known as EKG) tracking technology. Sence is the first wearable to be able to track ECG from one wrist which allows it to take readings all day and collect the data it needs to train you on how to maximize your happiness and reduce your sadness.
column7:

SenceHub’s powerful algorithms turn the raw data provided by SenceBand into actionable analytics. Using SenceHub you’ll be able to:

 1. Track your stress, vitality and emotions so you can adjust your daily routine to maximize happiness and productivity.

With each ECG scan, SenceHub syncs up with your calendar and takes a snapshot of your location so you know exactly when and where the scan was taken. This gives you maximum insight into the origins of each emotion so you can identify patterns and course correct.

The amount of premium features unlocked will depend on the amount we raise so don't forget to share this campaign to help unlock even more premium features!
column21:

Customer Service Specialist 1

Customer Service Specialist 2
column22:
>

Few people realize, but many traditional fitness tracking wearables use outdated technologies such as optical sensors that end up only being about 70% accuracy in measuring your heart’s activities.

The bottom line is that these sensors track pulse waves, which are phenomena caused by the heart beat but which also have many other, unrelated factors that effect their frequency. Besides, you can track your pulse with your own finger! Why pick a device that tracks a phenomenon you can track yourself? Sence tracks something fundamentally different and dramatically more precise: electrocardiography (ECG)
column23:
>

Now you can see why Sence is able to track data that is so much more accurate than what's out there. Curious about how Sence can track ECG from just one wrist or how it uses that data to tell you what emotions you've experienced? Keep on reading!
column24:
>

There are two main pillars to understanding how the science behind Sence works:

1. How SenceBand can accurately measure ECG signals from one wrist

2. How SenceHub can turn those raw ECG signals into emotional insights

Once you understand both these concepts you'll really grasp why Sence is so revolutionary! Let's take a look at both these pillars individually.

SenceBand's ECG Tracking from One Wrist

SenceBand measures ECG using a patent-pending technology that allows it to cancel out the electromagnetic ""noise"" from your body. This mechanism filters out things like electrical signals from muscle contractions and leaves only the electromagnetic feed from your heart (ECG) . This filtering method is completely novel and makes SenceBand the only smart bracelet capable of measure ECG from one wrist.

How accurate is Sence? Below is the result of a test that was done that compared Sence to a standard, medical-grade ECG device. You'll see that the R-peaks (the critical phenomena to understanding true heart-rate and emotions) match up perfectly with the medical grade control.
column25:
>

But don't take our word for it! Check out our SenceBand prototype in action for yourself in the uncut demo videos below. We made them to show SenceBand's current prototype functionality so there are no doubts we are well on our way to a final product:

Video 1: Sence's ECG Signal
column26:
wmode=transparent"" width=""612"">

Video 2: Sence Tracking Emotions

Feel free to skip to 3:25 for the test results if you wish!
column27:
wmode=transparent"" width=""612"">

Getting Emotions from ECG Analysis

Okay, so now you understand how SenceBand tracks ECG signals from just one wrist, but how can this help to infer anything about emotions? Aren't emotions all about what is going on in your brain? What does the heart have to do with emotions? Actually, there is an intimate link between the brain and heart. In fact, the heart's nervous system even contains 40,000 neurons!
column28:
>

Your heart rate is determined by the two competing systems in the body: The sympathetic and the parasympathetic nervous systems. The sympathetic nervous system is known as the ""fight or flight"" pathway and it tries to pull your heart in a direction of excitement. The parasympathetic nervous system is known as the ""rest and digest"" pathway and tries to mellow your heart out and slow down its beats. All our emotions leave a unique footprint in this constant battle between sympathetic and parasympathetic control. These footprints can be read using heart rate variability (HRV) analysis of ECG data. Since Sence accurately tracks R-peaks it can identify the unique signals associated with each emotion.
column29:
>

 

How Many Emotions can Sence Track?

With Sence's unique ability to analyze heart rate variability, it can track 64 different emotions and bodily states in you and your loved ones. Specifically, Sence can track 2 flavours (intensity levels) of each of the 32 emotions found below in Plutchik's Wheel of Emotions, a standard emotional reference tool in medicine and psychology:
column30:
>

Don't get overwhelmed with all these emotions! Sence lets you pick the emotions to track that matter most to you and your lifestyle. The insight you glean from Sence can be as specific or broad as you want it to be.

Further Scientific Reading:

Want to dig deeper into the Science behind Sence? Click on any of the topics below to be linked to a peer-reviewed scientific article that covers it in detail:

The Connection Between the Brain and Heart for Emotions

Tracking Vitality Using HRV

The Heart’s Connection to the Nervous System

column35:
>

Sence allows people to share their analytics with others, at a level of privacy they see fit. You'll be able to let people know if you had a generally good or bad day or even show them exactly what emotions you felt and where. This allows people using Sence become connected in ways never before possible, without even needing to be in the same room (or even country)!
column36:
>

Sence for Couples 

Sence allows you understand not only your own emotions but those of that special someone. Know when to give them space or when they need a little pick me up! Be the best partner you can be with these revolutionary emotional insights.

Sence for Families 

Track the health and emotional wellbeing of the more sensitive members of your family such as children so you can keep them safe and sound. With Sence you can get the insight you need to be the best parent or caregiver you can be.

Sence for Friends 

With Sence you can get way more insight into your peer group than with a social media post. Are The Boys feeling a bit down lately as a group? Maybe it’s time to go out for a night on the town! Sence connects you to your friends in ways that go way beyond words, pictures or even videos to make you feel more connected then ever before.
column37:
>

The Sence story features a long and winding journey with an unlikely origin. Originally, the Sence team assembled not to build a revolutionary hardware device but to collect high quality ECG screening data. With this data, they build a huge database that they hoped to sell to others. In order to acquire this data the Sence team set out with the monumental goal of screening 20,000 patients in rural Ukraine with a mobile hospital made up of 24 doctors, 24 nurses and modern ECG equipment. They planned to provide free check-ups and health guidance to these individuals who had little access to healthcare in exchange for their anonymous ECG data.
column38:
>

Sound like an impossible task? The Sence team actually exceeded expectations and comprehensively screened 22,433 patients in 52 days. This unprecedented study got Planexta (the makers of Sence) many adulations worldwide from cardiac societies and the like.
column39:
>

With the massive amount data Planexta now had, they set out to find the right wearable technology company to sell it to. Unfortunately, they didn’t find a good fit! All the current devices either didn’t use rigorous enough ECG measurements to make use of the data or they measured ECG in such an impractical way that users would never take enough readings for the data to be useable.

What a waste! So much data was now available but there was no wearable sophisticated enough to use it. Instead of giving up, the Sence team decided to take it upon themselves to create (from scratch) an ECG measuring wearable that was both accurate and extremely practical for consumers to use. They created a lab dedicated to this task called Platform20k (as a memento of the monumental screening tour) and hired 13 top experimental physicists and engineers, the begin work on SenceBand.
column40:
>

It took the team over a year to succeed, but SenceBand became a reality due to the discovery and implementation of a whole new method of measuring ECG. Now, Sence has the hardware and the software foundations to do something truly revolutionary. However, Sence is still a scrappy little company and genuinely needs YOUR help to actualize the immense potential Sence technology has to improve people's lives. The Sence team thanks you for every last dollar of support!
column42:
>

SenceBand’s design was created by the famous Red Dot Award winner, Donn Koh and his Singaporean team at Stuck Design. Before helping to create SenceBand he worked on multiple projects for Microsoft, Dell, Samsung, HTC and T-Mobile. Our engineers and physicists worked closely with Donn Koh’s team to ensure technological prowess and aesthetics could co-exist in SenceBand’s unmistakable appearance. Check out Sence's visual journey below:
