This project was developed and is being managed by BeyondNature, a company specializing in launching innovative products through crowdfunding and transitioning them into mass-market powerhouses.
column51:
>

Customer Service Specialist 1

Customer Service Specialist 2

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQ)

What is Crowdfunding?

Crowdfunding gives you the chance to unlock unique bonuses for helping great ideas come to life. Kickstarter is not a store where you can buy products but rather a place to help product ideas come to life. That is why supporters of crowdfunding campaigns are called “backers” and not “customers” and why these backers receive “rewards” and not “orders”

Supporting a crowdfunding campaign helps you be a part of something bigger than yourself and join a community of equally excited backers, eager to see a project come to life. This can bring with it a lot of joy which is supported by the fact that about 1/3rd of Kickstarter backers have backed more than 5 campaigns! That being said, just like any new venture in life, there are no guarantees that things will go exactly as planned.

Although we have every intention of succeeding in our project to bring Sence to life and get you your very own SenceBand in line with our estimated shipping date, it is always possible that unexpected hurdles can emerge. As such, it is transparency that drives crowdfunding and our main commitment is to keep all of backers in the loop about updates with the project, good or bad. If you back our campaign, we can promise that you will be updated on our progress regularly and will always be able to reach out if you have questions, concerns or ideas. And, if everything goes as planned and you receive your product, you will have gotten it at a substantial discount before anyone else, which doesn’t hurt :)

 

How frequently will I receive updates?

During this campaign, updates will be fast and furious and we will have tonnes to share with you. As such, you can expect updates as frequently as every 3-7 days! This period of the project is exciting because you’ll literally be able to see the progress of things coming to life everyday!

After the campaign, we will provide updates every step of the way
column52:
from the end of the campaign through to the moment we ship you your SenceBand. Depending on the amount of new stuff happening you can expect formal updates bi-weekly or monthly.

We commit to providing you with the information you need as soon as it is available, good or bad. If there’s a new feature or perk added, we’ll let you know. If there’s a delay, we’ll let you know that too.

 

What colors can I get?

Let’s vote for colors. Post your desired color in a “Comments” section to this campaign! At the end we will pick 3 most popular colors.

 

How do I pick my size?

There will be 2 size option. Standard and Large. If you have a small or medium sized wrist, you will be fine with a Standard sized band. If you have a wrist that is above 6.5” inches in diameter then you should go with a Large.

Regardless of what size is good for you, you’ll get to make your selection after the campaign. We will be sending everyone a survey to collect your desired color (the winners from the color contest) and your desired SenceBand size (for all the bands you bought).


Can I buy a custom strap for Sence?

At this time, the Senceband and strap you see are the ones you will get. Because of our design, there is no easy way to offer a custom strap. That being said, we are creating versions of Sence that have bigger straps and can be used on different parts of the body than the wrist, if that is what you are getting at!

It is even possible that we will offer these versions as a stretch goal later in the campaign if we raise enough. Make sure to tell your friends about about the campaign to help us get there and pledge yourself. Remember you can withdraw your pledge at any time so there is no risk to helping us get close to our stretch goal!

 

Is SenceHub free?

Every feature we mention about SenceHub in this campaign is included in your pledge unless explicitly stated otherwise. We will be developing, additional premium features as the development of Sence continues. We will be giving all of our backers a free month of these premium features as a thank you for their support.

We will not charge you anything for SenceHub above and beyond your pledge unless you opt to continue to use the premium features after your month trial.

 

Who can see my SenceHub data and where is it stored?

Sence is not a medical device but when it comes to your security and the protection of your data, we treat it like one. SenceHub will adhere to HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) standards. Specifically, you will have to explicitly opt in for your data to be shared with anyone for research purposes or otherwise. Further, your information will always be anonymized even if you do opt to share it for research reasons.

If you want to share your Sence data with people you know, you will always have the ability to customize how much data and what kind of data is shared. Want your partner to know generally how you feel that day but not when and where you are feeling specific emotions? No problem! You can customize the level of access others have towards your information at any time.

 

Is SenceBand waterproof?

Senceband and an IP64 rating meaning it is equipped to take a splash. It is not intended to be used in the shower or swimming

 

Can my SenceBand withstand varying temperatures?

Yes. It was developed to work between -25°C to +45°C

 

Will Sence provide data in units I use daily?

With Sence, you will be able to decide whether SenceHub displays information to you under the Imperial or Metric systems, where relevant. We understand our backers will come from all over the world and we will always attempt to add the customizability necessary for you to feel the most comfort possible in interpreting your data.

 

How long is it safe to wear Sence?

Sence is a very safe device and there are no foreseeable issues in wearing often and throughout the day. The device’s electrodes that capture and interpret your body’s electromagnetic fields do so without significant stimulation to your body. In fact, you shouldn’t even feel them working! We are taking every precaution to make Sence just as safe as any mainstream fitness wearable.

 

Will SenceBand also serve as a watch?

SenceBand does not currently act as a watch. Future iterations could implement this feature but they are beyond the scope of this campaign. Also worth considering is that Sence will eventually release versions that are not worn on the wrist. These versions will leave a place for your own watch on your wrist. Anyone who backs the current version of SenceBand can replace it for one of these other versions once they are available so don’t hesitate to pledge now for the sake of waiting for those to be released!

 

How do notifications on SenceBand work?

We are making App notifications fully customizable for user convenience. Currently there is not plan to have band vibrations implemented.

 

Which operating systems will Sence work for?

Sence will work for iOS and Android devices.  Sence also requires Bluetooth to collect data so you will need to have your phone on you to do so.

 

Why is SenceBand worn on the wrist?

In order to obtain an ECG sample we must register a potential difference. I.E. one electrode must be a bit closer to your heart than the other. That’s where the vertical position comes in. We have not experience the band sliding out of place during testing.

 

How does Sence's Bluetooth work?

Our Bluetooth connection is enabled only during a scheduled or an on-demand measurement. It's about 2 mins. That's a power saving approach.

Before helping to create SenceBand he worked on multiple projects for Microsoft, Dell, Samsung, HTC and T-Mobile. Our engineers and physicists worked closely with Donn Koh’s team to ensure technological prowess and aesthetics could co-exist in SenceBand’s unmistakable appearance. Check out Sence's visual journey below:                                                                                                This project was developed and is being managed by BeyondNature, a company specializing in launching innovative products through crowdfunding and transitioning them into mass-market powerhouses.   Customer Service Specialist 1Customer Service Specialist 2 FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQ)What is Crowdfunding?Crowdfunding gives you the chance to unlock unique bonuses for helping great ideas come to life. Kickstarter is not a store where you can buy products but rather a place to help product ideas come to life. That is why supporters of crowdfunding campaigns are called “backers” and not “customers” and why these backers receive “rewards” and not “orders”Supporting a crowdfunding campaign helps you be a part of something bigger than yourself and join a community of equally excited backers, eager to see a project come to life. This can bring with it a lot of joy which is supported by the fact that about 1/3rd of Kickstarter backers have backed more than 5 campaigns! That being said, just like any new venture in life, there are no guarantees that things will go exactly as planned.Although we have every intention of succeeding in our project to bring Sence to life and get you your very own SenceBand in line with our estimated shipping date, it is always possible that unexpected hurdles can emerge. As such, it is transparency that drives crowdfunding and our main commitment is to keep all of backers in the loop about updates with the project, good or bad. If you back our campaign, we can promise that you will be updated on our progress regularly and will always be able to reach out if you have questions, concerns or ideas. And, if everything goes as planned and you receive your product, you will have gotten it at a substantial discount before anyone else, which doesn’t hurt :) How frequently will I receive updates?During this campaign, updates will be fast and furious and we will have tonnes to share with you. As such, you can expect updates as frequently as every 3-7 days! This period of the project is exciting because you’ll literally be able to see the progress of things coming to life everyday!After the campaign, we will provide updates every step of the way
column53: from the end of the campaign through to the moment we ship you your SenceBand. Depending on the amount of new stuff happening you can expect formal updates bi-weekly or monthly.We commit to providing you with the information you need as soon as it is available, good or bad. If there’s a new feature or perk added, we’ll let you know. If there’s a delay, we’ll let you know that too. What colors can I get?Let’s vote for colors. Post your desired color in a “Comments” section to this campaign! At the end we will pick 3 most popular colors. How do I pick my size?There will be 2 size option. Standard and Large. If you have a small or medium sized wrist, you will be fine with a Standard sized band. If you have a wrist that is above 6.5” inches in diameter then you should go with a Large.Regardless of what size is good for you, you’ll get to make your selection after the campaign. We will be sending everyone a survey to collect your desired color (the winners from the color contest) and your desired SenceBand size (for all the bands you bought).Can I buy a custom strap for Sence?At this time, the Senceband and strap you see are the ones you will get. Because of our design, there is no easy way to offer a custom strap. That being said, we are creating versions of Sence that have bigger straps and can be used on different parts of the body than the wrist, if that is what you are getting at!It is even possible that we will offer these versions as a stretch goal later in the campaign if we raise enough. Make sure to tell your friends about about the campaign to help us get there and pledge yourself. Remember you can withdraw your pledge at any time so there is no risk to helping us get close to our stretch goal! Is SenceHub free?Every feature we mention about SenceHub in this campaign is included in your pledge unless explicitly stated otherwise. We will be developing, additional premium features as the development of Sence continues. We will be giving all of our backers a free month of these premium features as a thank you for their support.We will not charge you anything for SenceHub above and beyond your pledge unless you opt to continue to use the premium features after your month trial. Who can see my SenceHub data and where is it stored?Sence is not a medical device but when it comes to your security and the protection of your data, we treat it like one. SenceHub will adhere to HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act) standards. Specifically, you will have to explicitly opt in for your data to be shared with anyone for research purposes or otherwise. Further, your information will always be anonymized even if you do opt to share it for research reasons.If you want to share your Sence data with people you know, you will always have the ability to customize how much data and what kind of data is shared. Want your partner to know generally how you feel that day but not when and where you are feeling specific emotions? No problem! You can customize the level of access others have towards your information at any time. Is SenceBand waterproof?Senceband and an IP64 rating meaning it is equipped to take a splash. It is not intended to be used in the shower or swimming Can my SenceBand withstand varying temperatures?Yes. It was developed to work between -25°C to +45°C Will Sence provide data in units I use daily?With Sence, you will be able to decide whether SenceHub displays information to you under the Imperial or Metric systems, where relevant. We understand our backers will come from all over the world and we will always attempt to add the customizability necessary for you to feel the most comfort possible in interpreting your data. How long is it safe to wear Sence?Sence is a very safe device and there are no foreseeable issues in wearing often and throughout the day. The device’s electrodes that capture and interpret your body’s electromagnetic fields do so without significant stimulation to your body. In fact, you shouldn’t even feel them working! We are taking every precaution to make Sence just as safe as any mainstream fitness wearable. Will SenceBand also serve as a watch?SenceBand does not currently act as a watch. Future iterations could implement this feature but they are beyond the scope of this campaign. Also worth considering is that Sence will eventually release versions that are not worn on the wrist. These versions will leave a place for your own watch on your wrist. Anyone who backs the current version of SenceBand can replace it for one of these other versions once they are available so don’t hesitate to pledge now for the sake of waiting for those to be released! How do notifications on SenceBand work?We are making App notifications fully customizable for user convenience. Currently there is not plan to have band vibrations implemented. Which operating systems will Sence work for?Sence will work for iOS and Android devices.  Sence also requires Bluetooth to collect data so you will need to have your phone on you to do so. Why is SenceBand worn on the wrist?In order to obtain an ECG sample we must register a potential difference. I.E. one electrode must be a bit closer to your heart than the other. That’s where the vertical position comes in. We have not experience the band sliding out of place during testing. How does Sence's Bluetooth work?Our Bluetooth connection is enabled only during a scheduled or an on-demand measurement. It's about 2 mins. That's a power saving approach.",47.0,2,"1 Campaign

column3:
>

The G7 HAND JAM is a tool designed for alpine big walls. The G7 HAND JAM protects your hands from sharp cracks and allows you to climb to your full potential.
column6:
> 

Constructed from a single piece of thin Italian suede, the G7 HAND JAM moulds to your hands forming a perfect fit and provides uncompromised balance between protection, breathability, friction, and warmth.

The G7 HAND JAM is for all day wear, it provides protection when jamming and offwidthing, and is unobtrusive when face climbing or mixing free with aid.
column14:
> 

A day of alpine climbing is long and likely involves both crack and face climbing. The G7 HAND JAM is patterned to be fitted on your hand when jamming yet relaxed when face climbing and at belays – staying comfortable at all times so you can keep them on all day.
column19:
>

By forgoing rubber, the G7 HAND JAM is breathable and low-profile, keeping thin hands — thin hands.
column22:
> 

Made from a single piece of leather, the suede strikes the ideal balance between breathability and warmth. Allowing the G7 HAND JAM to work on cold alpine climbs through hot days in the Creek.
column27:
> 

The wide strap sits comfortably below the crease on your wrist — allowing movement, distributing the load, and providing protection for deeper jams.
column30:
> 

The hook and loop closure makes the G7 HAND JAM quick and easy to put on and adjust.
column35:
> 

We selected a high-grade Italian suede, similar to that used on the best climbing shoes. It is durable and comfortable.
column38:
> 

The perimeter of the G7 HAND JAM is reinforced with a high strength laminate to ensure that the wrist strap and finger holes do not fail.
column43:
> 

Like a pair of climbing shoes, the leather will stretch and mould to your hand — becoming uniquely yours.
column46:
> 

The leather is durable and provides protection from abrasion while remaining thin so you can feel your jams. It has the perfect amount of friction — most comparable to tape.
column48:
>

2 year, no questions asked warranty.

G7 HAND JAMs are really durable. They are not indestructible.

What does this mean? We are confident in our products, so we stand behind The G7 HAND JAM with this simple promise. We will repair or replace your G7 HAND JAMs. No questions asked, no fine print, no BS.
column50:
>

How does this work?

Regardless, if your G7 HAND JAMs get damaged or worn out, we have your back. As a Indiegogo backer and one of our first customers we extend this commitment to form a lasting partnership with you. Please do your best to take care of your G7 HAND JAMs This will help us succeed and sustain our business for years to come.
column52:
>

We answer no matter where we are!

column2:
> 

The G7 HAND JAM is available in 5 sizes, each in its own unique colour.

An instruction video with details on hand measurement will be available when it is time to pick your size.
column5:
> 

The retail package includes a display case that can be placed on a flat surface or hung on slatwall.
column8:
> 

The display includes a sizing kit (a custom tape measure and 1x each size) to assist customers in choosing the correct size. We will work with all retailers to ensure their staff receives the training on the product and how to size a customer.
column11:
> 

As a retailer,  you will have an opportunity to customize the size split in your order before it ships.
column17:
>MANUFACTURED IN-HOUSE

To design and manufacture at our demanding standards, we built our design studio in Squamish BC, surrounded by the mountains, and built our factory in Taichung, Taiwan, centrally located to leading textiles and machine technology. By investing in our own production facility we are able to develop and construct materials in new ways that result in the most high performance, long lasting products.

At our factory ShapeIt Corp. Taiwan, we manufacture for our brands Grade VII Equipment and Cardamon along with serving a number of customers in the outdoor industry, marine, aerospace, fashion, sports, and industrial markets.

To work with our production team please email us.

hello@shapeit.com

Nine years ago, Babymoon Inn opened as the only accredited, freestanding birth center in the Phoenix area, offering families the option of a low-intervention, out-of-hospital birth. Born out of the desire to provide midwifery care to more women, Babymoon Inn and its team have since served hundreds of families.

At its core, Babymoon is a small, family-owned business founded by two people who believe moms and babies are important.  We're not independently wealthy.  We're not a large corporation, nor are we owned or financed by a hospital or a physician or a private equity firm. Our efforts until this point have been entirely self-funded, and as birth center owners, it is challenging to find the resources to start and sustain another birth center without help. Our reason for wanting to expand is simple: We believe in this cause and can't help questioning, ""If WE don't grow birth centers, who will?"" Your contributions will help do exactly that. Grow birth centers.

We have seen lives changed by the true birth center model of care and feel strongly that Tucson families need access to their own freestanding birth center and this holistic, personalized, and evidence-based model of care. We thank you for your support.

   

We are currently in escrow on what we think is the perfect building to grow families and communities for years to come (we will announce the location soon!). However, Babymoon Inn is more than a building and has always been about more than just birth. We support women and families through pregnancy, birth, breastfeeding, and postpartum. We support women who have never had children and who may not ever want children through our full-scope midwifery practice. We believe in low-tech, high-touch care where clients and their providers are partners in care and make informed decisions together.

Babymoon Inn of Tucson will feature:
• A full-scope midwifery practice that provides prenatal and well-woman care, contraceptive counseling, pre-conception counseling, and problem visits
• A freestanding birth center with two birthing suites, each with their own bathrooms and tubs, a living room area, and kitchen (plus the opportunity to grow in the coming years)
• A community space for childbirth classes, yoga, group prenatals, and support groups
• Water birth
• A comprehensive childbirth education program
• Postpartum support groups for new moms
• 30-60 minute appointments
• Lactation support
• Group prenatal appointments in each trimester
• Prenatal massage
• Family centered-care
• The true midwifery model of care

“If you’re not changing it, you’re choosing it,"" wrote Mel Robbins. We believe this has never been more true. Steve Jobs once said, “Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to do what you love."" This is who we are, and birth work is what we love. Together, we will pave the road for our future, our children, and the change our mothers so desperately need.

Your contributions will help purchase a building we hope will see the birth of thousands of Tucson babies. They will help furnish the birthing suites and family care rooms. They will provide comfortable seating for mommy/baby groups and childbirth classes, beautiful tubs for labor and birth, and the beds where new families will bond in the sacred, uninterrupted hours after birth.  Also, snacks.  Oh yes, there will be snacks.

 

The United States arguably has the worst maternity outcomes of any developed country. While other countries' maternal mortality rates are dropping, ours continues to rise.  More than 98% of babies are born in hospitals, yet research has repeatedly shown birth centers to be the optimal place for healthy, low-risk women to give birth. With a maternal mortality rate of 0%, a Cesarean rate of just 6%, and a maternal satisfaction rate of 98%, freestanding birth centers play an integral role in improving maternity care and birth outcomes in the U.S. The stakes are high and we NEED more birth centers.

While our immediate next step is to open a location in Tucson - a metropolitan city with no freestanding birth center - our ultimate goal is to expand into several cities over the coming years. Your contribution to this campaign will help grow birth centers and provide midwifery care to as many families as possible.

To make Babymoon Inn of Tucson a reality, we need your help! Your donations will help create a space to serve Tucson families for years to come.  If you know firsthand the impact birth centers have on communities, your life has been touched by a midwife, or you simply want to support women and babies by providing them with a safe, evidence-based option for pregnancy and birth, please consider donating at one of the following levels.

 

When Julia and Steven Hall moved to Phoenix after a personally life-changing experience with birth center care in Texas, they discovered there weren’t any local birth centers in the Phoenix area and knew that had to change. Thus, Babymoon Inn was born and has been serving and growing families since 2010. Beginning as a single building offering out-of-hospital birth, Babymoon of Phoenix has since expanded to four buildings that include full-scope midwifery care, comprehensive childbirth education, group prenatal appointments, doula services, lactation support, prenatal and therapeutic massage, facials, chiropractic care, and primary care.

However, it is the people who walk through our doors every day that are the heart and soul of Babymoon Inn. Our clients (from first-time parents to families having their fourth Babymoon Inn baby) and our committed and passionate team members, all devoted to improving maternity care and demanding better outcomes for moms and babies, are the reason Babymoon exists and has grown to become a safe space for so many women and their families throughout pregnancy and postpartum.

Every dollar donated will help bring this model of care to Tucson families. From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for supporting us in bringing a new freestanding birth center to Tucson.

column3: >Hi there, thanks for stopping by to check out our campaign! Allow me to do some introductions: we're two sisters with one top priority – your satisfaction. We want you to be satisfied with your sexuality, with your relationships, and with the products you purchase to enhance each of those.

>""So, who or what is Pure?"" The idea arrived in early 2006. At the time, I was making a living as an independent representative of a popular adult home-party company. I wanted to be satisfied - I loved the work and I loved the way it allowed me to connect with and empower women, but I did not love all of the products I was selling. Pure is my response
column4: Pure is about integrity. You see, I cannot sell what I will not buy, and I will not buy poorly made products that are laden with chemicals.

column3: >When it comes to adult products, it turns out that's difficult to avoid! Items are often classified as “novelty” and are not well regulated in the US.
>I founded Pure in August, 2011 to take the guesswork out of intimate shopping. My sister Elise came aboard as my apprentice shortly thereafter
column7: >ogether, our goal is to present high-quality, body-safe products to customers in a fun, informative, and comfortable environment. Elise and I have spent our time since last August conducting open houses and “preview parties"" across the north east. We introduced a limited collection of products to women throughout the region and seized those opportunities to gain feedback and gauge interest. We were beyond thrilled to be well received everywhere we went. From Ithaca, NY to Philadelphia, PA to Washington, DC – women loved what we were doing (read about one party here:

column3: >We are now poised to scale up our operations and fully realize the potential of Pure! We aim to:

column1: <ul>
<li>

column7: > products that are body-safe (non-toxic, free of pthalates and other harsh ingredients), high-quality (made of materials such as medical grade silicon, glass and ABS plastic), and cruelty-free.

column1: <li>

column3: >Create a “sex positive” environment for women and couples so that they may explore intimacy and ask questions about sexuality.

column1: <li>

column3: >Provide outstanding customer service, always focusing on the needs of our patrons – whether it be providing assistance with finding the right product or ensuring discretion with orders, our customer's priorities are our priorities.

column1: <li>

column3: >Help you throw one heck of a party! Pure parties make great “girl's night” get-togethers, bachlorette parties, and can even be suited for fundraising events! Guests will laugh and learn
column4: they will also be able to shop knowing that all of the items Pure offers are earth and body friendly.

column3: >Pure is a woman owned, independently operated micro-business. I was able to fund our preview year and test our market by juggling a variety of part-time jobs (lunch-time delivery driver, freelance technical writer, GSA application processing aid...), and I'm grateful for every bit of the experience – but now it's time to make Pure happen! We have done the homework and we have the experience, all we need is a little boost to get there.
>Funds raised from this campaign will go to:

column1: <ul>
<li>

column3: >Increasing our collection – We toured with a limited line of products from top manufacturers such as Lelo, JimmyJane, ToyFriend, and Blossom Organics
column4: we plan to double our collection this fall/winter and bring more of the best on the market to our customers, including products from: Earthly Body, Intimate Organics, and Hathor Aphrodisia.

column1: <li>

column3: >Building our Inventory – We understand our customer's need for discretion, so we will never drop-ship (the practice of allowing the wholesaler to ship to the customer, rather than the retailer). In addition, carrying inventory means we bring products to Pure parties, which reduces shipping expenses (therefore passing savings on to our customers) and ensures discretion of purchases.

column1: <li>

column3: >Launching our website – We want our customers to have access to information and resources about our company and the products we offer, as well as create a space for sharing sex positive information about intimacy and sexuality!

>More than that - by making a contribution you enable us to grow. Your support allows us to reach out to women and couples and help them feel confident and comfortable with their own sexuality, as well as feel good about the products they are purchasing.
>...and, of course, you also earn some lovely ""perks!"" Look to the right to find out more.

>pure@whatsinyourtoybox.com

column1: So, who or what is Pure?"" The idea arrived in early 2006. At the time, I was making a living as an independent representative of a popular adult home-party company. I wanted to be satisfied - I loved the work and I loved the way it allowed me to connect with and empower women, but I did not love all of the products I was selling. Pure is my response
column2: Pure is about integrity. You see, I cannot sell what I will not buy, and I will not buy poorly made products that are laden with chemicals.

column1: When it comes to adult products, it turns out that's difficult to avoid! Items are often classified as “novelty” and are not well regulated in the US.

I founded Pure in August, 2011 to take the guesswork out of intimate shopping. My sister Elise came aboard as my apprentice shortly thereafter. Together, our goal is to present high-quality, body-safe products to customers in a fun, informative, and comfortable environment. Elise and I have spent our time since last August conducting open houses and “preview parties"" across the north east. We introduced a limited collection of products to women throughout the region and seized those opportunities to gain feedback and gauge interest. We were beyond thrilled to be well received everywhere we went. From Ithaca, NY to Philadelphia, PA to Washington, DC – women loved what we were doing (read about one party here: http://www.pixelsandpumps.com/2012/06/14/pure-party/).
We are now poised to scale up our operations and fully realize the potential of Pure! We aim to:

Offer only products that are body-safe (non-toxic, free of pthalates and other harsh ingredients), high-quality (made of materials such as medical grade silicon, glass and ABS plastic), and cruelty-free.
Create a “sex positive” environment for women and couples so that they may explore intimacy and ask questions about sexuality.

Provide outstanding customer service, always focusing on the needs of our patrons – whether it be providing assistance with finding the right product or ensuring discretion with orders, our customer's priorities are our priorities.
Help you throw one heck of a party! Pure parties make great “girl's night” get-togethers, bachlorette parties, and can even be suited for fundraising events! Guests will laugh and learn
column2: they will also be able to shop knowing that all of the items Pure offers are earth and body friendly.

column1: So...why do we need your support?

Pure is a woman owned, independently operated micro-business. I was able to fund our preview year and test our market by juggling a variety of part-time jobs (lunch-time delivery driver, freelance technical writer, GSA application processing aid...), and I'm grateful for every bit of the experience – but now it's time to make Pure happen! We have done the homework and we have the experience, all we need is a little boost to get there.
Funds raised from this campaign will go to:
Increasing our collection – We toured with a limited line of products from top manufacturers such as Lelo, JimmyJane, ToyFriend, and Blossom Organics
column2: we plan to double our collection this fall/winter and bring more of the best on the market to our customers, including products from: Earthly Body, Intimate Organics, and Hathor Aphrodisia.

column1: Building our Inventory – We understand our customer's need for discretion, so we will never drop-ship (the practice of allowing the wholesaler to ship to the customer, rather than the retailer). In addition, carrying inventory means we bring products to Pure parties, which reduces shipping expenses (therefore passing savings on to our customers) and ensures discretion of purchases.

Launching our website – We want our customers to have access to information and resources about our company and the products we offer, as well as create a space for sharing sex positive information about intimacy and sexuality!

More than that - by making a contribution you enable us to grow. Your support allows us to reach out to women and couples and help them feel confident and comfortable with their own sexuality, as well as feel good about the products they are purchasing.
...and, of course, you also earn some lovely ""perks!"" Look to the right to find out more.
Spread the love – Spread the word!
pure@whatsinyourtoybox.com",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Ithaca, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/pure-what-s-in-your-toy-box/pica

Why?

First, we would like to thank you for coming this far. Your interest in Parkour as a discipline and community is enough support for us.
<li>By ""We"" I mean the PPK Team. We started as just 4 dedicated visionaries and have grown to over 20 trusted die hard Coaches, Administrators, &amp
• We will be moving our Sicklerville location to Washington Township to meet the demands of the people (and to give you some shiny cool new stuff to play on).
• Almost 4 years ago we taught our first Parkour class in Washington Township...it just feels right to come back bigger and better to finish what we've started.

Keep reading for details on what's in it for you! 

What's in it for me? 

Contribution details:
• We are on a mission to raise $20,000 for the big move. The more money we raise the more awesome stuff we're going to put in the gym!

• Not only will you be receiving direct perks (listed below) but you will be helping us create a bigger, safer, and more creative environment for you and your little ones to learn, play, and grow as healthy people.
• Specifically: we will be getting a NEW FOAM PIT, NEW BAR SETUP, NEW WALLS, NEW BOXES, NEW WARPED WALL, AND MORE.

I have no money but I want to help! 

No money? No problem! Here's what you CAN DO:
• You can share this link to others that you think might benefit from contributing to our pre-sale.
• You can help us transport, and organize stuff from the old place as well as build new stuff at the new place.

• You can obviously always be helpful by telling others that Pinnacle Parkour is about inspiring people through movement. We want to change lives, help families get healthy, and get kids into a positive and uplifting lifestyle.

Thank you again, we could not have done it without you.

GF ToyMania 2013 

Active Toys For Active Change
column4:
>

GF ToyMania is a yearly initiative created by community leader and founder of GF Activewear, Goldin Martinez to help raise hundreds of new sports &
column5: fitness toys for children during the christmas holidays.

column1: At GF ToyMania Our Mission Is: Active Toys For Active Change.
Over the past three decades, obesity rates have increased dramatically worldwide. Obesity is a major risk factor for chronic diseases, accounting for an estimated 2.5 million deaths per year.

In the United States, nine million children between the ages of 6 and 12 are obese. Poor eating habits and the lack of physical activity are major causes of this epedimic, particularly in poor, under-served communities.

GF ToyMania is committed to combatting the obesity epidemic by encouraging the community to come out and celebrate the holiday season in a one day event that features celebrities, professional athletes, business owners, politicians, community leaders, live music, free food, giveaways, and more.

Our goal is to create a movement that will help raise hundreds of new sports and fitness related toys every holiday season that promote health, wellness and physical activity among NYC youth. 

Help Us Raise 400 New Sports and Fitness Toys This Christmas!

We are asking all our supporters to help us raise $5,000 to help GF ToyMania buy as many new sports and fitness toys for children as possible. 100% of all donations will be used to support GF ToyMania and our mission: Active Toys For Active Change.
GF Activewear Will Send A Limited Edition Black &
column2:
Gold GF ToyMania T-Shirt To Everyone Who Donates $100 Or More! 

Our Mission

Once our goal is complete we will take 100% of all funds raised and go purchase hundreds of new sports and fitness toys for children to giveaway during the Christmas Holiday. Our plan is to donate all the brand new sports and fitness toys we raise to all the students of P.S. 128 and Team Dreamers.  
We are hosting a free event on Sunday December 15th, 2013 from 12:00pm-6:00pm at P.S. 128 in Washington Heights in collaboration with the legendary Coach Dave Crenshaw and his organization Team Dreamers for all our supporters to enjoy. 
Everyone who donates can come enjoy hot chocolate, live music, catered food, celebrity guests, and more all for free. 
The flyer with all the information is located above and the event is completely free for everyone who supports our cause. You can also tell your friends to come out and bring their donation or new sports toy in person. Everyone is welcome to come celebrate the holiday season and help combat childhood obesity with us! 
Last year at GF ToyMania we raised over 300 new toys for children. This year at GF ToyMania we are aiming to raise 400 new toys for children. Each year our goal is to grow our movement even more so we can share the gift of Christmas and Exercise with  even more children in our community. 
Our high hopes is that GF ToyMania will become one of the positive solutions during our holiday season to the epidemic of Childhood Obesity. So please help us reach our goal this Christmas by supporting our cause and adding us to your list. 
We promise we've been good all year! 
Finally, please don't forget to:

column1: <span class=""Apple-style-span"" style=""font-family: arial, sans-serif

Even if you can’t donate, you can definitely help by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter and other social media — or in real life! Let your friends know that you support GF ToyMania and our mission — and they should, too! Here are a couple of sample tweets/posts to get you started. Just copy and paste them!
Help GF ToyMania raise $5,000 to help buy 400 new sports &
column2: fitness toys for kids this Christmas! Donate now!

I am a mother of 4 beautiful children and I am blessed to have them healthy !! I did have 3 of my children in the NICU for various time lengths but not more than a week...

Epidermolysis bullosa (EB) is a group of genetic conditions that affects roughly one in every 50,000 children. Children with EB have abnormally fragile skin: mild trauma or friction that would not affect other children can cause blisters and debilitating scarring.
I learned of EB from a facebook friend with the story of Easton Friedel.
The story touched me and NOW i am busy trying to find ways to help ALL families living with EB
I am donating all the profits of this fundraiser to the Butterfly Fund
http://thebutterflyfund.org/
The Butterfly Fund was started because of the need to get involved &
column2: to make a difference in the lives of people who truly need it.  It originated because of the need for awareness and help of those who suffer from the disease Epidermolysis Bullosa –  also known as EB.

column1: When we met these children and heard their stories, our hearts were never the same.

EB children are known as Butterfly Children, due to the fact that their skin is as fragile as a butterfly’s wing.  The Butterfly Fund has since expanded its hope and is dedicated to helping families who have a child diagnosed with any serious life altering disease or event.  All of these children are fragile…just like butterflies.
100% of the proceeds from our events go directly to family assistance in the form of financial aid, food, housing, clothing &
column2: care. Absolutely NO salaries are paid.  The Butterfly Fund does not discriminate and anyone and everyone who has a child with a serious illness may inquire with us.

column1: We cannot help these children without your help.

https://www.facebook.com/sonomabutterflyfund?fr...

First of all...

Thanks to everyone who donated to Phase 1! We not only met but exceeded our goal and we were able to start in on Phase 2 early! Your generous contributions have generated great results so far and we've only just begun!
For Phase 2:
We've got two large projects for this phase that will not only beautify the course but protect the environment in and around it as well.

Hole 11 - The Stump. Hole 11B's stump is rotting, surgery has already begun thanks to the donations from Phase 1, and we're going to finish the steps on the backside (uphill side) to prevent premature anthropogenic deterioration.

Hole 18. The area between pin positions B and C is easily one of the most eroded spots on the entire course. The south side of the large tree guarding the green has fully exposed roots, and the lack of grass and plants allows the wind to wreak havoc. We're duplicating the success of the phase 1 project enacted on hole 6 - which has been dubbed ""The Great Wall"" by the locals.
Finally, the tee signs on 2, 7, 9, and 13 are destroyed and/or missing due to either vandalism or rot. We are proud of our signage and easy navigation at GGP DGC so this state is unacceptable!
<div>
What we need:

Support through funding to keep the workers on the course part/full-time, providing for and serving the rapidly growing disc golf community in San Francisco and the greater Northern California region.

Through their tireless work and dedication, the Golden Gate Park Disc Golf Course will be the premiere free public course in the United States and the standard by which all other courses, private and public, will be judged in the future.

Vegan Health and Fitness Magazine is a brand new quarterly magazine jam-packed with workout tips, inspirational interviews,cutting edge scientific information, healthy recipes, and more-- for the whole family, from kids to seniors!  On top of all of that, each issue breaks stereotypes and features vegans who have achieved in all areas of fitness, from bodybuilding to endurance sports, from calisthenics to professional sports.

Our very first issue was Summer 2012 and was published in June. It featured vegan bodybuilder and best-selling author Robert Cheeke with vegan fitness model Koya Webb on the cover.  It was carried by over 170 natural grocery stores across the nation, including Whole Foods, Earthfare, Mother's Markets, Sprouts, Sunflower Markets, and Lassen's.  The first issue sold out in many locations in less than a week! Because of  the great response, our distributors more than doubled their orders for our second issue (Fall 2012), and we broadened our distribution to nearly a thousand stores across the US and Canada, including Barnes and Noble and Books-a-Million stores.

The fall issue is also selling very well (in fact it is selling out all over the place once again), and our distributors are saying that they want to double their orders again for our upcoming winter issue.  The only problem is that we don't have the money on hand to pay for the printing of that many copies yet.  The problem is that most advertisers have a policy of not advertising with magazines that have not been around for at least a year. But we don't want to wait that long to meet the demand for this magazine. We want to help make the world a fitter more compassionate place right away!  That's why we need your help!

Good Investment?

• My name is Paul Stewart and am a volunteer assistant coach in charge of General Operations.  
  • Each year our soccer program is given a very small budget that covers very little of the needs of the program.  The expectation by the school district is all the other funds will be raised through the boosters, but because many of our players come from low income homes what is collected through player booster donations does not come close to covering the large needs of the team.

• Our players will be participating in two fundraisers that will help cover some of that need, but we need generous  donors  like you to help fill the other gap.  
  • We currently are in need of 2 sets of new jerseys and shorts for 18 players, and our JV and B squad teams are playing with mis-matched uniforms.
What We Need

• We are in need of at least $1000.00.
  • With this money our team look like a team which provides a sense of being part of something bigger than themselves.  When they put on these uniforms, provided by people who believe in them, I know they will strive to believe in themselves which can lead far beyond soccer.

• Come cheer on our team.
  • Pass this webpage onto others

The Osseo Boys Soccer Program thanks you for all your support!

Our Vision:

We are asking you to join the force!  Your contribution will fuel our dream to give every woman an advantage in fighting the risk of Osteoporosis.

Osteoblaster is a follow-along video exercise series. It is a straight forward, easy to implement 30-day program. It includes 10-20 minute workouts that use mostly your own bodyweight – no equipment necessary. The program builds on itself so that you are never doing too much OR too little. Osteoblaster focuses on specific movements that can dramatically improve your bone quality.

The funds we raise will enable us to boost our marketing efforts and hire staff so that we can provide women of all ages the tools to keep their bones strong and fracture free for a lifetime.

We thank you for your support!  Together we can make a difference in our health.
Your partners in fitness are Dianne Sykes and Jannette La
Sota.  Dianne Sykes is an exercise
physiologist who has worked in a variety of roles in the fitness industry for
the past 17 years and Jannette La Sota is a retired Detective who served with
the NYPD for 25+ years.
Recognizing that our country is in its worst shape ever and how hard it is to
make sense of all the conflicting health information we are exposed to, Dianne
and Jannette decided to join forces to change the shape of our nation by teaching people in communities everywhere how to use fitness and nutrition to serve and protect their health for a lifetime.
Services:
It all starts with a preliminary investigation so that we,
the detectives, can piece together the clues that together can really solve your fitness ""case""!  During the preliminary
investigation we take the time to listen to you, your story, and your struggle, and
then we dig even deeper into your background so we can gather the information necessary to create the right program to achieve the results you
want.  The next step is to decide which
of our membership options is the right one to get you started.
Our most popular option is our ""Special Op’s"" membership
which includes a customized exercise program designed from the information we uncover
during your preliminary investigation, 4 semi-private intensive coaching
sessions per month, ongoing nutrition and lifestyle counseling, and unlimited
access to our facility and group classes.
Our Basic Training membership consists of unlimited access to our
monthly group classes which are designed to burn calories, improve balance and increase
energy.  We also offer special programs
designed to address various health and fitness related interest including a
coaching program for runners and <b><i>Osteoblaster, our program to help people with Osteopenia and
Osteoporosis.
","Our Vision:We are asking you to join the force!  Your contribution will fuel our dream to give every woman an advantage in fighting the risk of Osteoporosis.

Osteoblaster is a follow-along video exercise series. It is a straight forward, easy to implement 30-day program. It includes 10-20 minute workouts that use mostly your own bodyweight – no equipment necessary. The program builds on itself so that you are never doing too much OR too little. Osteoblaster focuses on specific movements that can dramatically improve your bone quality.The funds we raise will enable us to boost our marketing efforts and hire staff so that we can provide women of all ages the tools to keep their bones strong and fracture free for a lifetime.We thank you for your support!  Together we can make a difference in our health.            Our story:
Your partners in fitness are Dianne Sykes and Jannette La
Sota.  Dianne Sykes is an exercise
physiologist who has worked in a variety of roles in the fitness industry for
the past 17 years and Jannette La Sota is a retired Detective who served with
the NYPD for 25+ years.
Recognizing that our country is in its worst shape ever and how hard it is to
make sense of all the conflicting health information we are exposed to, Dianne
and Jannette decided to join forces to change the shape of our nation by teaching people in communities everywhere how to use fitness and nutrition to serve and protect their health for a lifetime.

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
• Introduce yourself and your background.
• Briefly describe your campaign and why it’s important to you.
• Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

column1: • Explain how much funding you need and where it’s going. Be transparent and specific—people need to trust you to want to fund you.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
• Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
• Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
• Make it real for people and build trust.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
• Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
• Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Hi,
I have always prided myself to taking care of myself and to
be of service, whether through healing skills, building or painting something
special for someone.
I am unable to practice Acupuncture in Arizona since I
graduated in the second class of the very first school in the country and now
my transcripts are no longer available.
I have been building custom furniture ad doing projects to
get by.
Last Wednesday ( 2-4-14), I was helping a friend design a
roof deck and the ladder slipped out and on my 12 foot decent my leg went
through the ladder rung and did a karate chop on my leg on impact which snapped
my tib and fib protruding them through my skin. It was not pretty.
I am still in the hospital and waiting for the swelling etc
to subside so that they can put all my pieces together with plates and screws.
I am blessed with good care and that it was not worse, but I
am afraid my insurance will not cover everything and when I am released I have
to come back for 20 hyperbaric treatments. One of the things not covered is transportation to and from the hospital for the 20 treatments and any sort of disability while I cannot work:(
I will more than likely be laid up for 3 or 4 months without
any way to earn an income and pay my bills :(.
I am not sure how I will meet the $3,000 ish monthly
financial burden for that 4 month time period and may face eviction and car
repossession.
It
is hard for me to humbly ask for this however If there is anything any of you can do and pitch in I will

be greatly appreciative. If there is anything I can do for you…just ask!

Perhaps I can do a painting for you or any life coaching counseling?
Peace and Abundance,
Conrad

Short Summary

We are 12 nursing students on a mission to raise money for the Haitian population that reside in the bateys in the Dominican Republic. The bateys are communities plagued with extreme poverty and therefore the members of these communities have many adverse health problems. We are raising money to provide analgesics, hypertension medication, vitamins, de-worming medication, and health screenings to the Haitian immigrants who so desperately need it.

All of the money received from this campaign will go directly towards supplies needed for us nursing students to provide care. None of the nursing students will be directly benefiting from the money received. 

What We Need 

We are looking to raise $2,000 in order to buy medical supplies so that we are able to provide adequate care to our patients in the Dominican Republic. Even if we do not reach this goal, we will be putting any money gathered from this campaign towards buying medication and other items to improve the health of the patients we see. Because of this, any donation, no matter how small would be greatly appreciated and will be used to impact and change the lives of those we meet in the Dominican Republic. 

The Impact

We are working towards creating a sustainable health care for the Haitian population in the bateys, but until that is established, we will continue to provide care as nursing students in the best way we know how. This money will be used to lower blood pressure, provide pain relief, promote adequate growth in children, help mothers sustain a health pregnancy, and dress wounds of the patients we encounter in the Dominican Republic. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just getting our mission heard by as many people as possible will help with our campaign, so we all would greatly appreciate it if you could pass the word along about our mission!

Why do so many ""challenges"" happen to good people?  This family of mom, dad, and four young children has struggled with partial hearing loss in a child, severe allergies, Aspergers Syndrome, and now mom has cancer.  Two years ago, due to budget cuts, everyone in the dad's agency took a 5% pay cut, followed by another smaller one this year.  Last year, Cooper's little sister was hospitalized twice and mom had to go to four specialists for a deep itching problem all over her skin, which turned out to be a precursor for the cancer.

My daughter is a stay at home mom and, due to various health challenges, she homeschools the kids. This is a happy family who faces their uphill battles together.  But right now they need some financial help to pay their portion of the cancer treatment costs.
Thank you for considering helping this wonderful family.

About the poem perk: Since I have always been in the writing profession, I wanted to give a perk that would be meaningful.  Of course, you would always have a virtual hug from us and gratitude in our prayers. But if you have a cherished family member who you would like to remember in a special way or someone you would like to give a special gift to, then I will write an original poem about that person based on information you provide.

Our Story

Hello! My name is Jonas Barnes. This campaign is for my nephew, Lawrence Melius and his parents. Recently, Lawrence was diagnosed with a very rare kidney tumor known as Wilm's Tumor. At only 2 years old, this is quite taxing on the little guy. As if that wasn't enough, his parents will be at a huge financial loss due to the treatment. Best case scenario, they will be paying $50,000 out of pocket on top of being out of work for over 3 months. They are family. And that is why I am going to do everything I possibly can to help them with this emotional and financial toll.
The Impact

This campaign will help a family under extreme financial and emotional distress due to a terrible tragedy that has fallen upon them. It will help keep food on their table and roof over their head while they deal with the treatment that their son will need to fight his disease. This money will help with medical costs, everyday costs while they are out of work caring for their son in and out of the hospital and will allow them to live as normal of a life as possible while they go through this ordeal.
<h3>What We Need &amp

I would never ask for the amount of money that they will be shouldering, but any amount will be an enormous help. I have set a goal of $5,000 and I think that will make a significant financial dent. The amount raised, whether it meets the goal or not, will all go to the Melius family to help with these costs. This is also only one phase of the campaign.

Locally, I am putting on fundraisers as well. I am a stand up comedian in the Pacific Northwest and will be doing 3 shows to raise funds for them as well. These shows, coupled with the help from all of you, will allow me to help my family deal with this tragedy without having added stress of a debt that will reach, at the lowest, $50,000.
Other Ways You Can Help
Please link this and spread the word on Facebook and Twitter if you see fit. Any and all help will be greatly appreciated. Thank you all in advance.

Short Summary

Hi, we are a group of doctors from the Philippines called the Yolanda Medical Relief group. We are colleagues and friends from Manila, some of us based in the US. We are currently raising funds for medical supplies to help us bring medical and surgical care to the victims of Typhoon Yolanda. As we all know, this Typhoon is the largest to hit since the history of the world with winds up to 300kph. Millions of Filipinos have been displaced, and numerous islands have been affected. The worst off, Tacloban, has an estimated 10,000 people who died.

We are working to save as much lives as we can. With your help and contribution, we can make this a reality. We have gathered a team of over 100 doctors (surgeons, orthopedic surgeons, pediatricians, internists) and are working with a major local airline who will transport us in waves, in and out of the most critically stricken islands and in places where no other local or international relief efforts have been able to reach. 

We pledge to provide updates on the ground, so we can show you where your contributions go to. 100% of your donations will go to medical equipment, supplies,
column2: >medicine, and surgical supplies from local suppliers and will equip the team on their mission. Any amount will go a long way. For instance, $5 can buy 100 pills of Doxycycline that can be used for treatment of infection and prevention of infections like leptospirosis. Funds will be managed by a team led by Dr. Ivy Cloma who is organizing the funds. We will also keep track of your contributions so we have a way of double checking. We will keep you updated upon confirmation of the receipt of your contribution.
column3: >We are aiming to raise a substantial amount of money so we can keep the missions going. The sooner we can get this off the ground, the better. We hope to catch patients before severe infection sets in and before they lose their leg from lack of wound care, or need for amputations. Your help can directly save lives!

column1: • We need $20,000. All of the funds will go to buying medicine (antibiotics, tetanus shots, surgical sutures, bandages, medical equipment and other logistic requirements such as batteries for light, tents, survival kits, clean water) to bring needed medical and surgical care to Typhoon victims.
• We are leveraging the power of stories, community, what it is to be human, and how we can all work together to save people's lives.
<li><span style=""line-height: 1.45em
column2: >If the entire goal is not reached, the funds raised will still go to the victims of the Typhoon. Your participation in our campaign will have made a difference in someone's life.

column1:
The Impact

Right now, the residents of the central region of the Philippines are in much need of food, shelter, clean water and medical care. As doctors, we feel it is our responsibility to provide the latter. Many have already volunteered their time, safety and personal conveniences to go into the field and help. It is our chance to provide them with as much resources as possible to be able to reach as many people as possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to your family and friends and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!!!

[Are you?]
<div>

column5: >[We are giving up rights until we raise the amounts shown to stand up for health equity.]

column1: <h2><strong><span>
<h1><span style=""font-size: 30px
TAKE PUBLIC TRANSPORT WHEN YOU NORMALLY WOULD NOT
<div style=""text-align: center
column2: >(Don't forget tell us how your challenge affects you by using #askwhyproject on Facebook!)

column1: <div style=""text-align: center
<div style=""text-align: center
<div style=""text-align: center
Thank you. Your impact is vital.

With your support we are raising funds for SocMed, a nonprofit that focuses on how social determinants (e.g. not drinking water, eating, or having a bed to sleep in) can impact the health and wellbeing of individuals and society.
<h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >SocMed works to educate and inspire future health care leaders to look beyond the biologic basis of disease and to stand in solidarity with those most affected by the social determinants of health. This understanding frames
column4: > in a direct relationship to health outcomes, transforming our system for a more just world.

column1: <h3><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
Praxis- We put our ideas into action.

SocMed runs an immersion course in Uganda that incorporates innovative teaching methodologies to merge teaching of medicine with understanding of the socioeconomic, cultural, political, and historical underpinnings of illness.
Personal- We know where we come from matters.
Who we are and where we come from matters deeply in healthcare delivery. Critical self-awareness enhances our ability to undo harmful structural and societal factors of which we are all part.
Partnership- We advance equity, together.

SocMed utilizes a curriculum that emphasizes building personal partnerships and reflection upon personal experiences with power, privilege, race, class, gender, and sexual orientation as central to effective partnership building in global health.
[Where your money goes:]
SocMed is a young organization, and donating a little will go a long way:
<ul>
• Providing scholarships for students from resource-limited settings who could not otherwise attend the course
<li><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >Financially supporting Aaron and Missy as they travel to Uganda to maximize the potential of SocMed

column1: [What YOU get:]
As a thank you for standing with us for health equity, you will receive one or more of the following:
<li>
<strong style=""font-size: 24px
<li>
<strong style=""font-size: 24px
<li>
<strong style=""font-size: 24px
<li>
<strong style=""font-size: 24px
<li>
<strong style=""font-size: 24px
<li>
<span style=""font-size: 24px
[More Ways to Help:]
<ul>

• Don't forget to challenge your friends on Facebook with our Facebook Challenge by tagging 3 friends and pasting the text below in your status bar:

    ""How healthy would you be without drinking water? Eating? Sleeping?
You have been tagged because I know you stand for human rights. You have 24 hours to show your support by tagging 3 friends who YOU KNOW stand for human rights and:
• 1.) Go to  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ask-why-project/x/8724994 to find and complete your human rights challenge.
<ul>
• 2.) Go to https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ask-why-project/x/8724994 and donate $20 to promote human rights education.
<li>
3.) Do both 1 and 2 to be entered into our grand prize drawing by sharing your reflections on your challenge by using #askwhyproject on Facebook.""

Learn more about SocMed on the Web!

Support SocMed on Facebook by liking us!
Remember to share thoughts and reflections with us on your challenge experience by using #askwhyproject on Facebook to keep the inspiration going and track our progress!
[Challenge Updates:]
<div>
Level 1=$500, Drinking water

We got headaches, dry mouths, and lightheaded. We weren't sure if this was from lack of caffeine or dehydration. Either way, we thank you for kicking off this project strong and sharing our passion for health equity!

Why? Nearly 1 billion people in the developing world walk on average 3.5 miles to get water to drink.


Level 2=$1000, Sleeping on hard floors
<div>

Last night proved to be more challenging that I expected. I don't remember much in-between Midnight and 3am, fading in and out of consciousness, unable to sit up without the experiencing nausea and feeling light headed. Around 3am, I think, I received the news that I could sleep due to many generous donation, including that of my parents. I go to lay back down on the floor, but immediately had to sit up. I got sick several times in the trashcan, but all that left my body was of course the water I had been drinking in attempts to fill my empty stomach. --Brooke

Why? Aaron and Missy's brothers and sisters (ages 5-19) in Cameroon were forced by their father to get only 4.5 hours of sleep per night before awaking again to clean, cook over a fire, and study with what little concentration they could manage.

Level 3=$1500, eating white rice (without silverware)

We woke up this morning and groggily checked our contributions page and immediately perked up--we got rice for breakfast!!!! Using only our hands, we could only manage to stomach a little of the flavorless stuff without feeling full and sick, but it was such a welcome source of nourishment.
Why?
column2: >Because malnutrition is estimated to contribute to one-third of all child deaths worldwide.

column1: Level 4=$1750, shoes
column2: >While walking in the hard gravel, Brooke tried walking in the grass. She was stung by a bee on her foot within hours of not having shoes. We also felt ourselves being really vigilant
column3:
> about potential broken glass after the homecoming weekend on campus. 

Why? Over 300 million children worldwide are without shoes, and along with basic sanitation, shoes help prevent the spread of parasitic diseases that plague over 1.4 billion people worldwide.

column1:
Level 5=$2000, oral hygiene
Our mouths got fuzzy on the inside and definitely stinky. We found ourselves embarrassed to get too close to people to talk. 

Why? In Cameroon I witnessed infected teeth turn into body-eating bacteria colonies that whittled people to the bone, all because they were oppressed by a system that did not ensure them basic oral hygiene.

Level 6=$2200, eat vegetarian diet
We were eating about 500-700 calories of white rice per day. Brooke and Missy each lost about 8-9 pounds in this time. 

Why? Rice is the staple food for over 3 billion people (most of them poor) constituting over half of the world's population. For those of you interested more deeply check out this article about rice and US food-aid policy: http://www.globalresearch.ca/haiti-aid-or-trade...

column3:
/>

Level 7=$2400 bucket showers
We get to shower! With buckets!!! (Or in this case, a coffee pot! Which actually works really well!)

Why? An American taking a five-minute shower uses more water than the average person in a developing country slum uses for an entire day.

Level 8=$2600, sleeping in beds
We will NOT have to sleep on the floor tonight! :) 

Why? An estimated 150 million adults are suffering from sleep-related problems across the developing world that are linked to an increase in problems like depression and anxiety.

column1:
Level 9=$2800, hand washing
This was something that was surprisingly hard to NOT do accidentally. We all had hand washing really ingrained into our habits and found it hard to not do unconsciously. We take this simple habit for granted so much when in reality it is not something everyone can do easily. In the hospital in Cameroon, for example, soap was very hard to come by in a place it was desperately needed.

Why? The simple act of washing hands at critical times can reduce the number of diarrhoeal cases by up to 35%

Why?
