column1: ","We are dedicated to human rights.
[Are you?]
[We are giving up rights until we raise the amounts shown to stand up for health equity.]
[Challenge of the day to YOU:]
TAKE PUBLIC TRANSPORT WHEN YOU NORMALLY WOULD NOT
(Don't forget tell us how your challenge affects you by using #askwhyproject on Facebook!)
Thank you. Your impact is vital.

With your support we are raising funds for SocMed, a nonprofit that focuses on how social determinants (e.g. not drinking water, eating, or having a bed to sleep in) can impact the health and wellbeing of individuals and society.
The impact of SocMed is vital.
[Here's why:]

SocMed works to educate and inspire future health care leaders to look beyond the biologic basis of disease and to stand in solidarity with those most affected by the social determinants of health. This understanding frames equity in a direct relationship to health outcomes, transforming our system for a more just world.
[Here's how:]
Praxis- We put our ideas into action.

SocMed runs an immersion course in Uganda that incorporates innovative teaching methodologies to merge teaching of medicine with understanding of the socioeconomic, cultural, political, and historical underpinnings of illness.
Personal- We know where we come from matters.
Who we are and where we come from matters deeply in healthcare delivery. Critical self-awareness enhances our ability to undo harmful structural and societal factors of which we are all part.
Partnership- We advance equity, together.

SocMed utilizes a curriculum that emphasizes building personal partnerships and reflection upon personal experiences with power, privilege, race, class, gender, and sexual orientation as central to effective partnership building in global health.
[Where your money goes:]
SocMed is a young organization, and donating a little will go a long way:
Providing scholarships for students from resource-limited settings who could not otherwise attend the course
Financially supporting Aaron and Missy as they travel to Uganda to maximize the potential of SocMed
[What YOU get:]
As a thank you for standing with us for health equity, you will receive one or more of the following:
Tell Us Why: (Entrance into Grand-Prize Drawing)
Surprise Perk
SocMed Wristband
Thank you Letter from Uganda
Custom Human-Rights Inspired Artwork
A SocMed Scholarship in Your Name
[More Ways to Help:]

Don't forget to challenge your friends on Facebook with our Facebook Challenge by tagging 3 friends and pasting the text below in your status bar:""How healthy would you be without drinking water? Eating? Sleeping? #askwhyproject
You have been tagged because I know you stand for human rights. You have 24 hours to show your support by tagging 3 friends who YOU KNOW stand for human rights and:
1.)	Go to  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ask-why-project/x/8724994 to find and complete your human rights challenge.
2.)	Go to https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ask-why-project/x/8724994 and donate $20 to promote human rights education.
3.)	Do both 1 and 2 to be entered into our grand prize drawing by sharing your reflections on your challenge by using #askwhyproject on Facebook.""
Learn more about SocMed on the Web!Support SocMed on Facebook by liking us!
Remember to share thoughts and reflections with us on your challenge experience by using #askwhyproject on Facebook to keep the inspiration going and track our progress!
[Challenge Updates:]
Level 1=$500, Drinking water

We got headaches, dry mouths, and lightheaded. We weren't sure if this was from lack of caffeine or dehydration. Either way, we thank you for kicking off this project strong and sharing our passion for health equity!
Why? Nearly 1 billion people in the developing world walk on average 3.5 miles to get water to drink.Level 2=$1000, Sleeping on hard floors

Last night proved to be more challenging that I expected. I don't remember much in-between Midnight and 3am, fading in and out of consciousness, unable to sit up without the experiencing nausea and feeling light headed. Around 3am, I think, I received the news that I could sleep due to many generous donation, including that of my parents. I go to lay back down on the floor, but immediately had to sit up. I got sick several times in the trashcan, but all that left my body was of course the water I had been drinking in attempts to fill my empty stomach. --BrookeWhy? Aaron and Missy's brothers and sisters (ages 5-19) in Cameroon were forced by their father to get only 4.5 hours of sleep per night before awaking again to clean, cook over a fire, and study with what little concentration they could manage.Level 3=$1500, eating white rice (without silverware)

We woke up this morning and groggily checked our contributions page and immediately perked up--we got rice for breakfast!!!! Using only our hands, we could only manage to stomach a little of the flavorless stuff without feeling full and sick, but it was such a welcome source of nourishment.
Why? Because malnutrition is estimated to contribute to one-third of all child deaths worldwide.

Level 4=$1750, shoesWhile walking in the hard gravel, Brooke tried walking in the grass. She was stung by a bee on her foot within hours of not having shoes. We also felt ourselves being really vigilant about potential broken glass after the homecoming weekend on campus. Why? Over 300 million children worldwide are without shoes, and along with basic sanitation, shoes help prevent the spread of parasitic diseases that plague over 1.4 billion people worldwide.

Level 5=$2000, oral hygieneOur mouths got fuzzy on the inside and definitely stinky. We found ourselves embarrassed to get too close to people to talk. Why? In Cameroon I witnessed infected teeth turn into body-eating bacteria colonies that whittled people to the bone, all because they were oppressed by a system that did not ensure them basic oral hygiene.

Level 6=$2200, eat vegetarian dietWe were eating about 500-700 calories of white rice per day. Brooke and Missy each lost about 8-9 pounds in this time. Why? Rice is the staple food for over 3 billion people (most of them poor) constituting over half of the world's population. For those of you interested more deeply check out this article about rice and US food-aid policy: http://www.globalresearch.ca/haiti-aid-or-trade...

Level 7=$2400 bucket showersWe get to shower! With buckets!!! (Or in this case, a coffee pot! Which actually works really well!)Why? An American taking a five-minute shower uses more water than the average person in a developing country slum uses for an entire day.Level 8=$2600, sleeping in bedsWe will NOT have to sleep on the floor tonight! :) Why? An estimated 150 million adults are suffering from sleep-related problems across the developing world that are linked to an increase in problems like depression and anxiety.

Level 9=$2800, hand washingThis was something that was surprisingly hard to NOT do accidentally. We all had hand washing really ingrained into our habits and found it hard to not do unconsciously. We take this simple habit for granted so much when in reality it is not something everyone can do easily. In the hospital in Cameroon, for example, soap was very hard to come by in a place it was desperately needed.Why? The simple act of washing hands at critical times can reduce the number of diarrhoeal cases by up to 35%

Level 10=$3000, hygieneWe didn't use any products for hygiene, shave, or brush our hair. We got stinky. We felt like people were grossed out by us, and thus didn't interact with as many people very closely, even each other. Why? People may have internalized biases about how to treat people who smell or appear unclean. We need to be conscious to keep our biases in check and treat people with love and respect.

Level 11=$3200, cold showersIcy water all over your body is surprisingly unpleasant in the morning...Why? Cold showers are terrible. Not everyone can afford running water, much less hot water. I will always remember our 5 year old host brother in Cameroon crying and shivering. every. single. time. he got bathed with freezing cold water.
Level 12=$3400, using silverware

We got strange looks in public, and were definitely wary of eating with only our hands during the week we couldn't wash them. Why? Clean hands cut the number of child deaths from diarrhea (the second leading cause of child deaths) by almost half and from pneumonia (the leading cause of child deaths) by one-quarter.

Level 13 = $3600, clean clothesOops! We're sideways! But we still feel great from having clean clothes to change into! Why? People may ""view"" others who are unable to dress ""sharp"" in a negative light due to implicit biases. How does this article tell someone they should feel if they are unable to dress in a certain way? Should things change?
http://www.cbsnews.com/news/do-clothes-make-the-manager/
Level 14 =$3800, eating meat
We love chicken and fish, but we hope to be more mindful while consuming meat going forward.
Why? While traveling, we've learned that meat is sometimes eaten scarcely in some areas due to the high cost of production. It can be a sign of privilege and honor.
Level 15 = $4000, drink any beverage you please
We love water, but we love coffee more sometimes. Brooke was especially appreciative to attain this level as a busy college student with a never-ending schedule of events, meetings, and tests.
Why? 780 million people worldwide lack access to clean water. Try to remember this more often and be mindful every day.  Check out water.org for quick world water facts.
Level 16 = $4200, phone use
Phones were the easiest to accidentally forget. We are seemingly attached to our phones at all times and it's very second nature to answer a phone call or text.
Why? Mobile phones are increasingly ubiquitous in poor countries, which now account for four in every five connections worldwide.
Level 17 = $4600, car use
Missy and Aaron went from Lincoln, NE to Sioux Falls, SD to Minneapolis, MN because of the generosity of friends, family, busses, and trains! Thanks for the help!
Why? People facing poverty rely heavily on public transportation and pay inflated prices (in terms of time and direct charges.)
Level 18 = $4800, hot water
Don't you just love hot showers in the morning? We do too. We found ourselves simply bathing less to avoid the freezing cold water. (Probably not the most hygienic activity.)
Why? Hot showers are not the common experience in low and middle-income countries, and are
Level 19 = $5000, ""Self Actualization""",19.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Who We Are

Everyone loves a good comeback story. And no city has made a bigger comeback in recent years than Detroit. If you’re looking for a city that’s synonymous with grit, toughness, and hard work, look no further.

And if you’re looking for a brand to cut through the bullsh*t of the current state of the fitness industry, look no further than Detroit Muscle. We’re here to bring you nothing but the highest quality products, content, and motivation.

Products &
column2:
Services

The Tee Hooded T-Shirt – The durability and comfort of cotton + the stretch and fit of spandex. We took both fabrics and blended them optimally to allow you to move and sweat. Consider it your battle armor.

Stainless Steel Blender Bottle -- It's time to upgrade your blender bottle, because you deserve better. Durable stainless steel body, robust top cap, black powder coat finish, and capable of holding over 25 oz of your favorite liquid beverage. It's as tough as the iron you lift every day, and much better looking.

Detmuscle.com &
column3:
Instagram – Real knowledge, real (hard) workouts, and the high octane fuel injected motivation you need to kick your fitness pursuits into high gear.

We've got big plans

Join our community of like-minded fitness badasses, and follow our journey as we become the iconic fitness brand of Detroit, with an expanded product offering and the best damn fitness content available. One day, we'll fulfill our ultimate goal of opening up a gym in Detroit.

 

Enough talk, Let's move some heavy weight.

Short Summary

I'm a male-presenting dfab non-binary person with mental illness. I am having a lot of trouble finding a job. My family is not badly-off, but they did spend over 75,000 dollars on rehab for me. They are willing to pay for the double incision process but probably not any other masculinizing procedure. Insurance will probably cover nothing.
I am NOT EXPECTING THE TOTAL AMOUNT I HAVE SET, I will be happy with anything, but this is a very costly thing to do.

Hopefully I can get an appointment with Dr. Garramone, but if not there are local surgeons I can turn to.

What We Need &
I will use the money for:
• Travel funds (I may need a plane ticket, if not I still need gas/tolls)
• Double incision chest reassignment (probably around 7,000)
• POSSIBLY body contouring and liposuction for a generally masculine shape (max. 5000)
The perks are not fantastic, but they are all I can offer at the moment, since as I said it will be very hard for me to find a job, and if I do it will be barely minimum wage.
I experience daily severe dysphoria about my body. I bind my chest for over 6 hours a day when I go out, which hinders my breathing and causes back/shoulder problems for me.
This surgery would boost my confidence and curb my anxiety immensely. I can pass as male decently enough without it, but I would love to donate my binders and do things such as go swimming.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

As previously stated, I'm not expecting the total amount of money I have as my goal. I'm not at a terrible risk of not getting it, but as I also previously said, my parents shelled out a lot for that rehab and I'm not thrilled about making them pay for the rest of it.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Every dollar counts, but if you absolutely cannot spare anything, please share this in as many places as you can! This is so important to me!!

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>Hello, my name is Sharon Spencer and Quentin was my son.    Quentin was an amazing father, brother &amp
column2:
son and he passed away on July 15, 2014 he was 22 years old, and he died exactly 22 days before his birthday which is August 6, 1991.

What we are trying to do is 2 things. 

1.  Help pay for Quentin's Final Expenses

2.  Setting up a scholarship fund for his daughter Allie Mariah Spencer.

We have a video and pictures located in the gallery section.   We loved to have you take a look.

Quentin's death was a shocker to everyone, he was not feeling well and had flu like symptoms.

He went to the hospital for antibiotics on Sunday July 13.   After we spoke with doctors we we're told that he had Pneumonia, fluid in the lungs, bacteria in his blood, and something happening with his heart.    So they transported him to Sarasota Memorial on Sunday night.   Mike &
column3: I went up on Sunday night and visited with him.  At this point in time he was only on Oxygen.  During our visit Brittany &amp
column4:
Allie were there also.  We visited with him until 8pm which was the visiting hours and told him we would be back in the morning.

The following morning we had a phone call at 5:30 am telling us that Quentin was being admitted to the ICU something was majorly wrong with his heart.  Nonetheless Mike &
column5:
I were there in less than an hour coming from Port Charlotte.
Once we were there we spoke with the heart doctor and was told that Quentin was
majorly sick and was going thru some tests for his heart.    Around 9:30 am they
rushed Quentin into emergency surgery.    Now the doctor did state that most young patients would have a 1 in 400 chance to survive but unfortunately he stated Quentin has a 1 in 10 chance.  To be honest when I heard this I was saying to myself
ok these are still pretty good odds.   When they rushed Quentin into Surgery we did not find out until later that night around 10:15pm that Quentin flat lined on the way to surgery.    But they we're able to save him by hand pumping his heart for 1 1/2 hours.  So they went ahead and did the surgery but found out that Quentin had
severe damage to his heart and needed a bypass.  Quentin was able to survive the
by-pass surgery and was in recovery.  They also did put a temporary pace maker in his heart.   After 40 minutes he flat lined again and then they hand massaged his heart again for 1 hour and finally were able to move him back to ICU.   This surgery should of taken about 5 hours but lasted over ll hours.

Quentin returned back to ICU and we could only glance at him from a distance, all you literally could see was his nose.   Nonetheless the Doctors told us that he would
be in a drug induced coma and to go home and get some sleep.

Ended up going back to the hospital first thing in the morning.  And pretty much was greeted by a chaplain that gave me the grim news.   Quentin's body was dying and it would be just a matter of time.   His organs were not working, his left leg
was completely black and blue and his right leg was starting to do the same and they also told us that his left eye was going back and forth under his eye lid which
was a sign of a stroke.  At this point in time there was absolutely nothing we could do.  He could not get a heart transplant because you have to have other working organs, he couldn't have his leg amputated because you have to have circulation and absolutely nothing  was working. 

After I was given the news we were totally crushed.   I couldn't even describe the
emotions I was going thru sad, angry, numb.   This is not happening, this is so unfair.
But we were able to see him and then the reality of what was happening was like a huge slap in the face.  

I am very thankful for my Pastor Oz  (Life Port Church) for coming up in time to be able to do his last rights.  What I can say is that when he did pass away, he knew he was loved.   There was 7 of us that we're there as we pulled the plug, and what I mean by that is he was on 9 different IV's medicine and the doctor just unplugged 1 and he was gone right away.    This was something that we thought would be the best, even if we did  decide not to do the above he would of only had about 30 more minutes, So we let him have peace and I know he is in heaven looking down.

We had a memorial service at our Church (Life Port Church) on June 18 and over 140 of his friends and family attended.   This was amazing and he was so loved.    I would say about 1/2 of his friends could not make it.    We were expecting over 300 +.     I did not want to be sad so I did a Quentin's Life Celebration Service.  It was ""beautiful"".

We understand that not all people would be able to donate, and if you can't
that is fine, if you could just please spread the word. 
PLEASE TAKE A LOOK AT THE GALLERY TO SEE PICTURES OF QUENTIN &
column6:
ALLIE AS WELL AS A VIDEO. 

Thank you for taking the time to read this and God Bless!

Sharon &

Celebration Service.  It was ""beautiful"".We understand that not all people would be able to donate, and if you can't that is fine, if you could just please spread the word.  PLEASE TAKE A LOOK AT THE GALLERY TO SEE PICTURES OF QUENTIN & ALLIE AS WELL AS A VIDEO.  Thank you for taking the time to read this and God Bless!Sharon & Michael Spencer",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Port Charlotte, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/quentin-spencer-memory-fund/pica

(English will follow)

Tout comme la force du lien homme-animal, la qualité des soins offerts aux animaux ont énormément évolué dans les dernières décennies.  

EUTHABAG a été conçu par Dre Céline Leheurteux, vétérinaire. Au fil de 18 ans d'expérience, elle a réalisé l'ampleur de l'impact émotionnel de la perte d'un compagnon sur les familles. Il lui est devenu insoutenable de devoir disposer du corps de ses patients dans un sac poubelle. Faute d'option, c'est ce qui était utilisé pour transporter le corps des animaux entre leur décès et l'incinération ou l'enterrement avant Euthabag.  

En tant que professionnelle, elle ne se sentait pas à la hauteur de la confiance que les familles lui octroient. Ne trouvant aucune alternative adaptée sur le marché, elle a conçu une housse mortuaire qu'elle a mis en marché en 2016.  

EUTHABAG est disponible en 5 tailles, allant du cochon d'Inde au grand Danois. 

Cette housse répond aux besoins particuliers du domaine vétérinaire:
• Base antifuite
• Poignées intégrées
• Résistante
• Écologique
• Identifiable
• Élégante
• Respectueuse

De l'animal, de sa famille et du professionnalisme des équipes en santé animale 


 

L'écologie est aussi au cœur de nos préoccupations. EUTHABAG contient de la matière recyclée post-consommation, l'encre utilisée est à base d'eau et la colle, à base de résine végétale. Notre objectif à moyen terme est de produire Euthabag à partir de 75% de matière recyclée.  

 

La majorité des animaux seront incinérés après leur décès. Euthabag peut être incinéré car il ne contient pas de chlore. Il ne provoque pas d'émanation de dioxines ou de furanes lors de son incinération. Il peut aussi être enterré car il ne contient ni métaux lourds, ni contaminants industriels. 

 
Euthabag fait l'objet d'un brevet en instance au Canada et aux États-Unis et d'un dessin industriel au Canada, aux États-Unis et en Europe. C'est aussi une marque commerciale enregistrée au Canada, aux États-Unis et en Europe. 

 

Euthabag est vendu  seulement aux vétérinaires et crematoriums. Au Canada par les distributeurs CDMV et VP et aux É.U. sur le site transactionnel euthabag.com. 

 

400 cliniques en Amérique du Nord, en Europe, en Israel et au Panama se sentent mieux en utilisant Euthabag. Trois facultés vétérinaires l'ont aussi adopté, positionnant Euthabag comme un nouveau standard de pratique.

Nous avons besoin de l’aide du public pour faire connaître Euthabag et souligner auprès des vétérinaires l'importance aux yeux des familles de traiter les corps des animaux en préservant leur dignité. Au Québec, près de 50% des vétérinaires utilisent Euthabag et au Canada, 4%. Nous avons travaillé sans relâche afin d'offrir un produit accessible à tous et que l'époque des sacs de poubelle soit révolue. Nous considérons aussi que l'utilisation du sac poubelle est une insulte au professionnalisme des équipes qui travaillent si fort à prodiguer les meilleurs soins du vivant de l'animal et à la force du lien homme-animal. 

Afin de maintenir nos prix, nous avons besoin d'une masse critique d'utilisateurs. Même si un nouveau produit répond parfaitement à un besoin, il faut investir massivement en publicité afin de le faire changer les habitudes.  

Le meilleur canal de diffusion est par la production de webinaires éducatifs afin de permettre aux vétérinaires d'expérience comme aux jeunes, d'offrir un meilleur service aux familles qui doivent traverser la douloureuse épreuve de l'euthanasie d'un compagnon. La formation universitaire actuelle est presque inexistante. La production et la diffusion de ces séminaires en ligne sont coûteuses mais permettent de faire accepter le produit comme un nouveau standard tout en améliorant la formation des vétérinaires et le service offert. Nous avons déjà donné des conférences au Québec avec succès. Votre contribution servira à former les vétérinaires tout en faisant connaitre le produit. Si ce sujet vous touche, partagez! Et parlant-en à votre vétérinaire.
column3:
>

ENGLISH

EUTHABAG was designed by a veterinarian, Dr. Céline Leheurteux. With over 18 years of experience in practice, she realized the magnitude of the emotional impact the loss of a companion can have on a family. To her, it became unjustifiable to have her patients placed into a plastic (garbage) bag after euthanasia. Unfortunately, in the absence of other options, this was the only way to transport euthanized animals to places of incineration or burial...until now. 

As a professional armed with integrity, Céline did not feel completely worthy of the trust families gave her when handing over their deceased pets. Finding no suitable alternative on the market, she decided to design a body bag that she launched after 4 years of hard work (while raising 3 children!), in 2016. 

This body bag meets the special needs of the veterinary field: 

Leakproof  I  Tear-proof  I  Expandable I  Sturdy  

Integrated handles  I  Designed by a vet for veterinary teams

Respectful  I  Ecological  I  Identifiable

 

EUTHABAG is available in 5 sizes, from the tiniest of Guinea Pigs to Great Danes. 


The EUTHABAG design has a patent pending in the United States and Canada and an industrial drawing for the U.S., Canada and Europe. It is also a registered brand in the U.S., Canada and Europe. 

Ecology is also at the heart of our concerns. EUTHABAG contains post-consumer recycled material, the ink used is water-based, the glue is made from vegetable resin. Our medium-term goal is to produce Euthabag containing 75% recycled material. Our end-goal is to produce a sturdy enough product containing only recycled material. 

Most animals will be cremated after death. Euthabag can be incinerated because it does not contain any chlorinated compound. It does not emit dioxins or furans during its incineration. It can also be buried as it does not contain heavy metals or industrial contaminants. 

In Canada Euthabag is sold to veterinarians through the veterinary distributors CDMV and VP.  In the US, Euthabag is sold direct to veterinarians via euthabag.com. 

More than 400 clinics in North America, Europe, Israel, Panama, Costa Rica and the Cayman Islands feel better using Euthabag. Three veterinary schools are also using it, positioning Euthabag as a new practice standard.

We need the help of the public to make Euthabag known and to emphasize to veterinarians how important it is for you, that your pets bodies are treated with respect and dignity, not only in the final stages, but afterwards. In Québec, nearly 50% of veterinarians are using Euthabag and in Canada, 4% overall and in the US only 0,005%!. We have worked tirelessly to provide a product that is accessible to all and that the era of trash bags can be deemed over. The use of the garbage bag is not only an insult to the integrity of the animal health teams that work so hard to provide the best care for our animals, but also to the human-animal bond. 

In order to maintain our low cost, so that Euthabag can be available to everyone, we will need to capture a critical mass of clients in the rest of Canada and the United States. Even when a new product responds perfectly to a need, we must invest heavily in advertising to encourage change in peoples habits.  

Educational webinars are one of the best channels used to help broadcast information. In our case, they would be used to enable experienced and young veterinarians alike, the opportunity to improve their veterinary services for families who have had to go through the painful ordeal of losing a pet. Currently, the curriculum vets receive unfortunately doesn't support much training in these areas.  

 

The production and distribution of these online seminars is expensive but will help better train veterinarians to improve their end-of-life services and also accept this product as a new practice standard. Your contribution will be used to help better prepare and train veterinarians while helping to make the product known.  

If this topic touches your heart, please share and don't forget to talk to your veterinarian!

Some of you asked when will beta versions of Duik be available.

A
private webpage will be available as soon as the campaign will end
(2015-02-17) for all those who contributed 25€ and more. On this page,
you will be able to download test versions of Duik as well as examples projects

and expressions created for new tools and not yet implemented in Duik, as soon as they are developped.

We can't say yet exactly when each feature will be finished and available
column2:
developping can be a long process with lots of surprises.
Anyway, the real work work will begin just after the end of the campaign, in the end of February.
A release candidate version of Duik 15 should be available by the end of April, after a bunch of alpha and beta versions.

Duik 15 may be available before this summer, if everything goes well, along with its documentation and libDuik.


- 2D Camera animation tool, to create controllers to

column1: automatically move backgrounds and overlays, faking a camera without

the need of 3D Layers.


- 3-layer IK
- Randomizer
- Blink animation
- Paint animation
- Move away tool

All of those are already working and will be available as test packages on the private page for indiegogo funders.


- Developping libDuik, which will be used by Duik 15 itself
- Implementing new animation tools (blink animation, paint animation and move away tool, randomizer)
- Upgrading Duik User Interface
to make it more user friendly and easier to understand and use,
preparing the implementation of more complex tools as 3-layer IK and the

new Autorig.
- Upgrading IK Creation to make it easier,
automatically detecting how the layers are parented and placed to get

rid of the need to select the layers in the correct order.
- Upgrading the Dialog window of the IK Creation, to make it easier to understand what are the options available and the type of IK to create.
- Implementing 3-layer IK
- Developping the new Autorig,
improving the biped rig and adding quadrupeds rigs. There should be
three main options when using the autorig: Bipeds (humans and other
primates), Plantigrades quadrupeds (bears, mice, rabbits, primates...)

and Digitigrades quadrupeds (dinosaurs, cats, dogs...)
- Developping a complete translation tool, to make it easier to translate Duik in a lot of languages.


Unfortunately, the autorig, one of the functions the most awaited, will
be developped at the end only, its development needing the other tools

to be available first.
Anyway, quadrupeds rigs will be available to
test earlier, a horse being one of the characters proposed to those who

contributed more than 50€.

Only when the development of Duik 15 will be finished, the complete user guide will be written, along with the developper's guide, but it shouldn't take long for it to be available.

Then, the tutorials will be made, beginning by updating the already available ones to match Duik 15 updates.



It seems we are going to raise the 4650 € initially needed, thanks to you all funders and sharers!
Now, the campaign continues with new goals, to make Duik even better and easier to use.

- Funded! Developping libDuik, a library (ExtendScript Object) to make it easy to include Duik in any other script for After Effects. This library will be released under a free software license (see the Free Software Foundation).

This means anyone will be able to use Duik in any script. We just can't wait to see the autorigs and scripts YOU can do with this!

- Funded! Writing the complete developper reference of Duik and libDuik. Just to make it even easier to use, including tips and tricks to give you anything you need to extend Duik to the infinity and beyond.
column3:
/>

- Funded! Dubbing the tutorials should make them easier to understand for all non-French speakers who currently have only English subtitles.
column5:
/>

- Funded! Duik already includes several languages, but all translations are not completed yet. We could finish those, especially German and Spanish, the two languages the most spoken by Duik users after English and French.
column7:
/>

- 7500 € and more: All tutorials made with the initial funding will be about the functions of Duik, explaining each one, to help users to know everything they can do with the script. Advanced tutorials would show how to use Duik on complex rigs, how to use it with other scripts and plugins...

Examples: How to rig a foot with toes, Face rigging, Hand rigging, Animating a walk cycle, Tips and Tricks about camera animation, Writing complex expressions, Developping with ExtendScript...

column1: It brings some
common tools and techniques used in 3D Softwares (like Maya, 3DS
Max...) to After Effects and 2D animation, which really lacked those
features.
The need of those tools is proven by the worldwide use of
Duik, which has been downloaded about 200,000 times since its
first release in 2009. (see the gallery for some examples of what can be done with Duik).
Above all, Duik is completely free, and will stay free,
for any purpose. You can download it, use it, share it, modify it, as

much as you want!
And this won’t change! Even being a
great success, Duik won’t be sold. Let’s share techniques and
knowledge!
It has been developped by NicolasDufresne, a French director and animator who needed those tools
and decided to share them freely once developped.
Duik is in its 14th version, which was released a year ago.
Duik brings the easy Inverse Kinematics (IK) to After

Effects.
IK is about being able to rig and animate a character

a lot more naturally.

For example let's say you had to animate
an arm sway. Normally in After Effects you would <b>separate the arm
into bones (arm, forearm and hand). Once you had parented all the
bones you would then have to animate each part separately - that's
what is called Forward Kinematics (FK). But, whatever
you keyed on the shoulder (rotation, scale or position), would have
an effect on the forearm and hand (rotation, scale, position). It was
always a balancing act. At the end of animating an arm, you would end
up with a mass of key frames, each individually affecting the limbs
(bones). This would make tweaking and adjusting the animation a

bleedin’ nightmare.

With IK you have one controller.
Through the arm you place bones which, like before, you create a
parenting system (Hand to forearm, forearm to arm). You then hit this
magic button which creates a fully possible arm. The unique thing
about this, is you only animate the controller. This means less key
frames and less fuss. Unlike before you can now tweak and reanimate
with ease.
This tool is essential in many cases – to animate a character,
especially for a walk, a run
column2: to animate mechanical processes of any

column1: kind, etc. – inverse kinematics implied the use of very complex

trigonometrical expressions in After Effects (see DanEbberts‘s expressions).
Duik automates this creation process
to allow the animator to focus on the animation! A simple controller
at the end of an arm, of a leg, or on the shoulders, an IK that was
created in one clic, now <strong>one can animate the entire limb just
by modifying the position of the hand or the foot!
Bones are layers which replace puppet pins
in After Effects. Created in a single click, they can be parented and
be controlled by IK’s. One can reproduce the exact same methods
like for the rigging of characters in 3D, but in After Effects. The
puppet acts like skinning, and Duik fills out the setup!
Most of the characters are alike… Arms, Legs, Head… To avoid
repeating the same work again and again, Duik’s
Autorig can automatically rig a biped character!
You only have to move the anchor points to the appropriate joints (or
create bones if you use a puppet) and the Autorig does the

job: controllers, parenting, IK’s, expressions…
And because
anyone is unique, the Autorig
adapts to your character: wether it has only one arm, or
it’s legs don’t have knees, it doesn’t matter, the rig is
automaticaly adapted.
When a limb bends, you may have to draw folds on the cloth, or a
muscle flex, or to adjust the shape of the elbow… <em><b>Rotation
Morph was made to easily control how a property changes

(shape, time remap…) when a reference layer rotates.

A new
tutorial will be made very soon to show you how to use this powerful
tool.
It’s one thing to have well rigged characters, now you have to
animate them easily! <strong>Duik brings all kinds of animation
controllers, from the powerful Spring, which
automates delays and bounces of an object, to the Wheel,

which automates the rotation of the layer while it translates.
Among
those tools, now you can copy/paste an animation
from several layers at once very easily, into the same composition to
repeat the animation, or from a composition to another to reuse

it.
There is also a very simple interface to manage
interpolations to animate very easily without manipulating
curves.

• New IK for 3+1 Layer

Until now, an IK could only be created on two layers (for
example, the upper arm and the forearm, or the thigh and the calf),
with a possibility to add a Goal to the limb (the last part :

the hand or the foot).
There will now be a way to create an IK
on three layers, while keeping the possibility to add a goal to
the limb. This can be very useful to human limbs: <b>adding an extra
layer in the elbows or the knees can help a better bending. And

obviously, this can enable more animal or mechanic rigs.

• A better Autorig

The autorig will be able to rig more complex legs, including feet
and toes joints, for more natural and realistic movements of the

feet.
The torso, neck and head will have a better rigging,

easier to animate.
There will be more options to make the
autorig more versatile, being able not only to rig bipeds but <b>animals

and quadrupeds too.


• New animation tools

• List controller, to be able to mix different
animations and expressions on one property.
• Move Away tool which can move away a layer from
another.
• Animate Paint, to easily animate paint strokes
made in After Effects.
• Blink, to easily create a blinking property.
• Randomizer, to randomize transformations, in
points and out points of layers.
• 2D Camera, to create controllers to
automatically move backgrounds and overlays, faking a camera without
the need of 3D Layers.
• Translation tool
A very simple app will be available to enable users to add or
update their own translations of Duik, in any language. Those
translations could then be included in future updates of Duik!
• Easier to use
Some enhancements to the interface, and including help inside Duik

will make it even easier to use, and easier to understand each tool.

• A complete documentation &
Why release a powerful tool if people do not know how to use it?
Duik 15 will be released with a full user reference, and tutorials
will be made for each tool (some are already available on Duduf Training).
Duik is a very useful tool for After Effects, and we think it
should be available for everyone. Thus, Duik is a free
software and it will not ever be sold, for any price, to anyone. It
is and should always be free - see the Free Software Foundation for a complete explanation of what it means
being a free software - Duik is released under the GNU-GPL v3, its source code is available on Github.
But developping this kind of tool, supporting it, making
tutorials, maintaining the website take a lot of time, and cost
money, which must be found, one way or another.
Crowdfunding now seems the best way to continue the quick
development of Duik while keeping it free for everyone.
While donations are like paying for an existing tool,
crowdfunding is bringing together a lot of enthusiast users to bring
Duik to its next level, while keeping it free.
What will be done with the funds?
<ul><li>

If the 4650 € crowd-funding goal is reached:

•
Duik 15 Release (development of new tools, updating the

website, writing a complete user reference)
•
One tutorial for each feature of Duik (some are already
available on <a href=""http://duduf.training/?lang=en"" rel=""noopener nofollow"">Duduf

Training)
• 4% (186 €) go to Indiegogo

If more than 5000 € are raised, some of these could be done:

• More tutorials about advanced techniques (how to rig a foot with toes, how to rig digitigrades...)
• More translations of Duik (German, Spanish...)
• English dubbing of the tutorials
• Writing a developper reference
• Creating a library to make it easy to use Duik in other scripts...

If the goal of 4650 € is not reached:

• Indiegogo will keep 9% instead of 4%
• Priority will be givent to the developement of Duik, but the tutorials, documentation could be delayed or even canceled.

From v1 to v9: The first versions - 2009 - 4,200 Downloads

• Inverse Kinematics - IK
• Bones
• Animation tools

From v10 to v12: The jump - 2010 ~ 2012 - 42,700 Downloads

The release of Duik 10 made it famous, and it became used worldwide at that time.
• New User Interface
• New Rigging Tools
• New Interpolation Panel

v13: The renovation - 2012 ~ 2014 - 68,000 Downloads

• More animation tools

v14: The revolution - 2014 - 70,800 Downloads so far (350+ per day!)

The 14th version was the biggest update to Duik (until 15!) and its usage spread even more.
• Complete Autorig
• IK upgrades
• Stretchy IK
• FK over IK
• User interface upgraded
• New automated spring function


All of this was made for free by Nicolas ""Duduf"" Dufresne, and, even being a growing success, Duik is and will stay free!
column3:
/>


□ Early users (25€ and more):

You'll get an access to testing versions of Duik 15 (alpha, beta and release candidates) as soon as they are released, and a unique opportunity to help development and make suggestions.

□ Rigged Characters (50-100€):

You'll get some characters rigged by Duduf with After Effects.
50€ per character, if you want more than two characters, add 50€ each to your pledge.
Those characters will be free to use, only for non commercial use.

See the list of characters available below. Other characters may be added in the future!

□ Animated Characters (150-200€):

You'll get some characters rigged and animated by Duduf with After Effects.
First character: 150€, then 50€ per character. If you want more than two characters, add 50€ each to your pledge.
Those characters will be free to use, only for non commercial use.

See the list of characters available below. Other characters may be added in the future!

□ A rig to your own character (500€):

Duduf will create a simple rig to your own personnal 2D character design with After Effects.
You'll be free to use this character as you want, as long as you include Duduf in the credits of the movie.
This rig will not include facial rig or fake 3D turns. If you want a complex rig, please contact Duduf.

□ Your personnalized tutorial (1000€):

Duduf will rig your own personnal 2D character design with After Effects. You'll be free to use this character as you want, as long as you include Duduf in the credits of the movie.
This rig will be sent to you along with a complete video tutorial explaining how to re-create it.
This rig will not include facial rig or fake 3D turns. If you want a complex rig, please contact Duduf.

□ Meet Duduf (1000-2000-3000€):

Duduf will come for a day to meet you/your company. This is a unique occasion to ask questions about Duik, rigging, and animation with After Effects, or solve any problem you may have. Or maybe just have a nice drink together?
For English or French speakers only, or others if you have a interpreter!

France or Belgium: 1000€
Europe: 2000€
Anywhere else: 3000€

","Some of you asked when will beta versions of Duik be available.A

column1: private webpage will be available as soon as the campaign will end
(2015-02-17) for all those who contributed 25€ and more. On this page,
you will be able to download test versions of Duik as well as examples projects
and expressions created for new tools and not yet implemented in Duik, as soon as they are developped.We can't say yet exactly when each feature will be finished and available
column2: developping can be a long process with lots of surprises.Anyway, the real work  work will begin just after the end of the campaign, in the end of February.A release candidate version of Duik 15 should be available by the end of April, after a bunch of alpha and beta versions.Duik 15 may be available before this summer, if everything goes well, along with its documentation and libDuik.- 2D Camera animation tool,  to create controllers to

column1: automatically move backgrounds and overlays, faking a camera without

the need of 3D Layers.- 3-layer IK- Randomizer- Blink animation- Paint animation- Move away toolAll of those are already working and will be available as test packages on the private page for indiegogo funders.- Developping libDuik, which will be used by Duik 15 itself- Implementing new animation tools (blink animation, paint animation and move away tool, randomizer)- Upgrading Duik User Interface
to make it more user friendly and easier to understand and use,
preparing the implementation of more complex tools as 3-layer IK and the
new Autorig.- Upgrading IK Creation to make it easier,
automatically detecting how the layers are parented and placed to get

rid of the need to select the layers in the correct order.- Upgrading the Dialog window of the IK Creation, to make it easier to understand what are the options available and the type of IK to create.- Implementing 3-layer IK- Developping the new Autorig,
improving the biped rig and adding quadrupeds rigs. There should be
three main options when using the autorig: Bipeds (humans and other
primates), Plantigrades quadrupeds (bears, mice, rabbits, primates...)

and Digitigrades quadrupeds (dinosaurs, cats, dogs...)- Developping a complete translation tool, to make it easier to translate Duik in a lot of languages.Unfortunately, the autorig, one of the functions the most awaited, will
be developped at the end only, its development needing the other tools
to be available first.Anyway, quadrupeds rigs will be available to
test earlier, a horse being one of the characters proposed to those who

contributed more than 50€.Only when the development of Duik 15 will be finished, the complete user guide will be written, along with the developper's guide, but it shouldn't take long for it to be available.Then, the tutorials will be made, beginning by updating the already available ones to match Duik 15 updates.It seems we are going to raise the 4650 € initially needed, thanks to you all funders and sharers!Now, the campaign continues with new goals, to make Duik even better and easier to use.- Funded! Developping libDuik, a library (ExtendScript Object) to make it easy to include Duik in any other script for After Effects. This library will be released under a free software license (see the Free Software Foundation).This means anyone will be able to use Duik in any script. We just can't wait to see the autorigs and scripts YOU can do with this!- Funded! Writing the complete developper reference of Duik and libDuik. Just to make it even easier to use, including tips and tricks to give you anything you need to extend Duik to the infinity and beyond.- Funded! Dubbing the tutorials should make them easier to understand for all non-French speakers who currently have only English subtitles.- Funded! Duik already includes several languages, but all translations are not completed yet. We could finish those, especially German and Spanish, the two languages the most spoken by Duik users after English and French.- 7500 € and more: All tutorials made with the initial funding will be about the functions of Duik, explaining each one, to help users to know everything they can do with the script. Advanced tutorials would show how to use Duik on complex rigs, how to use it with other scripts and plugins...Examples: How to rig a foot with toes, Face rigging, Hand rigging, Animating a walk cycle, Tips and Tricks about camera animation, Writing complex expressions, Developping with ExtendScript...
It brings some
common tools and techniques used in 3D Softwares (like Maya, 3DS
Max...) to After Effects and 2D animation, which really lacked those
features.
The need of those tools is proven by the worldwide use of
Duik, which has been downloaded about 200,000 times since its
first release in 2009. (see the gallery  for some examples of what can be done with Duik).
Above all, Duik is completely free, and will stay free,
for any purpose. You can download it, use it, share it, modify it, as
much as you want!And this won’t change! Even being a
great success, Duik won’t be sold. Let’s share techniques and
knowledge!
It has been developped by NicolasDufresne, a French director and animator who needed those tools
and decided to share them freely once developped.
Duik is in its 14th version, which was released a year ago.
Duik brings the easy Inverse Kinematics (IK) to After
Effects.IK is about being able to rig and animate a character
a lot more naturally.For example let's say you had to animate
an arm sway. Normally in After Effects you would separate the arm
into bones (arm, forearm and hand). Once you had parented all the
bones you would then have to animate each part separately - that's
what is called Forward Kinematics (FK). But, whatever
you keyed on the shoulder (rotation, scale or position), would have
an effect on the forearm and hand (rotation, scale, position). It was
always a balancing act. At the end of animating an arm, you would end
up with a mass of key frames, each individually affecting the limbs
(bones). This would make tweaking and adjusting the animation a
bleedin’ nightmare.With IK you have one controller.
Through the arm you place bones which, like before, you create a
parenting system (Hand to forearm, forearm to arm). You then hit this
magic button which creates a fully possible arm. The unique thing
about this, is you only animate the controller. This means less key
frames and less fuss. Unlike before you can now tweak and reanimate
with ease.
This tool is essential in many cases – to animate a character,
especially for a walk, a run
column2: to animate mechanical processes of any

column1: kind, etc. – inverse kinematics implied the use of very complex
trigonometrical expressions in After Effects (see DanEbberts‘s expressions).Duik automates this creation process
to allow the animator to focus on the animation! A simple controller
at the end of an arm, of a leg, or on the shoulders, an IK that was
created in one clic, now one can animate the entire limb just
by modifying the position of the hand or the foot!
Bones are layers which replace puppet pins
in After Effects. Created in a single click, they can be parented and
be controlled by IK’s. One can reproduce the exact same methods
like for the rigging of characters in 3D, but in After Effects. The
puppet acts like skinning, and Duik fills out the setup!
Most of the characters are alike… Arms, Legs, Head… To avoid
repeating the same work again and again, Duik’s
Autorig can automatically rig a biped character!
You only have to move the anchor points to the appropriate joints (or
create bones if you use a puppet) and the Autorig does the
job: controllers, parenting, IK’s, expressions…And because
anyone is unique, the Autorig
adapts to your character: wether it has only one arm, or
it’s legs don’t have knees, it doesn’t matter, the rig is
automaticaly adapted.
When a limb bends, you may have to draw folds on the cloth, or a
muscle flex, or to adjust the shape of the elbow… Rotation
Morph was made to easily control how a property changes
(shape, time remap…) when a reference layer rotates.A new
tutorial will be made very soon to show you how to use this powerful
tool.
It’s one thing to have well rigged characters, now you have to
animate them easily! Duik brings all kinds of animation
controllers, from the powerful Spring, which
automates delays and bounces of an object, to the Wheel,
which automates the rotation of the layer while it translates.Among
those tools, now you can copy/paste an animation
from several layers at once very easily, into the same composition to
repeat the animation, or from a composition to another to reuse
it.There is also a very simple interface to manage
interpolations to animate very easily without manipulating
curves.
• New IK for 3+1 LayerUntil now, an IK could only be created on two layers (for
example, the upper arm and the forearm, or the thigh and the calf),
with a possibility to add a Goal to the limb (the last part :
the hand or the foot).There will now be a way to create an IK
on three layers, while keeping the possibility to add a goal to
the limb. This can be very useful to human limbs: adding an extra
layer in the elbows or the knees can help a better bending. And
obviously, this can enable more animal or mechanic rigs.• A better AutorigThe autorig will be able to rig more complex legs, including feet
and toes joints, for more natural and realistic movements of the
feet.The torso, neck and head will have a better rigging,
easier to animate.There will be more options to make the
autorig more versatile, being able not only to rig bipeds but animals
and quadrupeds too.• New animation tools• List controller, to be able to mix different
animations and expressions on one property.
• Move Away tool which can move away a layer from
another.
• Animate Paint, to easily animate paint strokes
made in After Effects.
• Blink, to easily create a blinking property.
• Randomizer, to randomize transformations, in
points and out points of layers.
• 2D Camera, to create controllers to
automatically move backgrounds and overlays, faking a camera without
the need of 3D Layers.
• Translation tool
A very simple app will be available to enable users to add or
update their own translations of Duik, in any language. Those
translations could then be included in future updates of Duik!
• Easier to use
Some enhancements to the interface, and including help inside Duik
will make it even easier to use, and easier to understand each tool.• A complete documentation & tutorials
Why release a powerful tool if people do not know how to use it?
Duik 15 will be released with a full user reference, and tutorials

Duik is a very useful tool for After Effects, and we think it
should be available for everyone. Thus, Duik is a free
software and it will not ever be sold, for any price, to anyone. It
is and should always be free - see the Free Software Foundation for a complete explanation of what it means
being a free software - Duik is released under the GNU-GPL v3, its source code is available on Github.
But developping this kind of tool, supporting it, making
tutorials, maintaining the website take a lot of time, and cost
money, which must be found, one way or another.
Crowdfunding now seems the best way to continue the quick
development of Duik while keeping it free for everyone.
While donations are like paying for an existing tool,
crowdfunding is bringing together a lot of enthusiast users to bring
Duik to its next level, while keeping it free.

Duik 15 Release (development of new tools, updating the

One tutorial for each feature of Duik (some are already

Training)• 4% (186 €) go to Indiegogo

If more than 5000 € are raised, some of these could be done:• More tutorials about advanced techniques (how to rig a foot with toes, how to rig digitigrades...)• More translations of Duik (German, Spanish...)• English dubbing of the tutorials• Writing a developper reference• Creating a library to make it easy to use Duik in other scripts...

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Live the Fresh Life!

If you love the idea, please think about donating a dollar.  $1 donations add up very quickly...  With your help, a lease will be signed for the expansion of Fresh in Jacksonville, Florida later this year.  This expansion will bring not only healthy, organic, and delicious foods, but also the entire lineup of Fresh Fitness activities to the community - all within a fun and relaxed atmosphere.  Fresh is a one stop shop for health and wellness.

If you don't live near Jacksonville, we have you covered!  We sell all of our shelf stable products online and ship them directly to you.  With our expansion, we will also add many more products for sale online!  All of them are plant-based, organic, healthy, and delicious!
<div>
Enjoy Fresh for Yourself!

$30 Reward - Our limited edition ""Kickin' Hot Sauce"" is only available through this campaign, and it's one of our best sauces yet! Hillary's relaxing yoga session will be emailed for your enjoyment. The Fresh pedometer is a great way to measure your daily activity, to find ways to set your own records by staying in shape. Our famous Smokey Southwest Seasoning is the best ""go-to"" spice for anything on the grill, including corn on the cob and zucchini!

$60 Reward - Everything from the $30 reward, plus more! Choose your t-shirt design and size. Try all of our gourmet spice blends in sampler packs. Amaze yourself with how many things you wind up adding Chipotle Mustard to because of the great flavor and mild sweetness from agave nectar.

$100 Reward - Everything from the $60 reward, plus more! Choose your spice level (Mild through XXX Hot) for a bottle of each of the original Fresh sauces - Tropical Heat, Black Bean, Spiced Apple. Treat yourself right with a case of Fresh Chocolate Maca Energy Bars, which are perfect as a snack or before/after the gym!

Our goal to raise $10,000 from this campaign will buy a new commercial oven for the Fresh expansion.  If donors like you are gracious enough to exceed our goal, this will help to buy commercial grade blenders, dehydrators, food processors, and mixers.  Your help will go a long way to helping people live a happier healthier lifestyle.
<div>
A Fresh Start

Fresh grew from our love for each other and our passion for healthy living.  To share our passion for healthy food with our family and friends, we bottled Jason's pineapple hot sauce to share with everyone at our wedding.  With overwhelming support from all who received a bottle that day, we decided to officially start Fresh.

In 2011, Fresh rented space in a commercial kitchen (commissary) in downtown Jacksonville.  Partnering with a local print shop and other local vendors, Fresh has focused on suppporting local businesses from the start.

In 2012, Riverside Arts Market (every Saturday in downtown Jacksonville) became the central hub for sharing Fresh with the community.  Their love of Fresh shaped the expansion of the Fresh line to include mustards, trail mixes, gourmet spice blends, breads, and gluten free cookies.

In 2013, as more people discover Fresh, new products are continually brought to life.  Through continued involvement with the Riverside Arts Market and other local events, the community's love of Fresh cannot be contained within just one day per week.  Fresh needs to expand!  Fresh won 8th place overall in the inaugural One Spark crowdfunding event, beating out 450 other start-up businesses as the crowd favorite.  By the end of the year, armed with our recently earned MBAs from University of North Florida, Fresh will expand to a new commercial location to help the community live The Fresh Life!
<div>
A Fresh Future

With a refreshing take on fitness, the Fresh Fitness studio will freature a relaxed atmosphere for yoga, group fitness classes, and personal training.  Fresh Fitness is for everyone from couch potatoes to athletes.  The studio will feature tranquil yoga, high intensity interval training, beginner circuit training, and other classes with a focus on individual goals.  Fresh Fitness together with Fresh Foods creates a place to nurture your healthy lifestyle.

Whether it's a quick lunch for you, dinner for the entire family, or a full week's worth of meals to fill your fridge, Fresh has you covered.  Our healthy prepared meals to-go are ready and waiting for you, because we know your time is very valuable.  Fresh is your healthy fast-food resource for people on the go.  Featuring eco-friendly packaging options, you can feel good about the choices you make at Fresh.

On the weekends, tables and chairs will fill the studio and the farm-to-table dinner party will begin.  With an ever-changing seasonally inspired menu featuring the freshest local produce, Fresh is the place to be.  Celebrate the Fresh lifestyle with three or more courses including delectable desserts and a selection of organic beer &

While we specialize in healthy delicious foods, we also pride ourselves in offering allergy-free foods.  In order to help support your healthier lifestyle, our entire facility will always be free from dairy, eggs, and peanuts.  We will also offer many gluten-free products, created in a separate preparation area and dedicated gluten-free oven.

Live The Fresh Life and make a difference in your life and the lives of others.  At Fresh, we understand the importance of sharing our good fortune with others.  We have always, and will always donate a portion of our porfits to causes that are close to our heart.
Final Comments

Just adding some tag lines here to make our campaign easier to find...  plant-based, vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, healthy, local, delicious, fitness, yoga, kripalu, circuit training, personal training, high intensity circuit training, crossfit, zumba, low glycemic, sugar-free, One Spark, JAX, Jacksonville, Florida, Made in USA, charity donations, animal rescue efforts, CJ Acres Animal Rescue, UNF, University of North Florida, Ospreys, MBA, diet &
column2: exercise, PCRM, Repole, and of course - FUN!

Just adding some tag lines here to make our campaign easier to find...  plant-based, vegetarian, vegan, gluten-free, healthy, local, delicious, fitness, yoga, kripalu, circuit training, personal training, high intensity circuit training, crossfit, zumba, low glycemic, sugar-free, One Spark, JAX, Jacksonville, Florida, Made in USA, charity donations, animal rescue efforts, CJ Acres Animal Rescue, UNF, University of North Florida, Ospreys, MBA, diet & exercise, PCRM, Repole, and of course - FUN!",6.0,0,"1 Campaign

Hello,

My name is Vonabell Hurst and I am a recently married 20 year old woman with an unknown sickness over taking my body. About 2 months ago, I began fainting without cause. Along with these spells, I began throwing up, feeling dizzy, couldn't stand for long with weakness in legs, seizing during and after, slowness of speech, and memory loss. Just yesterday, I fainted 6 times in a row and when I woke up, had no idea where I was and barely recognized my own husband. I didn't know my apartment or even my pets. For 30 minutes, I struggled to remember who I was and what made up ""me."" I have been to the hospital 5 times - 4 times being in the emergency room and 1 time admitted. I've been to multiple doctor's visits including GP, cardiologist, and neurologist. I have even spent my first time in an ambulance this past December. I have more doctor's visits in my future, and frankly, I am terrified. During these episodes, I have stopped breathing and have needed CPR to start again. With all of this stress, confusion, and sadness came another factor - finances. The ambulance ride, hospital visits, and doctor's visit bills have all started pouring in with no indication of stopping soon. At this point in time, my new husband, Jesse, and I need help. We are asking for all those who love us, or even don't, to please consider aiding us in our time of need. We have 4 animals, rent to pay, and cannot do this on our own. We thank you and appreciate your support in helping us find a cure for me, and also for helping us when I needed oxygen, medicine, and to live. In return, we promise to keep you updated with my status and let you know what we discover - together. Thank you again for your help and may you be blessed for it!

Jan 2013 Lisa Mawdsley, a wonderful mother, wife and great friend to so many announced they were expecting their second child. The next few months were extremely exciting for their young family looking forward to finding out the sex of the baby. When they went in for the ultrasound at 20 weeks their excitement quickly turned to fear as they learned that their baby girl had a tumor on her spine that would make this a very risky pregnancy.  Over the course of the next 4 months Lisa had to be closely monitored by specialists while still caring for her young daughter Alyssa. Bailey Elizabeth was born on July 5th which involved an extremely complex c-section in order to not disrupt the tumor which weighed in at one pound. The very next morning Bailey endured a four hour surgery to remove the large tumor and a portion of her tailbone. She was living off of a breathing tube and feeding tube until she was able to learn to breath and eat on her own. Lisa and her husband Tim spent their 13th wedding anniversary in the hospital and got the gift of seeing her first smile that day but were still not able to hold their new daughter. Bailey was 5 days old before she felt the warmth and comfort of her mom and dad holding her. They were finally released to take her home on July 16th where mom and baby are still recovering.

Lisa was the definition of strength and positivity during one of the scariest things she will ever experience.  Most get to take their baby home and enjoy watching them grow with few worries while Lisa is just thankful that her baby survived. She came home to medical bills that are piling up from the specialists and Bailey’s surgery and extended hospital stay.

I know word can spread like fire on Facebook so let’s get it out there! Even 5,000 people contributing $1.00 can help us reach our goal of $5,000 in 30 days. If you can't contribute you can still be a huge help by spreading the word by simply clicking the link above.

Please know that all funds will go to Lisa and her family to help cover medical bills and expenses for Bailey. Lisa has been limited to working part time as she was being closely monitored by specialists in Iowa City, two hours from home, for months and is now recovering with complications from the C-Section. Even the smallest contribution will go a long way and would mean so much to the Mawdsley family.

Tools for Success

Five essential training accessories rolled into one portable piece of equipment. Everything you need for a full body workout at home or on-the-go. The add-on tools below can be used together or separately:
<ul>
• Training mat
• Weighted Body Bar
• Massage Roller
• Resistance Bands
• Weighted Handles
Convenience

After being originally developed for Janie after having our baby, we quickly found that Yoga Flexer was the solution for many busy lifestyles. Whether it's work, travel, school or an injury. Known to be a functional tool for travel and packing into small spaces but many use it as their main workout resource at home. Replicating dozens of exercises you would see at the gym or studio.
Versatility
What's our favorite part? Perfect for any age or skill level. Yoga Flexer can be paired with many different training methods such as:
<ul>
• Pilates
• HIIT (high-intensity interval training)
• Barre
• Sandbag Style
• Cardio and Strength
• Physical Therapy
Handle Connection With Weights

Connect the handles to replicate dumbbell like motions. Add 2lb weights in each handle to increase intensity during resistance training. The weights can be easily removed to fit your skill level. Our custom mat has two foot holes built in for support. The body bar can be used on its own or combined with our weighted handles. The durable zipper attachment holds the mat and body bar together.
Resistance Band Training

Resistance training improves muscle strength and tones your body. Improving mobility, flexibility and your health. Various workouts may require connecting two of our bands for more reach and less resistance. Running the bands through our roller tube mimics a door anchor.
New Mobile Accountability App
-Instructor Scheduling
-Beginner to Expert Guides
-Training Videos
-Progress Tracker and Reports
RESULTS YOU SHOULD EXPECT
Crafted for portability, while improving your flexibility and stability.
Yoga Flexer has shown to assist in your core strength, posture, concentration, body awareness, balance, muscular control and so much more!
<div>
OUR STORY

Over the past couple of years, a lot has changed in our lives. We went from being in college, working out every day, to not working out at all. After having our son, working out was just an afterthought for the two of us. It was difficult to find a balance between work, graduate school, traveling to see family and finding energy.

Janie, was a Division I track athlete at Northern Iowa. On top of that, she was finishing her graduate degree in Speech-Language Pathology. The adjustment to parenting impacted her the most, as leaving our little one to workout at the gym was not going to make it on her to-do list. That’s when we began developing the Yoga Flexer System! -- Anthony and Janie Kokakis
<h3>Risks &amp
Inevitably, there will be bumps in the road but through hard work, preparation, and supportive backers, like you, this product will be delivered as promised.

We already have the tooling and molding purchased. That will save us a ton of time, compared to the last production run. We learned some valuable lessons about logistics, that's for sure. This is our biggest hurdle and we look to improve that aspect dramatically with the experience gained from our 1.0 campaign. Your Yoga Flexer 2.0 will come with more Velcro security, handle lock improvements and a better travel strap.

In the event that something slows down the process, we promise to always stay in touch. We will respond to everyone that may have questions regarding the Yoga Flexer. Without your support, it would be SO much more challenging getting back into production. -- Anthony and Janie
Other Ways You Can Help
We will understand if you can't contribute right now, but you can still help us tremendously:
• Check out the Indiegogo share tools at the top, let your friends know about us!
